story:
I have been gaming my whole life. It has raised me from the pits of despair and into the joy of community. Being homeschooled I spent a lot of time completing quests and defeating army hoards of alien races with some of my best friends in the world. It is what kept me going as an adolescent. Now, well into adulthood, I still find much solace in turning on my pc and starting up a game of Prop Hunt on Gary's Mod with my server, or sprinting through tombs in the rain forrest in the newly adapted Tomb Raider.

My trusted ROG Asus G60vx has finally passed. It's been a good several years and I know you really put up with a lot. May she rest in peace. I will avenge her death by creating my first custom build PC. This is something I've always wanted to do and now I really have no choice. Help me keep the dream alive.

For those being redirected from the old crowdfund I updated the amount due to indiegogo not having restrictions on meeting my goal. The computer will cost at least 1200 total.

story:
My dear friends,

We got an idea, that we believe will change the world of Tv media. 

An application that enables you to watch live and on-demand video services on your phone, tablet, pc device. 

Today in the world of Apps the media category has more than 15 million users worldwide. We believe that TV online has that potential and far greater than that. 


Tv Online Features:

A wide selection of public TV channels

Quick channel preview

Integrated TV guide

Fast channels launch and switching

Video-on-demand

Onscreen controls

High Quality streams

Channel Store with Categories

Search by keyword

Please note that Tv Online content is offered for free. 


All of you, my dear friends, can help us make something different, better, enjoyable. With every contribution you will become a part of this beautiful newborn, that we want to watch grow, develop and succeed in every possible way.

About me:

I am an application developer that has been doing it in the last few years. My specialty is in the media category. Curently I run a few different apps, which are all seccesseful and some of them are top rated in the media category. 


Thank you so much in advance for all of your help!

story:
Done! This is the first model of Phonedock.


What is this project about?

„Personal Computer, DVD Player, music system, game console… all this gets possible with Phonedock!“

A young student made a mini-PC that fits in anyone’s pocket possible with „Phonedock“. The idea is to connect a smartphone with a dockingstation to get a complete personal computer. This dockingstation called Phonedock can also be connected to a monitor to maximize the ease of use. Today the technical requirements of modern smartphones can replace notebooks or desktop computers. Moreover, the graphic performance of a modern smartphone is equal to your console in the living room. If your hardware is not sufficient, no problem! Phonedock allows you to increase the performance. With Phonedock you have all your music, movies, games and documents with you every time. Dock and get started.

Using a HDMI cable, the signal of your smartphone is transmitted to a monitor or tv screen. You can connect a mouse, keyboard or controller by using the bluetooth function. Phonedock gives you the necessary stability, even if you only want to watch movies or surf on the internet. While your smartphone is docked the battery gets charged and the device gets cooled down: the cooling fan guarantees an underrating performance.


Advantages of Phonedock

-  Easy connectivity to monitor, tv screen or music system via HDMI

-  Active cooling by an cooling fan to avoid the usual CPU- limitation

-  Representation in widescreen which is more comfortable for the human viewing habits than the visual field of a conventional dockingstation.

-  Phonedock uses high quality materials

-  Unique design

-  USB ports

-  Full operation system

-  Mobility

-  Allows to save money

-  Avoids electronic trash thanks to an all-in-one device


What are the goals?

The target is to create a first class dockingstation for smartphones to unite the functionality of laptops, consoles, or DVD players in one device. I would not stop by creating a prototype; I would like to make it a long term occupation, to develop and upgrade Phonedock. Direct target group are persons who possess a smartphone with a dual or quadcore processor, 1 GB RAM and 8 GB internal storage. The situation up to now is that costumers have to buy one computer for their homes and another one for their pockets. This creates a lot of electro trash, redundancy and waste of money. Phonedock is the solution and allows you to use your smartphone like a PC. Sometimes things are stronger than they are big.


Why support this project?

Only a sufficient start capital and a small ensured purchase volume are an insurance to create and upgrade this product. It would be nice if a small start-up company from South Tyrol contributed to change and enrich the world revolving around android, smartphones & Co. with an innovative project. I would like to give customers the chance to get the maximum out of their smartphone.


What happens with the money?

Most of all will the money be needed to finance the development and the production of a Phonedock prototype. To launch a company, a lot of money is needed which I won’t be able to shoulder all by myself. If the funding is successful, the first prototype of Phonedock will be completed in 12 weeks. However, I won’t spare any effort to undercut this target

Who stands behind Phonedock?

Behind Phonedock stands the student Raffael Pace, a multimedia designer who is interested in painting, design, art and perpetually fascinated by new technology. The Phonedock-development from its first idea to an efficient prototype will cause not only many of sleepless nights and an empty pocket, it will be also a motley roller coaster ride with its ups and downs.

Why do we need you?

I am a student who works tirelessly to bring Phonedock to the market. I have a good idea, lots of endurance and motivation. Now I need you. Help me support this project and find a skilled team. I need your help to find new partners and to show the world what a new and revolutionary product Phonedock is.

Money isn’t all I need. Share the video to draw the attention to my idea of as many people as possible. Every vote, every click, and every help counts!

Finally, I would like to remind each of you that limits only exist in our minds.

story:
Please check out the updates on our website: http://www.elecfreaks.com/estore/ 

The Freaks3D printer is still available to purchase at http://elecfreaks.com/freaks3D

For any discussion about the Freaks3D please move to http://www.elecfreaks.com/forum/

 

 

 

Take it wherever you want. The Freaks3D weighs 2.945kg and battery compatible. It is completely portable. Small enough to blend in with any table but large enough to unleash your creativity.

Less is more. Simplified extruded-aluminum beams to ensure sturdy and high-quality performance. The Freaks3D employs v-slot slider system to provide precise seamless positioning.

Quality prints on your desktop. Detailed layer resolution at fast speed. All-metal nozzle head allows PLA/TPU filaments of a rainbow of colors without easy breaks or damage.  No pre-heating is needed. Simply feed the filament into the entrance path and the printer will do the rest.  

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Nearly the same scale and lightweight as you laptop, it fits comfortably on any table whether you are in office, at home, coffee shop, school, etc.. The Freas3D is even quiet enough to print in a library. Unleash your innovation with an easy carry-around 3D printer like never before.

 

 

 

SD card print

Print via USB or SD card. When using a USB cable, you connect Freaks3D to your computer. With 3D software on the computer, you just plug in the filament, check the settings and print.

Or you upload a file to the SD card and tell it to print from the SD card.

 

 

 

 

 

Various materials and a rainbow of colors

 

 

Freaks3D can print PLA, TPU (Thermoplastic Polyurethanes). Bring your ideas into life without constraints on filaments/colors.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Simple, safe mechanical construction

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 
 

Full LCD display

Operate Freaks3D with ease visual and interactive LCD display. It is intuitive to monitor the system configuration while printing.

 

 

Easy setup

Can Freaks3D be assembled and printing in a couple of hours? Definitely. We provide patient and detailed setup instructions for you, normally the construction should take 2 hours or so. No soldering is required.

 

Consistency guaranteed with 10-hour aging before shipment

Every Freaks3D will go through 10 hours aging before shipment to guarantee machine consistency and continuous high mechanical endurance.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Despite of all levels printers out there, we believe Freaks3D can bring the technology to everybody’s hands, ranging from hackers/makers like us, engineers, artists, architects, to housewives, teachers and children. And what can it print? Almost everything you can imagine. Tools, models, toys, decors, prototypes, jewels, smartphone case, household utensils, replacement parts, robotic cars, drones…. Even, it prints much finer results than we think.

 

 

Why not contribute for an already-existing product rather than something conceptual? We’re so prepared to rocket manufacturing and can’t help to ship the Freaks3D to you once the Indiegogo campaign closes. 

 

 

Freaks3D Assembly

Freaks3D Accuracy

 

 

 

 

 

 
 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

The current status for Freaks3D is: all R&D work has been finished for the final prototype. We now jump from concept to manufacture. We present it on Indiegogo campaign because we want you to help us ramp up production and bring Freaks3D into homes, maker faires, maker spaces, labs and classes.

We believe it is the most accessible 3D printer (great and affordable price), reliable (high layer resolution) and small enough to be carried everywhere.

 

 

 

 

 

We are ElecFreaks, a team that loves to build things with our hands. Making, hacking or whatever you call it - this is our passion.

We are having a lot of fun working on Freaks3D and we will also share with you what we have learned all the way along the development on 3D printers through Reprap, Makerbot, acrylic frame, lasercut body, 3D software design, etc..

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Great news, 3D print enthusiasts!!

From RIGHT NOW through August 15, ElecFreaks is offering FREE PRINT SERVICES for everyone around the globe. 

 

 

How it works: 

1. Help get the words out by sharing the "free 3D print program" to 3D enthusiasts around you VIA twitter or facebook WITH the link: http://igg.me/at/freaks3d, and AT @elecfreaks. 

2. Send your 3D print models to project@elecfreaks.com, with a snapshot of the tweet or facebook msg  you sent out in Step 1. 

Remember send us your shipping address, contact number included. 

If you're already one of our Freaks3D Indiegogo backers, only tell us your pledge ID, according to the pledge ID, we can find your shipping address and ship the 3D print together with your Freaks3D. 

Please note that the model dimensions do not exceed 5cm X 5cm. 

3. ElecFreaks start printing your 3D model and send package into your hands. The 3D printing takes some time, thus we will start from the earliest submitter who has finished Step 1 AND 2. 

We are feeling excited and welcome you to interact us as part of our Freaks3D community: https://www.facebook.com/groups/freaks3d/ 

So now's your chance to finally get 3D print experience, henceforward, you can invent 3D printing.

 

 

 

 

Q & A

1. August 2015 is shipping date, is that correct?

Yes, as Freaks3D is a finalised product which is fully prepared for shipping, August 2015 is exactly the shipping date. ElecFreaks will start the production line soon after the Indiegogo campaign goes live, so expectantly the first batch will be delivered soon after 15, August. 

2. How do you do aging for the Freaks3D kits? 

It is necessary to let you know we cannot do aging for the kit form. 

However for the assembled machine, firstly after it's assembled, we will start multiple actual module print tests. When ensure this runs smoothly without any error, we will have the Freaks3D print a personalized handle and include it in the package for every backer! 

Handles of various of shapes will be shipped at random for our supporters. All the 3D files of handles will be stored in the SD card, so you can feel free to print any one you want. 

3. What is the material used for printing, is it readily available and what is the cost? 

Supported print material on the Freaks3D 3D printer: PLA, TPU. 

Every Freaks3D assembled perk goes with one PLA filament peel, while the kit perk level does not include filaments. The filament spools will be available to purchase on http://www.elecfreaks/estore in a couple of days. 

Please stay tuned on the Indiegogo updates, we'll keep everybody informed!

4. What software is required to design an object to print? Where can I download it? 

Software: Cura, Repetier Host 

You can download them from 
Cura – https://ultimaker.com/en/products/cura-software 
Repetier Host – http://www.repetier.com/download/

story:
Above: A quick sketch to show the general idea!

News:

The X, Y and Z table movements have been completed. Just need to get some springs from the hardware store and it'll be done! Oh, and replace the yardstick with small aluminum channel.

Above: Before. Below: After.





See updates for details!



Short Summary

I want to design an amazingly easy to build and robust open source 3D printer framework!

  • My name is Jesse Gordon and I'm an electronics design engineer, network engineer, and hobby machinist and I like to tinker with robots.
  • I want to design and build an open source 3D printer framework using V-Slot extruded rails and rollers - a design that is easy to build with minimal tools and is easy to set up and use.
  • With your generous and gracious help, I am confident that, Lord willing, I will be able to  create a robust and easily constructed and adjusted XYZ motion system suitable for 3D printing and all sorts of other fun.

I have worked some with the V-Slot aluminum extrusions and rollers and really like them so far. I have worked out much of the plans already for a system that is easy to construct and easy to adjust.

So many 3D printer systems are very fragile and require special techniques to adjust and require constant adjustment.

In contrast, I'm designing a system which will be easy to assemble and require no adjustments to keep it moving smoothly other than replacing parts when they finally wear out since everything wears out eventually.

I know of course that there is no free lunch - somebody has to pay - and when I tell you that the machine will be easy to build and use, you are quite right to ask "What's the catch? Why don't other 3D printer makers do it?" Here's the answer: My design is a little more bulky. It's height and depth are twice it's working area. So, if you have a 12x12x12 inch working area, it will be a bit over 24 inches tall and 24 inches deep (front to back) and a bit over 12 inches wide. I can trade off Cute and get Robust and Simple.

Once I've built some prototypes and worked out the wrinkles, anybody with access to a drill motor (Drill press preferred but not required) should be able to build one entirely from pre-cut aluminum extrusions and precut aluminum plates which can be ordered from places like onlinemetals.com -- and all for just $200 to $300 (not including control electronics or hot end plastic printing head.)

(Of course these prices are estimated. I won't know the exact materials cost until I'm done!)


What We Need & What You Get

Funding need details:

  • I need your kind and generous funding to buy aluminum extrusions, rollers, hardware. In the end, I believe each kit will contain between $200 to $300 of materials but because I haven't built a kit yet I am estimating $700 per kit in case I build one version and find a better way to do it and have to re-do it! I don't want anything to get in the way of me delivering a great kit!
  • I have created all sorts of cool perks all the way from emailed plans to a full kit of everything you need!
  • I'm hoping that I'll get funded enough to build at least one kit which will allow me to finish the design and test it. Then I'll have plans and can fulfill all other perks! Even if I don't get funded enough to build a kit I'll still find some way to build and test the plans, then I can fulfill all the perks for plans.
  • The system I have in mind is just the XYZ motion assembly. It does not include extrusion hot ends or motor drivers or electronics. It may include motor mount but because of the V-Slot extrusion you will be able to easily attach your own motor mounts for whatever motors you want.
  • The dimensions of this system will be roughly half a meter wide, one meter tall, and one meter deep (front to back.) This will allow me to use pre-cut 1-meter lengths of extrusion without me or you having to cut them to another length.
  • The working area is to be about 0.5 x 0.5 x 0.5 meters, roughly.
  • The video mentioned in the perks will show how to assemble all the pieces.
  • The parts list will show what to get from where.

The Impact

I believe this design will open up a whole new way of thinking when it comes to 3D printers!

This one really will be designed to be built at home with minimal tools!

    Risks & Challenges

    There is of course the risk that I find after building it that I can't make it work. However I do not think this is a likely risk. I have worked already some with the V-Slot rollers and spent some time figuring up how it would all go together.

    I really believe it will work out beautifully!

    One of the biggest challenges I foresee is just time. Because I work full time this is a nights/weekends project, so it will move slowly but I will post pictures and video updates of the progress so everybody can see how it is coming along.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Know somebody who's interested in 3D printing? Pass this on to them!

    Notes:

    The reason I'm not showing any social media connections is because I don't have accounts on any of them!

    ALSO: I only ship packages to USA addresses. However I can email anywhere in the world!

 I want to design and build an open source 3D printer framework using V-Slot extruded rails and rollers - a design that is easy to build with minimal tools and is easy to set up and use.

With your generous and gracious help, I am confident that, Lord willing, I will be able to  create a robust and easily constructed and adjusted XYZ motion system suitable for 3D printing and all sorts of other fun.
 
I have worked some with the V-Slot aluminum extrusions and rollers and really like them so far. I have worked out much of the plans already for a system that is easy to construct and easy to adjust. 
So many 3D printer systems are very fragile and require special techniques to adjust and require constant adjustment.
In contrast, I'm designing a system which will be easy to assemble and require no adjustments to keep it moving smoothly other than replacing parts when they finally wear out since everything wears out eventually.
I know of course that there is no free lunch - somebody has to pay - and when I tell you that the machine will be easy to build and use, you are quite right to ask "What's the catch? Why don't other 3D printer makers do it?" Here's the answer: My design is a little more bulky. It's height and depth are twice it's working area. So, if you have a 12x12x12 inch working area, it will be a bit over 24 inches tall and 24 inches deep (front to back) and a bit over 12 inches wide. I can trade off Cute and get Robust and Simple.
Once I've built some prototypes and worked out the wrinkles, anybody with access to a drill motor (Drill press preferred but not required) should be able to build one entirely from pre-cut aluminum extrusions and precut aluminum plates which can be ordered from places like onlinemetals.com -- and all for just $200 to $300 (not including control electronics or hot end plastic printing head.)
(Of course these prices are estimated. I won't know the exact materials cost until I'm done!)

  What We Need & What You Get Funding need details: 
I need your kind and generous funding to buy aluminum extrusions, rollers, hardware. In the end, I believe each kit will contain between $200 to $300 of materials but because I haven't built a kit yet I am estimating $700 per kit in case I build one version and find a better way to do it and have to re-do it! I don't want anything to get in the way of me delivering a great kit!
 I have created all sorts of cool perks all the way from emailed plans to a full kit of everything you need!
 I'm hoping that I'll get funded enough to build at least one kit which will allow me to finish the design and test it. Then I'll have plans and can fulfill all other perks! Even if I don't get funded enough to build a kit I'll still find some way to build and test the plans, then I can fulfill all the perks for plans.
The system I have in mind is just the XYZ motion assembly. It does not include extrusion hot ends or motor drivers or electronics. It may include motor mount but because of the V-Slot extrusion you will be able to easily attach your own motor mounts for whatever motors you want.
The dimensions of this system will be roughly half a meter wide, one meter tall, and one meter deep (front to back.) This will allow me to use pre-cut 1-meter lengths of extrusion without me or you having to cut them to another length.
The working area is to be about 0.5 x 0.5 x 0.5 meters, roughly.
The video mentioned in the perks will show how to assemble all the pieces.
The parts list will show what to get from where.
 
  The ImpactI believe this design will open up a whole new way of thinking when it comes to 3D printers!This one really will be designed to be built at home with minimal tools!
  Risks & ChallengesThere is of course the risk that I find after building it that I can't make it work. However I do not think this is a likely risk. I have worked already some with the V-Slot rollers and spent some time figuring up how it would all go together.I really believe it will work out beautifully!One of the biggest challenges I foresee is just time. Because I work full time this is a nights/weekends project, so it will move slowly but I will post pictures and video updates of the progress so everybody can see how it is coming along.
  Other Ways You Can Help
Know somebody who's interested in 3D printing? Pass this on to them!Notes:The reason I'm not showing any social media connections is because I don't have accounts on any of them!ALSO: I only ship packages to USA addresses. However I can email anywhere in the world!

story:
GestureKit: A new SDK that makes ‘gestures’ super easy to implement on any mobile-web interface app .

 

               

We are team based in San Francisco, Buenos Aires and Rumania of gesture experts who have created the world’s first easy-to-use cross-platform tool for gesture-driven apps. 


gestureKit simplifies the  integration and implementation of custom gestures by a unique draw, generate and use process.  No messing with your developing process like some of those fiddly gesture tools out there, we have taken the pain out of that.


          


So what exactly is gestureKit?


We have developed a non-intrusive, transparent overlay that allows you - developer or designer - to assign gesture commands to any app. You can run gestureKit smoothly on top of all the native and interactive elements of your apps without any fuss. The Indiegogo campaign will help us to move from touch to gesture sensors plus reach new markets, more of that detail to follow…

       


Topline, here are the gestureKit features:


  • Manage gestures on the cloud 

  • Reduces development time and costs - one line of code 

  • Easy to integrate 

  • Complementary dashboard and analytics

  • Great tool for wearable 


Easy implementation, and process to follow


Any app creator knows that integrating gesture control for applications across multiple platforms is a very tedious process. With gestureKit, you can now easily do this without the pain of re-programming from scratch on every platform. 

Here is the process:

  1. Subscribe or login with Github.
  2. Create the application and gestureset at the DashBoard (see Getting Started Guide).
  3. Draw the gestures online or at the gestureKit recorder app.
  4. Implement the gestureset on your code.


For our fellow geeks, here is the code:


Could we make it any easier for you? Follow the steps above without even coding and boom! You have yourself human-to-computer functionality : )

For a better recording experience, we have developer the GestureKit Recorded application for Android.

              

 See the results online at your Dashboard!          

             

               


Oh, did you remember? We’re cross platform : ) 


Check out our GKPlayer demos for iOS, Android and Web platforms. 



Easy to manage

We offer a easy-to-use dashboard to create, edit and store unique gestures in the cloud, as well as to view metrics of gesture activity conducted by end-users.




Our gesture vision


We have finished a big chunk of our research work and development and  have gestureKit up and running with the online editor, plugins for iOS, Android and Web, and we have created a demo application to showcase our technology. We have built our web platform and we continue improving it every day. We are in the process of building our very  gesture ecosystem.


Where will your money go?


For the end user, we aim to create an end user gesture customization service based on gestureKit, online customization and cloud gestures called DrawAction. Available for developers as an extended feature and for end users as input types, DarwAction is the visible face of gestureKit and the way to interact directly with end users. 


                       


For developers, creating closed thematic kits (Developer Kits), enhancing and consolidating the API, creating a storage and distribution standard based on gesturesets that apply to specific application views, adding more clients like LeapMotion, W8 and Unity, creating new particles for visual representation and providing new features to the the recognition engine like runtime recognition. Also integrate new gestures technologies like touch-less sensed gestures, air-gestures and 3D gestures as part of the roadmap.


With your support we plan to move our product into an amazing selection of markets.  We have developed use cases that are ready to be developed, but we lack the economic resources to make them happen. Your contributions will free-up the use gesture features in the markets we plan to reach. 



Lastly, consolidate the human machinery in order to comply with all these tasks in time.

Why crowdfunding?

Because we believe that much remains to be done in terms of gesture technology and we have the idea of ​​encouraging interaction activities in a community that has a space in our platform and Open Source content to develop new ideas. 

We are asking for help to make gestures as a service that can provide social support for people with disabilities, health problems or communication to which institutions have convened with which we will face joint projects. 


Which industries can benefit from gestureKit technology?

The potential of gestureKit to make a remarkable impact in many industries such as healthcare, automotive, original equipment manufacturer, game and entertainment systems, personal productivity, wearable technology and security.


                    
For example Jasmine Dumas is a Medical Device Engineer with a BSE in Biomedical Engineering and is working with us on gestureCare Lab with the idea of developing a sample 'Pain Management App' that incorporates an initial user prompt once an hour to quantify their current pain experience to promote communication and adherence to physician prescribed treatment and personal journaling of illnesses. Your contribution could help shape this development in medical industry.


Your contributions will also encourage activity within our open source gesture community


A gesture is the combination of a drawing and code that executes an action or UI. That code can be shared between developers in our open source repository of gestures. We call them gestureActions and gesturePlugins, which developers will be able to clone and modify according to their needs.

  • gestureActions: for those who do not have development experience. A block of code that is triggered with gestures can ultimately be dragged and dropped on the backoffice once approved.
  • gesturePlugin: for developers who want to enhance the a specific plugin and develop UI features and new interactions.


Our job is to assign the gestures into our tracking system, test their codes and submit them to be rated by the community, which will generate reliable standards, set by the community for the community, for a true open source experience. Chekout RoamTouch repository.

Once you submit  a gestureAction or gesturePlugin, we add it to the tracking list so every developer and visitor can understand that gesture on a summary  card.




There is also an opportunity for computer animators and motion graphic artists to shine with gestureKit, creating beautiful animated traces for gestures and visual effects, inspired on the legendary pixie-dust, nyan cats or...surprise us!



As a developer, UX designer and as part of the gestureKit community you will have a user ID that will allow you to manage the dashboard, interact in forums, post on blogs and interact with other people in the industry on Labs. We are creating an ecosystem, an optimal environment to stimulate the community to discuss and exchange ideas about gestures and their influence in our life styles.

UXg stand for User Experience for Gestures. Technically, it is an extension of user experience.

For more information on UXg and how to get involved, check out our e-book here or visit our UXg Services web page.


Case app RKTLauncher

Presenting RKT Launcher demo app, powered by gestureKit technology. A fast blast for a safe launch of any of your apps, skipping the unlock screen process.



PROGRESS



TEAM. RoamTouch: Knowledge+Drive


Jose Vigil

CEO & Founder

Facebook | Twitter | About | LinkedIn


Radu-Daniel Vatavu

Human computer interaction

LinkedIn




Ionut-Alexandru Zaiti

Algorithm Developer

linkedin



Yandie Fashu Kanu

Legal Advisor and Intellectual Property

LinkedIn




Mary Brodie

UX Services

LinkedIn



Special thanks to our Indiegogo supporters

As a special token of our appreciation, we will create a special page on our website to list all your names and the achievements of this campaign. Additionally, those who pledge $100 or more will be granted exclusive first access to the projects that we be able to finish successfully and will be asked to input into a bio monthly meeting of the company’s progress as investors in the business. 

Risks and challenges

As mentioned above, most of the work with gestureKit has been completed (the project is now well defined). We still have to develop the case building process in a more structured and efficient way, which could be uncertain as to when we can start. However, our team will do everything possible to ensure a timely delivery of all our completed projects.


Thanks very much for reading, for your support and contribution.

story:
What is WatchAir?

WatchAir is an advanced smart antenna, not only receiving HDTV signal over the air, but also wirelessly streaming your live local TV directly to your smart devices such as smart phone, tablet, streaming box/stick, PC and even Smart TV. No wire and no monthly fee. 

The Freedom You Can Enjoy With WatchAir

1. The Freedom From Your Cable Bill

 

2. The Freedom From The Antenna Wire To TV

 

3. The Freedom From The Hassle of Where To Install

 

4. The Freedom Of Where To Watch Your Local Live TV From

 

5, The Freedom Of When To Watch Your Local Live TV

 

WatchAir Features

 1. Market-leading Indoor HDTV Antenna

 

2. Wireless Streaming Live Local TV

 

3. Easy-to-use App with Rich Program Information*

 

4. Smart Recording

 

5. Extensive App Support

    

WatchAir Specification

1, Specification

 

2. Disassembled WatchAir

 

3. Dimension

 

 

4. What's in the box

  

WatchAir in The News

  

 

Yesterday, Today, and Tomorrow

 

1. The Year of Chaos (2014)

 

2. Closed, But No Dice (2015)

 

 

3. Our Dream Came True (Early 2016)

 

 

 

 

 

4. Executing Our Promise To You (Hardware Schedule)

 

5. Executing Our Promise For You (Software Schedule)

 

The Current Status (As of Aug 12)

1. Final sample (T0) images

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

2. WatchAir Unboxing Demo

Please note that the following demo videos are purely organic, in other words, intentionally taken without any insert or digital post-processing.

 

  

 

 

3. WatchAir Installation Demo 

Please note that the following demo videos are purely organic, in other words, intentionally taken without any insert or digital post-processing.

 

 

4. WatchAir How To Use Demo 

Please note that the following demo videos are purely organic, in other words, intentionally taken without any stop, or digital post-processing.

 

 

 

Who & Why

1. People Who Created WatchAir

 

2. Our Vision and Why Indiegogo InDemand!

Our vision is simple. A two-word dream: Hang & Watch.

Our "Hang & Watch" means people just hang our WatchAir, and they can watch their local live TV right away. No hassle and no frustration at all, The reason we want to have such a dream is because people paying too much money for their pay-TV, or watching TV by using TV antenna with unhappy experience. We want to make a product to help people happy while they are watching TV. And we believe we made very good progress so far, making a product to watch their local live TV for free and easier than ever before, and of course, this is not the end. In near future, we will raise our bar not only by making cool products to sell, but also by creating innovative "services" to share with our friends and families, so that people can be happier than ever before while they watch local live TV's. We believe that our vision is firmly embedded with the spirit of Indiegogo. So please support us to share our dream. Thank you.

  

More About WatchAir

story:
*** This campaign is finished, you can get an EzTemp today on Fábrica Digital (Spanish) and Tindie (English) ***

Air temperature and relative humidity are very common parameters that need to be measured. We've been using the well-known DHT22 but we find it very innacurate as well as unstable.

Also, Raspberry Pi doesn't come with a built-in ADC, and using analog sensors isn't easy.

That's why we've created EzTemp&RH! :)

With EzTemp&RH you get a professional relative humidity sensor by Honeywell and an accurate thermistor that you can read using your UART pins on Raspberry Pi, your PC or any other serial-capable device.

You just send a 1-byte command to the EzTemp&RH and it will take readings of humidity, temperature and an external signal you connect. EzTemp&RH will send the data back through the serial port.

Features

EzTemp&RH features a professional-grade Honeywell HIH5030, 3% accurate from 11-89% RH (7% at 0-10% and 90-100%), as well as a 10kOhm 1% thermistor. Sensors are read by a precision 12-bit SAR ADC. You can also connect an external sensor to the ADC to use it on Raspberry Pi.

Media coverage

Thanks to great writers, the project has been featured on these awesome blogs:
  • Framboise314.fr
  • DIYMakers.es
  • HardwareHacking.mx
  • Embarcados.com.br
  • Brunier.nl
  • Open-Electronics.org
  • FrankensteinGarage.it
Check them out! :)

Open-Source

We're open-hardware fans. If EzTemp&RH gets produced, we'll publish the sources on GitHub. Schematics, Layout, BOM and firmware will be available for anyone to see, modify and create their own designs.
https://github.com/CAIMANICS/EzTempRH-for-Raspberry-Pi
 

This means we could work together on the firmware and design awesome features!

What you get

All perks include free worldwide shipping!

But I'm not a geek! Can I contribute?

Sure! With the non-geek reward you can back our project and get a temperature sensor that doesn't require programming skills! ;) [Clarification: This is a symbolic reward for backing the project, it isn't made by us]

3 other ways you can help

  • Tell your friends about the project.
  • Use the 'share' widgets at the top of the page and spread the word.
  • Tweet and Retweet #EzTempRH and campaign links.



Extended features

The on-board PSoC4 device will run a bootloader, so you can upgrade its code easily using the serial port on your computer. Also, you can run your custom code on EzTemp&RH for your own applications. It can work as a standalone microcontroller board!

Who we are

We're a group of makers as well as professionals at the electronics industry.

EzTemp&RH it's been already prototyped using development boards. We've been using the HIH5030 sensor for some months in professional applications, and we love it, that's why we want to use it on our Raspberry Pi for our projects.

We've produced electronic products before, so we're familiar with the process of PCB manufacturing and SMT assembly. If everything goes as expected, we should be shipping the boards 3 months after the campaign ends. :)

FrankensteinGarage.it

Check them out! :)



Open-Source

We're open-hardware fans. If EzTemp&RH gets produced, we'll publish the sources on GitHub. Schematics, Layout, BOM and firmware will be available for anyone to see, modify and create their own designs.

https://github.com/CAIMANICS/EzTempRH-for-Raspberry-Pi 




This means we could work together on the firmware and design awesome features!


What you get



All perks include free worldwide shipping!



But I'm not a geek! Can I contribute?

Sure! With the non-geek reward you can back our project and get a temperature sensor that doesn't require programming skills! ;) [Clarification: This is a symbolic reward for backing the project, it isn't made by us]





3 other ways you can help

Tell your friends about the project.
Use the 'share' widgets at the top of the page and spread the word.
Tweet and Retweet #EzTempRH and campaign links.




Extended features

The on-board PSoC4 device will run a bootloader, so you can upgrade its 
code easily using the serial port on your computer. Also, you can run 
your custom code on EzTemp&RH for your own applications. It can work
 as a standalone microcontroller board!


Who we areWe're a group of makers as well as professionals at the electronics industry.EzTemp&RH it's been already prototyped using development boards. We've been using the HIH5030 sensor for some months in professional applications, and we love it, that's why we want to use it on our Raspberry Pi for our projects.

We've produced electronic products before, so we're familiar with the process of PCB manufacturing and SMT assembly. If everything goes as expected, we should be shipping the boards 3 months after the campaign ends. :)

story:
Activity is like your personal assistant, which helps to organize your life in a way you want. You can use it for fun - to keep the track of all interesting events. You can use it for business - to plan all important meetings and make appointments. You can use it for everyday life and household - to manage casual things like calling a plumber, making appointment with a therapist or even making a shopping list. And you can use Activity for more significant events - to organize your birthday party or wedding, to meet your friends, to make a date. You can use it also as a storage of your memories - to save and share photos and videos from any important event of your life. And, of course, you can combine all this cases - Activity’s mission is to manage all your events.



Main features:

  • You want to be aware of what interesting is happening around? And find some events to participate? - Use Activity’s search tool and get a list of all public events, which you can sort by a specific type, city and date. Send invitation to your friends, so you won’t go alone!


  • Or maybe you’re interested in which events your friends are involved? - Just check Activity’s newsletter to be updated and participate in events you like.


  • Or you want to organize your own event? Like a party, performance, concert, flash mob, competition or any other activity and share it with everyone? - Create a public event with Activity, so anyone can see it and participate in it.


  • You need event not for everyone? An appointment, a private party, a date, a business meeting, a visit to a doctor, etc.? - Use Activity to create a private event and invite just a person/persons you want. The event will automatically appear both in your calendar and in calendar of your invitees.


  • And if you invite no one - this event is just for you! Use it as a reminder, a to do list, even as an alarm clock.


  • You need to keep track of all your activities, events, you’ve created, been invited or involved in? And you want to save memories from all these events? They all are already stored and automatically organized in your Activity’s calendar. View them by day, by week or by month. Remember your past events, check upcoming ones and plan ahead!



Dear funders,

Our application is going to be free, because we want to make Activity available for everyone. So how we can show our special appreciation to you? We consider our funders as a part of Activity Team, united by one common goal - to make it happen. So in order to honor you we’re going to include a list of all our sponsors into a credits of the application. (Of course, if you don’t want to stay incognito). The credits will be sorted by a contribution amount, just to make it fair. (So the more you contribute the higher your name in the list!)


We believe, together we can create a really great application, which can be useful for many people. That’s why your opinion is very important for us. Please feel free to leave your remarks and suggestions about the application at our Facebook and Twitter profiles.


We promise to keep you updated with the latest news about our progress, our successes and mistakes. And we’ll notify you when a working prototype be ready as well as a final version of the application. So you will be the first to download Activity and check it out. Join us and let’s make it happen together!

story:
Our Story

Today smartphone become important part of our life. As devices become faster and faster and display become larger and larger, they make us more efficient. However with this fancy and high speed technology battery life is always seem a problem. There are portable batteries on the market, but none of them meet our expectations. Most of the portable batteries can olny be charge via usb.  You will need to always remember to bring a extra wall charger with you. Because of this inconvenient, we find out a solution, PowerSq.
 

What is PowerSq?

PowerSq, is a small portable USB wall charger with a built in 3000mAh rechargeable battery. While you charge your mobile device and also charge the built in battery at same time. And it size is small enough to put in pocket, that you can take with you anywhere. it is one solution for charging device and backup battery.
 

PowerSq a crab to good wall charger with builtin battery in your pocket
 
 
PowerSq size is small, dimensions: 50mm x 50mm x 27mm / 1.96" x 1.96" x 1.06", that you can carry with you anywhere.

PowerSq built-in a 3000mAh battery, it is good for 2 full charge for most smartphone.
 
 
PowerSq can use 100-220v input for international use. It is design to replace wall charger and you can bring with you while travel.
 
 
PowerSq will be CE, RoHS, and FCC Certifiable.
 
 

Spec

  • Dimensions 50mm x 50mm x 27mm / 1.96" x 1.96" x 1.06"
  • 3000mAh rechargeable battery
  • Input:100-240v supported for international use
  • Output: 5v/1A
  • CE, RoHS, and FCC Certifiable.
  • One status LED

Thank you for reading and support

Thank you for reading this far. We will be doing our best, using all our resources, efforts to deliver the best PowerSq to you. We going to do whatever needs to be done to deliver your PowerSq to you on time. Thanks for support!!

story:
The new and improved Sensibo Sky (2nd generation) is now available for purchase on Indiegogo. Click this link for more information

Thank you for helping us make the Sensibo experience great :)

Sensibo is a tiny device that connects air conditioners to the internet. It can be used with any A/C that has a remote control.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Sensibo supports any A/C that can be used with a remote control.

 


Sensibo uses IR commands to communicate with your existing A/C, just like your remote control. It works right out of the box and supports any remote controlled A/C: Window A/Cs, Split, central, standing, etc.

 

 

 

 

 

 

You don’t need to teach Sensibo anything. Remote control commands are pre-installed, ready to communicate with your existing A/C. 

 

 

Check out how the Sensibo Pod is installed

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Sensibo's app comes packed with amazing features:
IFTTT integration, scheduling, timer and more.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

You might have a Samsung in the living room, an LG in the bedroom and a Friedrich in the study and yet, Sensibo allows you to control all of them using one simple interface.

 

 

In order to extend the range of the Sensibo Pods, we designed Sensibo to have two parts: one smart hub that connects to your home router, and a Sensibo Pod for each of your air conditioners. This design also helps make Sensibo more affordable.

 

Sensibo is 100% mobile and transferable. We opted for 3M: Command™ mounting tape, super strong and easily attachable to any surface and most importantly, the pod can slide right off your A/C without leaving a trace. 

 

 

The Sensibo pod is composed of two parts: a mounting unit that attaches to the A/C surface, and the main pod unit. The main pod unit floats on a magnetic axis around the mounting unit. 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

We respect air conditioners. They represent a century's worth of research in the field of thermodynamics. When we first thought about a world with smart air conditioners, we realized it would be too expensive and unnecessary to build a smart A/C from scratch.

Air conditioners are really great at what they do, cool and heat.
They just don't know when to do what. Sensibo gives A/Cs the power of insight, and the ability to adjust to your lifestyle.

 

 

 

 

Each Sensibo pod is powered by two micro-processors. We chose to work with Texas Instrument’s CC2538 as the main MCU. It runs a 802.15.4 low power RF standard with 6LoWPAN protocol on top. The secondary MCU is Texas Instrument’s CC2541, running Bluetooth Low Energy and supports iBeacon. Sensibo runs on two powerful standard CR123A batteries

 

 

 

Sensibo is equipped with 6 tiny super strong Infra-red emitters pointed in all directions. This way it's easy to place the pod on your A/C and it just works.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Omer Enbar is the CEO of Sensibo. Omer is a devoted maker, with vast experience in product. Prior to Sensibo, Omer worked on products both for consumers and for the professional market. Omer holds a BSc. in computer science.

Ran Roth is the CTO of Sensibo. Prior to Sensibo Ran worked as an algorithm researcher at Yahoo. Ran is a technology and science enthusiast. He holds an MSc. in algorithm and a BSc. in Physics and Maths. Before Sensibo, Ran worked on many challenging algorithmic problems in the field of BigData, Computer Vision and Control Theory. He also has a wide knowledge and experience in software development.

Dror Bren is the Creative Director of Sensibo. He’s an experienced industrial and UX designer and holds an MDes in design management and a BDes in Industrial design. Prior to Sensibo, Dror has worked at BRIO Interaction Design, developing interfaces for some of Israel’s leading startups.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

One of the coolest things about Sensibo is that we are working on integrating with various platforms.
Sensibo has an active IFTTT channel, which lets you use your creativity and innovation to create recipes that use Sensibo's abilities.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

I have a central air conditioning system. Can I use Sensibo?
Yes, central air conditioning is supported if your system has a remote control (even if you lost it).

What's the difference between Sensibo and Nest?
Nest replaces your existing wired thermostat. If you have a remote controlled air conditioner you can't use Nest or a similar solution. Sensibo can be used with any remote controlled A/C.

How does the Sensibo Pod connect to the A/C?
The Sensibo Pod is completely external to your air conditioner. It has no wires. It controls the A/C using IR commands, in the same manner your remote control does.

How does the Sensibo smart hub connect to the internet?
The Sensibo smart hub connects to the internet through your home router. The connection is done using a regular ethernet cable. We chose to use ethernet over WiFi for our smart hub because it's easier to install, more secure and there's no need for updating passwords.

Can I schedule Sensibo to turn on the air conditioner?
Yes. The app lets you easily schedule the A/C to your routine. Even better - you can set the scheduler to work only if it’s hot or cold.

How much time do the batteries last?
Sensibo is very power efficient and uses strong batteries that last 3-6 months with normal usage.

Does Sensibo measure relative humidity?
Yes. Relative humidity and temperature are incorporated into a thermal comfort model. 

Does Sensibo have an API?
We are working on providing an API. Once released, Sensibo will offer a rich API that lets you control the air conditioner and read the data from the sensors.

 

 

* Dog image courtesy of Rolland Budi (cc-by-sa 2.0)

story:
Thank you all ! We appreciate all your support in the campaign. 

From now on, we launch website to let people who missed the campaign to order our Android based head units.

 www.in-dash.net


Please send email to indashnet@gmail.com if you need further information.

Extra Information will be updated here: 
https://plus.google.com/communities/115500164891031633970


 

Feedback from XDA-developers

daniel_loft

"This looks like a great idea! I thought of something similar for my thesis, some years ago, on linux, but didn't come up too fancy."

sedrader

"You sir, are awesome. I've thought about doing this before but never had time to get around to it."

ke1n p1an

"nice idea. voice controls would be really nice and an option to let it read out mails/messages you are getting while driving"


Noobie Boobie

"That is a genious idea!!"

doraz72

"This looks awesome! I've been saying someone should do this for years... Good luck!!!"

ayk33

"great idea...good luck what you do"


Where We Started

 

Automobiles are our “2nd home” since we spend a significant amount of time in our cars every day. The Internet brought huge changes to the world, but very little to a car. Many motorists had dreamed of driving a “smart car” that not only provide simple navigation and music, but also execute our voice command and respond back like Google Now or Siri; and in addition to our favorite streaming music from Pandora, Spotify or Rdio, we could also enjoy the performance and the convenience of thousands of Apps such as Waze, Yelp and others.


Tablets and smart phones have been put on trials in our test vehicle and the result has not been satisfactory. So, our 4-person development team took the challenge and designed a 2 DIN head unit built-in to the vehicle’s in-dash panel, and now, we make this motorists’ dream come true:


Android In-Dash System Combined 3G+ mobile Internet on the go.


Compared to large auto companies who try and have this kind of system installed in their cars, and charge their customers a premium, what we would like to provide to the drivers community with even a better, open system on a DIY basis, so that most cars, new or used, would easily become a “smart car” with simple and easy installation.

 

What We Have Achieved

 

We have finished all the design, aging test and road test of our Android in-dash system. We are able to provide dedicated head units for over 60 car models, and in addition 2 DIN universal designs for a number of car models with square shape head units. Now, we need your support to put them into a production line so we can bring the smart car on the road.

The design comes with ARM Cortex A8 CPU, power management, audio output amplifier, FM/AM radio, Bluetooth and GPS that follow the aftermarket standard. Your traditional infotainment system continues to function in terms of features and quality, and with our in-dash system, it now has freedom with Internet and open Android platform.

Here is the highlight feature list:

  •  Android 4.0
  •  ARM Cortex A8 up to 1.5G CPU
  •  1G DDR3, 4G FLASH ROM
  •  USB 3G Dongle
  •  Wi-Fi
  •  Webcam for DVR
  •  1080P 30fps video playback
  •  FM/AM radio
  •  GPS
  •  Bluetooth hands free and A2DP music
  •  Steering wheel keys integration
  •  Support rear camera view
  •  DVD optional
  •  OBD optional


Detailed SPECIFICATION:

 

 

 

  

How We Have Come So Far

 

Our professional expertise in mobile communication and vehicle infotainment system have allowed us to achieve successful designs and overcome numerous obstacles after countless days and nights of hard work and on-going testing. Our team has been able to fix details & issues with both the hardware and the software. Such endeavors are usually done in the large labs of brand name auto makers who like to have the system built-in and charge their clients a premium. We are proud of the fact that with the efforts of a small professional team, we make ourselves part of the world’s transportation revolution by connecting our most important living spaces besides home and office into Internet and taste the change by Internet and Apps.

 

How We Would Use the Funds


Your support will help us to take a solid step forward of our “connected car project”: putting it into batch production.
$1500 is required for each of the 60 car models we currently support to manufacture the panel plastic boards and other related parts. When ready, we would move forward to start batch production of a minimum 100 units per batch. The mother board, Android board and other components are common parts shared among all models. The funds will be used to produce minimum dedicated parts and the first batch of common parts.

 

Model List


1) Universal model

 

Universal model is to be used in normal square shape in-dash panel. There are many cars which applied 2DIN square shape in-dash system. If your car cannot use universal or any dedicated panel, a 3D-printing cover with a universal device might be a cool choice.

Following is 7’ Universal model and dimension:

 

 

 

2) Dedicated Models

Dedicated models come with well matching panel and dedicated wires for easy installation. Here is the list we could support:

 

 


Risks and challenges


1. Car design and models vary by country/region. Please let us know your car’s make/year/model so we would try our best to conform. If nothing is available, the best bet is the Universal panel. Please feel free to contact us: indashnet@gmail.com. 

2. For Hacker’s choice, Information might be changed from time to time as more features will be added like OBD and Yaw detection.

 

Acknowledgement


We want to thank Jin Fang, for providing nice illustration. You may enjoy other lovely works from her: http://jinzilla.deviantart.com/.
Also, we thank the musicians who make the great music:

Psychadelik Pedestrian: Raindrops, Fifth world
deeB: Downtown
The Scallions: Silence in Sunshine

This project cannot come to this stage without the help from those who carried out road tests and insipid aging test. Thank you all!

Google, Android are trademarks of Google Inc. ARM is a trademark of ARM Inc. All other brand names are trademarks or registered trademarks of their respective owners.

 

Your Contribution

 

We are trying to shape the future of driving experience and put a lot of time, funding and effort in the project. We believe all cars will get connected one day like our home and office. Your support will make this happen and move the project to its promising future. You will be a part of world’s pioneers of tasting Internet in cars!

If you are a developer, we welcome you to hack and add more features into the devices or develop some services or Apps. 

If number of ‘Idea Shine’ backers reaches 500 or more, we will make Android part as an open source project to allow all people to modify it freely!

Tablets and smart phones have been put on trials in our test vehicle and the result has not been satisfactory. So, our 4-person development team took the challenge and designed a 2 DIN head unit built-in to the vehicle’s in-dash panel, and now, we make this motorists’ dream come true:
Android In-Dash System Combined 3G+ mobile Internet on the go.
Compared to large auto companies who try and have this kind of system installed in their cars, and charge their customers a premium, what we would like to provide to the drivers community with even a better, open system on a DIY basis, so that most cars, new or used, would easily become a “smart car” with simple and easy installation.
 
What We Have Achieved
 
We have finished all the design, aging test and road test of our Android in-dash system. We are able to provide dedicated head units for over 60 car models, and in addition 2 DIN universal designs for a number of car models with square shape head units. Now, we need your support to put them into a production line so we can bring the smart car on the road.
The design comes with ARM Cortex A8 CPU, power management, audio output amplifier, FM/AM radio, Bluetooth and GPS that follow the aftermarket standard. Your traditional infotainment system continues to function in terms of features and quality, and with our in-dash system, it now has freedom with Internet and open Android platform.
Here is the highlight feature list:

 Android 4.0
 ARM Cortex A8 up to 1.5G CPU
 1G DDR3, 4G FLASH ROM
 USB 3G Dongle
 Wi-Fi
 Webcam for DVR
 1080P 30fps video playback
 FM/AM radio
 GPS
 Bluetooth hands free and A2DP music
 Steering wheel keys integration
 Support rear camera view
 DVD optional
 OBD optional

Detailed SPECIFICATION:
 
 
 
  
How We Have Come So Far
 
Our professional expertise in mobile communication and vehicle infotainment system have allowed us to achieve successful designs and overcome numerous obstacles after countless days and nights of hard work and on-going testing. Our team has been able to fix details & issues with both the hardware and the software. Such endeavors are usually done in the large labs of brand name auto makers who like to have the system built-in and charge their clients a premium. We are proud of the fact that with the efforts of a small professional team, we make ourselves part of the world’s transportation revolution by connecting our most important living spaces besides home and office into Internet and taste the change by Internet and Apps.
 
How We Would Use the Funds
Your support will help us to take a solid step forward of our “connected car project”: putting it into batch production. $1500 is required for each of the 60 car models we currently support to manufacture the panel plastic boards and other related parts. When ready, we would move forward to start batch production of a minimum 100 units per batch. The mother board, Android board and other components are common parts shared among all models. The funds will be used to produce minimum dedicated parts and the first batch of common parts.
 
Model List

1) Universal model
 
Universal model is to be used in normal square shape in-dash panel. There are many cars which applied 2DIN square shape in-dash system. If your car cannot use universal or any dedicated panel, a 3D-printing cover with a universal device might be a cool choice.
Following is 7’ Universal model and dimension:
 

 

 
2) Dedicated Models
Dedicated models come with well matching panel and dedicated wires for easy installation. Here is the list we could support:
 

 

Risks and challenges
1. Car design and models vary by country/region. Please let us know your car’s make/year/model so we would try our best to conform. If nothing is available, the best bet is the Universal panel. Please feel free to contact us: indashnet@gmail.com. 
2. For Hacker’s choice, Information might be changed from time to time as more features will be added like OBD and Yaw detection.
 
Acknowledgement
We want to thank Jin Fang, for providing nice illustration. You may enjoy other lovely works from her: http://jinzilla.deviantart.com/.Also, we thank the musicians who make the great music:
Psychadelik Pedestrian: Raindrops, Fifth world  deeB: Downtown  The Scallions: Silence in Sunshine
This project cannot come to this stage without the help from those who carried out road tests and insipid aging test. Thank you all!
Google, Android are trademarks of Google Inc. ARM is a trademark of ARM Inc. All other brand names are trademarks or registered trademarks of their respective owners.
 
Your Contribution
 
We are trying to shape the future of driving experience and put a lot of time, funding and effort in the project. We believe all cars will get connected one day like our home and office. Your support will make this happen and move the project to its promising future. You will be a part of world’s pioneers of tasting Internet in cars!
If you are a developer, we welcome you to hack and add more features into the devices or develop some services or Apps. 
If number of ‘Idea Shine’ backers reaches 500 or more, we will make Android part as an open source project to allow all people to modify it freely!

story:
A prototyping app for designers and the perfect bridge between designers, developers and clients...

Hi there! We are Ronald, Jurriaan and Max and we want to make a dent in the universe... We’ve all worked for different agencies, with different clients and a lot of different designers and developers. And that, my friends, is exactly how we got inspired to start Clickmodels. A prototyping app for designers and the perfect bridge between designers, developers and clients.

Clickmodels in a nutshell

Millions of designers, clients and developers worldwide are part of the complex process prior to the release of an online project. All of them are looking for new ways to speed up their workflow and presenting and selling their product better. For designers, creating a quick but good working prototype is not always that easy. With Clickmodels that will be made so much easier, more fun and obvious to do.

What we'll do for designers

We’ve got a lot of great and advanced functionalities specially for designers. Whether you just want to create clickmodels of simple webpages or prefer advanced and interactive onepagers. Clickmodels is the app to present, build, review, test, and finish up your design.

..for developers

Developers are going to love this stuff. Send your developer your clickmodel and you make it possible for him to see specifications like colours, margins, paddings and assets. Also handy tools like hover states, mirroring and crop & save tools are things developers just can’t go without. It will save the developer a lot of time creating the pixel-perfect product that everybody will love and nobody needs to sit next to a developer for hours anymore. Win win situation, right?

..for your beloved clients

It’s time to get rid of the dozens of emails with tons of annotations and revisions from your clients. Hold your conversation there where it’s meant to be. Send your beloved client your clickmodel and let them review and approve all your designs one by one. Reduce emails, phonecalls or even text messages.

Why we think you’ll love it

There are millions of designers worldwide producing and pitching dozens of websites everyday. All of them are looking for new ways to speed up their workflow and presenting and selling their product better. That’s where we come in. None of the available tools on the market allows designers, developers and clients to work together so efficiently using 1 single tool. Clickmodels does just that. Some say it’s magic, we just want to create the perfect bridge between designer, developer and client.

We believe that with Clickmodels we can take away a lot of struggles among designers, developers and clients. With the experience we’ve gathered over the past decade we know very well what these struggles are and how we can take away the biggest part of it.

A handful of functions you’ll love

Why do we need your money

Development takes a lot of time, a lot. We’re currently building Clickmodels with just two developers. The newest and state of the art functions we’re working on (not shown in the image above) are mindblowing but are going to take up hundreds and hundreds of extra hours of development. To make our dream become reality and to let it work perfectly we need your support to buy more manpower, brains and beards. The more we raise, the sooner we can get our hands on some extra developers. Your money is well spend and we know for sure you’ll love the final result.

Awesome rewards

Every perk comes with a subscription, the higher the perk the bigger the total package. Check out our perks on the right side of the screen and take a look at the impressions of the merchandise we will send you for your support.

Don't miss these perks

Paid subscriptions

Clickmodels subscriptions will be available in 4 different packages. All these packages contain most of the same functions and the price is based on the amount of projects.

No perks? There are more ways to help!

Short by cash, no creditcard or paypal or just don’t want to make a pledge? If you like our project we would appreciate you to spread the word via Twitter, Facebook etc. Every little bit helps us to reach our goal.

www.twitter.com/clickmodelsapp

www.facebook.com/clickmodelsapp

Questions? Just send us a quick email!

More about the team

Ronald Mansveld

Dreaming code since he was 12, Ronald is always looking for ways to make code better, faster and more secure, and has a weak spot for working on web-based applications such as Clickmodels. From the high-level architecture, to the low level plumbing-details, Ronald has it all under control, so Clickmodels feels as snappy as possible, and perhaps even snappier.

Jurriaan van Drunen

Born and raised in the city of Haarlem in the year '89. A design and UI enthusiastic over de last 8 years and now right at the heart of Clickmodels. Jurriaan is always trying to create something different and better. He guarantees that there is no learning curve for Clickmodels at all…

Max van der Stam

Hailing form IJmuiden, Noord Holland since 1990, Max has been working with computers since he was old enough to use a keyboard. Today, Max is driven by the desire to make fluent, beautiful web-based applications like Clickmodels. And when it comes to making a good application absolutely perfect, Max goes the extra mile using new and exciting technologies to deliver a stunning user experience. Creating the little things that exist in Clickmodels such as beautiful but unobtrusive transitional effects or the easy and simple way to create new Screens for Clickmodels with one drag-and-drop action is what makes him happy.

So this is the end of our story

Well thanks for reading this far and taking an interest in Clickmodels. We really hope you can back us and we're looking forward to hearing your comments. We're very excited about Clickmodels and hope you are to.

Cheers, The Clickmodels team!

story:
Introducing HaloEffect


Hey, I’m Brian, co-founder of Halo Effect!

Over the past 5 years, co-founder Dave Reeb and I have launched dozens of products, including iPhone and iPad accessories sold in Apple stores worldwide, and we're excited to launch our most important product line yet.

Designed to fit most popular smartphones (like iPhone, Galaxy S, Pixel, and others), Halo Effect reinvents your day from wake to sleep, using a series of mounts that allow you to be a better you.  Whether you are an athlete, a parent, a student, an executive, a driver, an artist, or all of the above, this kit will empower your day.

Do you use a case for protection or style, or do you prefer to keep it thin and light? No worries. You can do both, or either, and even change your mind later. Three of the bases that come with your kit were designed to work with cases up with 2.5 mm in thickness. For example, if you have an Apple iPhone 7 with a leather Apple case, you will simply switch from the #3 base to the #4 base. We’ll lay it all out in the directions that will come with your kit.

The bottom line: no smartphone mount system has ever had any three of these capabilities packaged together, and solutions that try to meet even half the functions of Halo Effect cost more.

Each kit comes with 6 bases to fit most major smart phones with a case or without (see chart)

The Play-Perform mount is the integral hub of the kit.

The first all-in-one smartphone kit

Halo Effect’s all-in-one kit provides mounts with four unique and fundamentally important functions—RUN+RIDE, DRIVE+DIRECT, PLAY+PERFORM, SHARE+STREAM. 

A quick overview:

  • Run+Ride — lightest & smallest, rotates 7 snaps-on/off upper & lower arm.
  • Drive+Direct — secure, any-view, ultra-portable, any-view car vent mount.
  • Play+Perform — most functional any-view,table-top, counter, and desk stand.
  • Share+Stream — any-view smooth-surface multi-mount (for glass, walls, etc.)

Thanks to Halo Effect's smart design, switching between each mode is seamless: just slide and clip when you’re on to your next activity.

 
 

What the press and you tubers are saying

 

 "...a solution for all of those ways and places we use smartphones ...a hands-free kit that includes a universal base for your device that plugs into three unique mounts for driving, running or biking, and working."  —Fast Company   

"With HaloEffect, one clever phone attachment has the ability to directly attach the the rest of the mounts in the system, creating a more seamless experience...Overall, this is probably the best stab at streamlining the hands-free lifestyle I've seen yet." —Core77 

"...It’s unique in that it comes in a kit and puts four functions together." —Technical.ly

DailTekk on You Tube: Check how excited Chris gets about our kit.

4-mount kit does it all

 

a) PLAY+PERFORM Mount Summary (the Hub of the Kit)

Get the best view of your screen with this freestanding mount.

Watch your favorite videos on the go, angled for the best visibility.

Best-in-class for video conferencing and FaceTime.

Holds ID, subway pass, credit card securely. No need for a case.​

 

Unlike other phone-side mount components, this feature actually does something—something pretty amazing. It's great for watching a video on the go, sharing a presentation, and even holding your credit card and ID. Plus, it has swappable bases, enabling it to mount to numerous phones (and phone sizes) with or without a case.

It includes the most functional kickstand ever created, with a 360° indexed rotation, a 90° infinite-angle arm, and can easily be swapped to another phone—no magnets or adhesives required.

 

b) RUN+RIDE Mount Summary

The only mount you'll need for running, cycling and fitness.

Easy in-workout screen view and access, with no messy sleeves, with 360 rotation.

Place it on your lower arm for the perfect cycling position.

Clips easily and securely on a washable/breathable arm band.

 

Perfect for fitness and other outdoor activities, the RUN+RIDE mode snap-connects your smartphone to your upper or lower arm for your morning run, bike trip, or evening workout. The minimalist design and breathable 4-way stretch fabric is also perfect for keeping you cool when it's hot.

Plus, the indexed 360º rotating mode allows you to quickly check your run route with a twist, and raises your device off your arm—so you can wear it on your upper or lower arm, giving you full mobility for activities like push-ups.

 

c) DRIVE+DIRECT Mount Summary

Never lose your way with your smartphone right on your dashboard.

Easy access to your GPS while on the road.

It won't block vent airflow, keeping your phone from overheating.

The perfect driving companion—navigate, answer calls handsfree, or watch a video in the passenger seat. This mode easily slides into your car’s vent, without blocking airflow or allowing hot vent air to overheat your device. With two insertion modes and 360° x 90° indexed rotation, this mode enables any desired angle and view.


d) SHARE+STREAM Mount Summary

The handsfree mount is great for your work or daily routine.

Quickly check a recipe in the kitchen.

Hop on a video call handsfree.

Incorporate your smartphone into your morning routine.

This simple, powerful mount adheres to almost any smooth surface—tile, glass, painted surfaces, mirrors, screens, and more—using a Command™ Strip adhesive. It leaves no residue when removed, and can be easily replaced to reposition the mount somewhere else if you change your mind (we even provide a free second strip just in case).

Perfect for dual-screen video conferencing, keeping your phone away from kids' sticky fingers, checking recipes while cooking, and more.

 

It fits like a glove - using 6 Swappable Bases

 

Have a case?  Swap the base.    

For the phones listed above, if you want to use a case, you can simply swap the base to fit whatever thin-walled case you like (with case wall thickness less than a 2.5mm ) - like the Apple case on an iPhone shown below.  

 

Halo Effect is roughly 1/3 the cost!

 

Timeline

 

Perks

 

Our process

This is our most all-encompassing project yet, and we've been working on it for well over a year. That may sound like a long time — maybe it is — but it went by fast. We had some false-starts, made dozens of unique prototypes, yelled at the sky a few times, and spent lots of hours in the lab and in the field testing and refining.

We grabbed some of the best ideas from our ZeroChroma roots (and the very capable brain of my business partner Dave), tweaked and optimized each one, and then combined them in a way that will transform your day. Even though it took plenty of roll-up-your-sleeves ingenuity, and hard work, we feel lucky to have had such a simple, seamless solution fall into place. 

Although we have had the good fortune to work together on a few award-winning one-of-kind products, this kit was the most fun in recent memory. We hope your process of discovery matches ours.

Our process designing Halo Effect.

 

Why Indiegogo?

We're really excited to bring this project to life—and we thought crowdfunding would be the perfect way to go. 

Our smartphones have now become so personalized, we all need them for different uses. That's why we created a kit that allows for a slew of different activities—to fit any lifestyle, anywhere. Given the democratic nature of crowdfunding, we knew this would be the perfect place to create a community and make this project a reality.

Team

Dave  and I  are so thankful to each and every member of our team (both past and present) with a special thanks to Jeremy Carpenter, Teri Chrissomallis, Michele Dierking, Laura Siciliano, Steven Wright, Patrick Francisco, Nathan Li, Mike Woods and Hugh Smallwood.

With over 20 years of manufacturing and supply chain experience in Asia, Europe, Mexico and the U.S., we are picky and demanding. Our manufacturing partners GPA Global out of Shenzhen and UTS in Taipei City are simply the best.  They make the complex look simple, and they do it on time and on spec.

We can't wait to get the Halo Effect into your hands! 

 

Thank you!
