story:
Watch the video to see how 321-RIDE works.

Welcome to 321-RIDE!


Drinking and driving sucks. When you drink and drive you risk being arrested, causing an accident, or worse, killing somebody. More over, a DUI can spell financial ruin, costing more then $10,000 in legal expenses. In a day and age of social media, your friends, family, and coworkers will undoubtedly hear about it and ask you questions. You might even lose your job. Everybody wants to have fun, nobody wants to get in trouble.

321-RIDE has a very simple premise; after a night out, we drive you home in your vehicle. Our clients call or text to order a ride. A chauffeur is immediately dispatched to the clients location. Upon arrival the chauffeur drives the client home in the client's vehicle. A second driver follows behind in a separate vehicle and picks up the chauffeur when the ride is complete. Rides are charged based on a flat rate plus mileage, with an average charge of $62 per ride. 321-RIDE is a membership based service, currently with an annual fee of $200. With our expansion we will be changing to a monthly membership model, under $8 per month.

For more then 6 years, 321-RIDE has been in business in Greater Cincinnati to help our clients better enjoy their nights out. We are now ready to embrace new technology and expand far beyond the Cincinnati area. The money raised in this campaign will go directly into the creation of a mobile app for both iPhone & Android. Imagine sitting in a loud bar and scheduling your own chauffeur with the press of just one button and never having to get out of your seat. Even better, the app will allow you to share 321-RIDE with friends and get rewarded for doing so! The app will revolutionize how 321-RIDE operates. Individuals will be able to sign up and order a ride at anytime. The funds raised will also go to covering the start up expenses for business launch in Columbus and Cleveland. Help us expand so that we can help you and your friends have more enjoyable nights out. You have fun, we will drive.

The Mobile App

Your donation will be used to design, build and implement a mobile app for both iPhone and Android platforms. The app will make 321-RIDE an on demand service, where a person can download the app, sign up, and order a ride in less then 2 minutes.

Here are just a few of the benefits of a mobile app for our clients:

  • One touch ride ordering - no phone calls or text messages needed
  • No waiting on hold, no dispatchers
  • Refer a friend and earn free rides
  • No need to leave the bar or go somewhere quiet to call for a ride
  • Always know where your chauffeur is and how long until they will be to you
  • Faster pick up times
  • Ability to rate chauffeurs after each ride
  • You can choose your favorite chauffeur or let the app pick for you
  • Simplicity; all of your information is securely stored, no cash needed, ever!

With building the mobile app, 321-RIDE will update its back end systems which will allow for a more streamlined business that is ready to grow. New back end features will include quicker communication of information to chauffeurs, ability to track location of chauffeurs at all times, and automatic payroll systems.


We are amped up and ready to expand to major cities throughout Ohio, followed quickly by Indianapolis, Pittsburgh, and Nashville. With the development of the 321-RIDE mobile app, expansion will be quick and seamless.

With your help we can bring 321-RIDE to cities throughout Ohio and beyond. Our expansion will help individuals better enjoy their night, but it will also allow for restaurants to take better care of their valuable customers via a free chauffeur home. Most importantly 321-RIDE's expansion will mean fewer drunk drivers on the road. Which means we are all safer in the end.

Our goal is for 321-RIDE to open for business in Columbus in June of 2014 followed by Cleveland a few months later. Our unique form of transportation will transform how you enjoy night life. Whether you go out and enjoy a drink once a week or once a year, 321-RIDE will be on call to assist you.


Other Ways You Can Help

We are grateful for everyone who donates to 321-RIDE's cause. We also understand that not everyone will be able to contribute and that's cool. You can help in other ways, too.

  • Tell your friends & family about 321-RIDE
  • Share 321-RIDE's Indiegogo campaign on your favorite social media. Remember to tag us on twitter @321RIDE or mention us on Facebook.
  • We are always hiring upstanding people with good driving records to become 321-RIDE Chauffeurs. Email us and we will contact you about a job when we expand to your city.


Definitions:

  • On-Call Chauffeur Service: 321-RIDE's standard service. You call, text, or use the app to order a ride and a chauffeur is immediately dispatched to your pickup location. The chauffeur then drives you home in the comfort and safety of your own vehicle. No pre-scheduling is needed. Pricing is based on mileage driven. 

  • Hourly Chauffeur Service: A pre-planned service, where the client schedules a date and time in advance for a chauffeur to arrive at the client's home. The chauffeur then transports the client in the client's vehicle wherever they would like to go. The chauffeur is solely dedicated to this one client for the entire evening and remains with the vehicle throughout the trip. Pricing is based on a flat hourly rate.


*Please note that 321-RIDE is a membership based company. You will be required to agree to 321-RIDE's terms and conditions and fees before having access to our services or your account credits. The account credits issued as Perks will be applied to all monthly, membership, and rides fees until credit balance is reduced to zero. Account credits can not be used to provide gratuity. Gratuity will be charged to credit card on file.

story:
DIY 3-Pin car dock kit for you Galaxy Nexus!


Sweet, my phone's got 3 pin connectors on the side!

If you own a Galaxy Nexus, I'm sure you were like I was, excited to hear about the 3 pin connectors on the side of the phone. That excitement quickly died off when we saw that the docks that Verizon was selling for the Galaxy Nexus did not come with pogo pins to charge our phone. The dock is really nice, but you still need to unplug and plug in the phone every time you need to take it off and on the dock. 

 

GSM Car Dock

The GSM version of the Galaxy Nexus has this type of dock available in Europe and is slowly making it's way to the US. When it finally does get here, it's expected to be priced around $60-$80 (http://www.clove.co.uk/official-vehicle-dock-samsung-galaxy-nexus-ecs-k1f2begstd)  The GSM Car Dock with pogo pins is not compatible with the LTE version of the Galaxy Nexus and there are rumors that Verizon is not going to support the pogo pins so we may never even see this dock.

 

 

So it's up to us then...

This is when I decided to take things into my own hands, literally. I saw that there were a few people that have already done a similar mod in online forums, so I knew it would be possible. The only thing was that to get the parts, you need to order direct from the manufacturers which have a minimum order of 1,000! 

 

Need funding!

So I decided to start an Indiegogo project for all of those Verizon customers that would like try this mod out for themselves and save them the trouble of trying to find the right pieces to make it work. If we can get enough supporters, these parts will be available to anyone, not just big companies. 

 

So, exactly what are we talking about here?

In this DIY kit you not only get the pogo pins that will work with your phone but also a pogo pin holder which will space out the 3 pins perfectly so that they will line up with the connectors on the side of your phone. All you need to do is take out a bit of the rubber with a dremel from your dock and pop in the holder with the pogo pins inside. They are then soldered to 2 pieces of wire which are embeded inside the rubber of the case by making 2 slits. This makes it practically invisible once you're done. The wires are then soldered to a micro USB receptacle that you will attach to the back of the dock. 

 

 

Smart, programable dock

You will also receive a programmable NFC sticker that you can hid inside of the dock (behind the "Samsung" cover). This will let you program your dock to do a variety of things once the phone is docked. It can launch apps, adjust settings, etc...

You can purchase the official Samsung Dock in Amazon for about $30 which doesn't have the 3-pins. http://www.amazon.com/Samsung-ECS-K1F8BEGSTA-Verizon-Galaxy-Nexus/dp/B006NYP61K/ref=sr_1_1?ie=UTF8&qid=1337128515&sr=8-1

story:
Brand Story

 

 

How would a smartphone look in the future?

This is a question without an answer.

 

In the ever-changing world of consumer technology, customers’ demands and needs are always changing. As time passes, we realize that looking back is often much simpler than predicting the future. As we can’t see the future, why not focus on the present?

 

Messy cables, headphones, opening a sim slot with a tiny pin … all these daily hassles are part of our current life now.

 

We believe life is too short to waste time on dealing with things like that. That’s why we’ve created the world’s first holeless and seamless smartphone, to set you free from the restraints.

 

Media Coverage

 

Design philosophy

 

In the world of design, we often talk about trends. And trends are always changing. From the Empire State Building, an iconic building of the modern age to the minimalist home for contemporary arts centre; the elaborate and intricate design in the past has been replaced by minimalism. The industrial design has shifted to a user-friendly ergonomics approach.

 

As one of the industry innovators, we have been wondering if seamlessness is the big picture for future smartphone design.

 

The answer is yes, but that’s not all.

 

Driven by our passion for minimalism and our unbound minds, we’ve brought the Meizu zero to life. With timeless aesthetics and an all-screen ceramic 3D design, Meizu sets you free from tangled cables and seamlessly highlights your personality.

 

Our R&D Journey

 

 

Ceramic Unibody Design

 

In today’s digital age, technology is placed on a glowing box, with design that isn’t so much tangible, but about the feeling it invokes. With the incredible evolution of smartphone design in recent years, our devices are becoming increasingly portable and versatile, but its design is still evolving, and no one has given a glance into the future smartphone.

 

We’ve created the Meizu zero; a truly uninterrupted design. With the hope to embracing minimalism to the extreme and realise our unbound ideas, we’ve finalized an all-screen ceramic 3D design after countless sleepless nights and prototypes. We believe zero is a perfect illustration of “mobility”, “seamlessness” and “ergonomics”, it brings the revolutionary technology from future to the present.

 

To ensure signal stability, the hardness and texture, Meizu zero is uniquely crafted from premium ceramic material. From the initial injection molding to the final AF coating, the zero has undergone multiple CNC machining process and repeated polishing. Multiple 3D arc grinding and polishing steps are used to create smooth edges, and the seamless integration from the fuselage to the curved OLED panel, presenting you the absolutely stunning quality.

 

Virtual Side Button

 

To achieve a genuinely uninterrupted design, removing all physical buttons is the only solution.

 

Adopting “Pressure Sensing Technology”, Meizu zero has created virtual side buttons that power on or off the phone, as well as adjust volume, with just a touch. Virtual button not only relieves pressure on the edge frame, it also tackles the issue of unintentional touches and smoothing its way to earn a better waterproof rating.

 

For many users, traditional buttons offer haptic feedback, and our virtual side buttons provide the same tactile feedback via with our mEngine 2.0 linear haptic engine.

 

 

Product Highlights

 

 

Super mCharge Wireless

 

We didn’t just want to give users wireless charging, we wanted to give them fast wireless charging, as long wait times for a phone to top up can be annoying.

 

Unlike the traditional wired fast charging, fast wireless charging can only be achieved through high voltage and low current. But how to guarantee the high-voltage energy is transmitted from the base?

 

With Meizu’s Super mCharge, 3-level buck and charge pump technology, zero delivers a constant voltage output at 18W, a breakthrough in wireless charging from the hardware level. We are pleased to introduce you “Super mCharge Wireless”.

 

High-speed Wireless USB

 

Due to the characteristics of high-speed data transmission, USB has moved into the mainstream technical standard for Smartphones. With just a data cable, user can seamlessly transfer files between phones and PCs. But bringing in an uninterrupted design with an unparalleled data transmission experience is our mission, therefore, zero opts for wireless USB.

 

The phone features a built-in wireless chip with a specification of 60GHz,plus a dedicated charging base, our wireless USB technology can handle the same bandwidth rates of USB 3.0.

 

What’s more, the wireless ship embedded with an independent OS and SoC micro system, so even the device is unable to boot due to firmware errors,a user can still override and rewrite the phones boot log via Wireless USB.

 

mSound 2.0 In-Screen Sound Technology

 

The Meizu zero features mSound 2.0 In-screen Sound Technology which allows the display to function like a speaker and an earpiece.

 

The sound waves are generated by the vibrations and propagated through the air. Thanks to the efforts of our technicians, the Sound Technology allows you to simply put your ear against the screen for the crystal-clear audio output. Transforming the display into a call receiver also helps us to bring in a true holeless screen.

 

The mSound 2.0 In-screen Sound Technology also transforms the entire front display into an external speaker, it prevents dust from trapping in the speaker and mic grills for better sound quality.

 

By optimizing the internal structure, adjusting the layout and choosing quality materials, Meizu zero delivers outstanding audio quality and unmatched levels of sound.

 

IP68 Certified Dust & Water Resistance

 

As a daring concept mobile phone, the Meizu zero has no physical bezels and notches, smoothing its way to earn an IP68 rating. The Meizu zero can withstand accidental submersion up to 2 meters underwater for up to 30 minutes. Attributed to its precision craftsmanship, underwater photography or videography is no longer limited by water, only your imagination.

 

eSim Support

 

To achieve a true uninterrupted design, the zero also eliminated the SIM tray too. The zero instead supports eSIM, a breakthrough in mobile technology. It eliminates the hassle of changing sim cards; with the digital management capability, users can efficiently manage multiple devices which significantly improving the user experience.

 

In-display Fingerprint

 

Meizu never compromises design over user-experience, to minimize the thickness of zero and to remove all bezels, the zero comes with an in-display fingerprint scan under its the AMOLED display. With the game-changing optical fingerprint sensor, you can unlock the phone just by placing a finger on the display.

 

Flyme 7

 

Flyme OS is a customized mobile operating system developed by Meizu for smartphones based on the Android Operating System, offering users an excellent interactive experience and intimate online services. The new Flyme 7 has inherited the gorgeous yet simple design of Flyme, and has been further upgraded with design details and interactive experiences. The new AI engine One Mind adds a plethora of useful features, making the AI system even smarter.

 

Specification

 

Dimensions

149.75*74.27*7.85

Specifications

Snapdragon 845, IMX380+IMX350

Network

GSM：B2/B3/B5/B8

WCDMA：B1/B2/B5/B8

TD-SCDMA：B34/B39

CDMA：BC0

TD-LTE：B34/B38/B39/B40/B41

FDD-LTE：B1/B3/B4/B5/B8/B2/B7/B20

 

Our Company

 

About Meizu

 

Meizu was founded in 2003 with the headquarters based in Zhuhai, China, a rising technology powerhouse. We create simple yet intuitive mobile devices with a minimalist design to say more by showing less; we are committed to offering unmatched customer experience in a user-friendly way.

 

We’ve expanded our footprints in the smartphone market since 2008, driven by the passion for minimalism and the unbound mind, we are dedicated to presenting Smartphones with the best in class performance plus aesthetics and value. 

 

Striving for perfection has always been and is still the declared aim of Meizu, and we see our brand as an obligation to provide quality, service, sustainability and to lead innovation.  We invest heavily in R&D for a technological breakthrough while exploring the boundaries of minimalism. Meizu demonstrates the collaborative spirits by gathering over 1000 in-house staff and 600 retail stores; today, Meizu is one of the leading Smartphone manufacturers in China with a global presence.

 

Our Team

 

Timeline

 

 

FAQ

 

1. How to contact our team?

For enquiries or suggestions, contact us at mzcs@meizu.com

Website: https://www.meizu.com/en/

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/meizu

Twitter: https://twitter.com/MEIZU

Instagram: Instagram.com/meizutech

 

2.Crowdfunding Period

We plan on running the Meizu zero campaign from January, 30th to March 1st, 2019

 

3. What is included in the package order?

1x Meizu zero

1x Wireless charging base

1x Instruction manual

 

4. Does it support wired cable charging?

No, a wireless charging base is required.

 

5. Does it support other wireless charging bases？

It works with all Qi wireless charging bases but fast charging can only be activated by the included Meizu charging base.

 

6. How to transfer data between devices?

You can transfer files at high speed with our wireless charging base which includes a USB-C output cable. But transferring data via Bluetooth is also supported.

 

7. When will my order arrive?

We'll ship in April 2019, and keep you updated on shipping information and make sure that your order will be delivered promptly.
story_txt: Brand Story  How would a smartphone look in the future?This is a question without an answer. In the ever-changing world of consumer technology, customers’ demands and needs are always changing. As time passes, we realize that looking back is often much simpler than predicting the future. As we can’t see the future, why not focus on the present? Messy cables, headphones, opening a sim slot with a tiny pin … all these daily hassles are part of our current life now. We believe life is too short to waste time on dealing with things like that. That’s why we’ve created the world’s first holeless and seamless smartphone, to set you free from the restraints. Media Coverage Design philosophy In the world of design, we often talk about trends. And trends are always changing. From the Empire State Building, an iconic building of the modern age to the minimalist home for contemporary arts centre; the elaborate and intricate design in the past has been replaced by minimalism. The industrial design has shifted to a user-friendly ergonomics approach. As one of the industry innovators, we have been wondering if seamlessness is the big picture for future smartphone design. The answer is yes, but that’s not all. Driven by our passion for minimalism and our unbound minds, we’ve brought the Meizu zero to life. With timeless aesthetics and an all-screen ceramic 3D design, Meizu sets you free from tangled cables and seamlessly highlights your personality. Our R&D Journey  Ceramic Unibody Design In today’s digital age, technology is placed on a glowing box, with design that isn’t so much tangible, but about the feeling it invokes. With the incredible evolution of smartphone design in recent years, our devices are becoming increasingly portable and versatile, but its design is still evolving, and no one has given a glance into the future smartphone. We’ve created the Meizu zero; a truly uninterrupted design. With the hope to embracing minimalism to the extreme and realise our unbound ideas, we’ve finalized an all-screen ceramic 3D design after countless sleepless nights and prototypes. We believe zero is a perfect illustration of “mobility”, “seamlessness” and “ergonomics”, it brings the revolutionary technology from future to the present. To ensure signal stability, the hardness and texture, Meizu zero is uniquely crafted from premium ceramic material. From the initial injection molding to the final AF coating, the zero has undergone multiple CNC machining process and repeated polishing. Multiple 3D arc grinding and polishing steps are used to create smooth edges, and the seamless integration from the fuselage to the curved OLED panel, presenting you the absolutely stunning quality. Virtual Side Button To achieve a genuinely uninterrupted design, removing all physical buttons is the only solution. Adopting “Pressure Sensing Technology”, Meizu zero has created virtual side buttons that power on or off the phone, as well as adjust volume, with just a touch. Virtual button not only relieves pressure on the edge frame, it also tackles the issue of unintentional touches and smoothing its way to earn a better waterproof rating. For many users, traditional buttons offer haptic feedback, and our virtual side buttons provide the same tactile feedback via with our mEngine 2.0 linear haptic engine.  Product Highlights  Super mCharge Wireless We didn’t just want to give users wireless charging, we wanted to give them fast wireless charging, as long wait times for a phone to top up can be annoying. Unlike the traditional wired fast charging, fast wireless charging can only be achieved through high voltage and low current. But how to guarantee the high-voltage energy is transmitted from the base? With Meizu’s Super mCharge, 3-level buck and charge pump technology, zero delivers a constant voltage output at 18W, a breakthrough in wireless charging from the hardware level. We are pleased to introduce you “Super mCharge Wireless”. High-speed Wireless USB Due to the characteristics of high-speed data transmission, USB has moved into the mainstream technical standard for Smartphones. With just a data cable, user can seamlessly transfer files between phones and PCs. But bringing in an uninterrupted design with an unparalleled data transmission experience is our mission, therefore, zero opts for wireless USB. The phone features a built-in wireless chip with a specification of 60GHz,plus a dedicated charging base, our wireless USB technology can handle the same bandwidth rates of USB 3.0. What’s more, the wireless ship embedded with an independent OS and SoC micro system, so even the device is unable to boot due to firmware errors,a user can still override and rewrite the phones boot log via Wireless USB. mSound 2.0 In-Screen Sound Technology The Meizu zero features mSound 2.0 In-screen Sound Technology which allows the display to function like a speaker and an earpiece. The sound waves are generated by the vibrations and propagated through the air. Thanks to the efforts of our technicians, the Sound Technology allows you to simply put your ear against the screen for the crystal-clear audio output. Transforming the display into a call receiver also helps us to bring in a true holeless screen. The mSound 2.0 In-screen Sound Technology also transforms the entire front display into an external speaker, it prevents dust from trapping in the speaker and mic grills for better sound quality. By optimizing the internal structure, adjusting the layout and choosing quality materials, Meizu zero delivers outstanding audio quality and unmatched levels of sound. IP68 Certified Dust & Water Resistance As a daring concept mobile phone, the Meizu zero has no physical bezels and notches, smoothing its way to earn an IP68 rating. The Meizu zero can withstand accidental submersion up to 2 meters underwater for up to 30 minutes. Attributed to its precision craftsmanship, underwater photography or videography is no longer limited by water, only your imagination. eSim Support To achieve a true uninterrupted design, the zero also eliminated the SIM tray too. The zero instead supports eSIM, a breakthrough in mobile technology. It eliminates the hassle of changing sim cards; with the digital management capability, users can efficiently manage multiple devices which significantly improving the user experience. In-display Fingerprint Meizu never compromises design over user-experience, to minimize the thickness of zero and to remove all bezels, the zero comes with an in-display fingerprint scan under its the AMOLED display. With the game-changing optical fingerprint sensor, you can unlock the phone just by placing a finger on the display. Flyme 7 Flyme OS is a customized mobile operating system developed by Meizu for smartphones based on the Android Operating System, offering users an excellent interactive experience and intimate online services. The new Flyme 7 has inherited the gorgeous yet simple design of Flyme, and has been further upgraded with design details and interactive experiences. The new AI engine One Mind adds a plethora of useful features, making the AI system even smarter. Specification Dimensions149.75*74.27*7.85SpecificationsSnapdragon 845, IMX380+IMX350NetworkGSM：B2/B3/B5/B8WCDMA：B1/B2/B5/B8TD-SCDMA：B34/B39CDMA：BC0TD-LTE：B34/B38/B39/B40/B41FDD-LTE：B1/B3/B4/B5/B8/B2/B7/B20 Our Company About Meizu Meizu was founded in 2003 with the headquarters based in Zhuhai, China, a rising technology powerhouse. Meizu demonstrates the collaborative spirits by gathering over 1000 in-house staff and 600 retail stores; today, Meizu is one of the leading Smartphone manufacturers in China with a global presence. Our Team Timeline  FAQ 1. Does it support other wireless charging bases？It works with all Qi wireless charging bases but fast charging can only be activated by the included Meizu charging base. 6. How to transfer data between devices?You can transfer files at high speed with our wireless charging base which includes a USB-C output cable. story:
Imperial Code Cylinder / USB-Stick

What is this all about?

As part of the 501st Legion (biggest Star Wars costuming club worldwide) I wanted to do an imperial officer costume. Part of the costume are the so called “imperial code cylinders”. In the first three Star Wars movies (1977-1983) they used radiation dosimeters, but today these dosimeters are very rare and hard to come by and most of the time very expansive, so I thought about creating a replica and when I took the dimensions I realized that it had the perfect size for an USB-stick. In-universe the code cylinders are for data transportation and security codes – a perfect fit if you ask me!

About me & the project:

My Name is Andreas Laube and I’m from Germany. I’m part of the 501st Legion (biggest Star Wars costuming club worldwide) and a huge Star Wars Fan.

I just want to do this and already put much effort into this project, but I can’t do it all on my own. The molds for the stick and production-costs (almost all manufacturers start production at a minimum of 500 pieces when it comes to metal usb-sticks) are very expansive for one person alone and I just don’t have that amount of money at hand. So I asked my friends and members of the 501st Legion if they’d be interested in an USB-Stick like that and the feedback was very positive!


But I’m sure there are more Star Wars fans out there who’d be interested in this, so I decided to make it public and available for everyone.

I’ve got many offers from different companies and I decided the 16GB / USB 2.0 version has the best price performance ratio. This will be a replica / costuming-piece and I see the USB-feature as a little gimmick!

USB-Stick specifications:

Dimensions:   65mm (2.56”) long / 15mm (0.6”) in diameter [plus the clip]
USB-Standard:  USB 2.0
Capacity:   16GB
Material:  metal

Perhaps it is even possible to add a small light-up feature if attached to a device (blue ring), we’ll see!


Project-plan:
I’ve arranged everything, so if we hit the goal I’ll let production start. This will most likely take about 4-6 weeks, so I could ship the sticks early in December. My plan is to everyone get their USB-Sticks before Christmas 2013! If we don’t hit the goal, everybody gets their money back and nothing happens… :/

Perks:
Prices for shipping and handling not included, please add the appropriate amount (see below).


Shipping & handling:
Every USB-Stick comes in a separate case with a certificate of authenticity. The case is filled with foam to fit the USB-stick exactly for secure transportation. Blueprints come in clear plastic folder.

Shipping-costs:
Germany:   5,00€ (~ $6.70) [including insurance & tracking]
international:  6,50€ (~ $8.60) [including insurance & tracking]

prices are for packages up to max. 8 USB-Sticks! If you want more, double the shipping costs.

Other:
If I've forgotten anything or you have a question, feel free to ask!
Tell your friends & fans, use the share-buttons and spread the word ;)

story:
The creators of the WiPy are back!

So, what are we saying? The LoRa, WiFi and BLE Micro controller and LoRa Nano gateway for enterprise grade connected Things. With the latest chipset the LoPy offers a perfect combination of power, friendliness and flexibility. Create and connect your things everywhere. Fast. 

We have created a hardware platform with four times the memory of previous generation micro controllers, three wireless network types, a product that can act as a LoRa nano gateway allowing you to connect up to 100 LoPy's. Create your own little private network and become a neighbourhood hero! When used as a private nano gateway, it will connect your other LoRa devices up to 5km however expect up to 40km range (when in line of sight) when connecting your LoPy to a LoRa gateway of a network provider! 

LoPy Benefits 

★LoRa Nano gateway or just LoRa/WiFi/BLE device – you choose ★ MicroPython enabled, use "the Linux of IoT" to achieve speedy developments ★ super small and light to fit in any cavity★ Ever so low power to enable years of battery life so there’s no need for new nuclear power stations to run millions of LoPys ★ What’s more… With dozens of ready to use templates and much more added options, now you can create almost anything that comes to your mind. Combination of advanced content importers, different layouts, header styles, post types,… gives you a freedom and control you have never seen before. And you can do it all with the new Pymakr IDE. 

★ARDUINO IDE COMPATIBLE 
(See more details below)

★ Want to know more about LoRa? Check the FAQ here.

Mechanical 

LoPy Size: 55mm x 20mm x 3.5mm (without headers).
Expansion Board Size: 65mm x 50 mm x 12mm. 

★Dual processor (each core running @ 160 MHz) + WiFi + BLE radio System on Chip.
★Network processor handles the WiFi/BLE connectivity and the IPv6 and IPv4 stacks. 
★Main processor entirely free to run the user application along with the LoRa stack. 

Memory 

★ RAM: 400 Kbytes.
★ Internal Flash = 1MByte 
★ External Flash = 4MByte 
★ GPIO: Up to 24 (3.3V tolerant)

Interfaces 

★ 2 x UART, SPI, I2C, DMA, I2S (audio playback).
★ Internal chip antenna and u.fl connectors for external antennas.
★ Surface mountable and also available with male headers. 

Timers

★ 16-bit and 32-bit timers with PWM.

ADC and DAC

★ 12-bit ADC and 8-bit DAC.

Hash and Encryption engines 

★ SHA  ★ MD5 ★ DES ★ AES 

Power 

★ Input: 3.3V - 5.5V.
★ Wi-Fi:12 mA in active mode, 5uA in standby. 
★ LoRa: 3mA in active mode, 39mA during Tx, 14mA during Rx. 

Bluetooth

★Bluetooth Smart: Both standard Bluetooth and BLE supported.
★BLE: 8mA in active mode, 2uA in standby. 

LoRa Specification

★ Semtech LoRa transceiver SX1272. 
★ LoRaWAN stack.
★ Class A and C devices. 

Operating Frequencies

★ 868 MHz. 
★ 915 MHz. 

Range Specification

★ Node range: Up to 40km (when in line of sight). 
★ Nano-Gateway: Up to 5 km (when in line of sight). 
★ Nano Gateway Capacity: up to 100 nodes.

Networking

★ WiFi: 802.11b/g/n 16Mbps. 

RTC (Real Time Clock) 

★ Of course, running @32.768KHz

DMA (Direct Memory Access)

★ All over the place.

Security

★ WEP, WPA/WPA2 WiFi security. 
★ SSL/TLS support.
★ AES encryption engine.

Compatible with 

★Blynk libraries available.
★IBM Bluemix Binomium Ready (4 months FREE data management for LoPy backers).
★Microsoft Azure ready.
★Pymakr IDE.

Certifications

★EMC
★CE
★FCC
★LoRa WAN

★Dimensions: 65mm x 50 mm x 12mm.★USB to serial converter.★LiPo battery charger with JST connector.★Push-push MicroSD card socket. ★3 Female headers, compatible with the LoPy and the WiPy.★User led and user push button.★Battery charge monitoring.★Lots of jumpers to enable/disable functionality. 

External antenna.
★RF Cable Assemblies SMA(F) JK-IPEX MHF U.FL 1.13 100MM
★SMA Tilt Swivel 1/2 Wave Whip antenna

Frequencies will depend on region. 

Power Hungry? 

We don’t think so. No need for new nuclear power stations to power the LoPys of this world. In fact, we’re quite confident we have a product that is mirroring the WiPy's SUPER GREEN CREDENTIALS as the LoPy consumes only: 

★0.1% of Raspberry Pi B+
★1.5% of the Arduino Mega
★5.27% of a Particle Photon

This is great news if you want to create something that is connected for longer periods and powered with a battery.


And what if you could build your own LoRa network?

Here is the clever part, you can use the module to switch a comms signal from WiFi to LoRa (and vice versa) thus making the LoPy both a LoRa Receiver / Transmitter and a Nano gateway capable of handling comms with up to 100 other LoRa nodes! This means you can go and create your own LoRa network for you, your friends or just your Things! No monthly bills for connectivity. All you need to turn the LoPy into a LoRa Nano Gateway is a LoPy kit including antennas, a power supply and fingers to type in some code. The way it works is illustrated below: 

We will provide the Python library needed to make the LoPy operate as a nano gateway and let you run your own private (or not, share it with your friends!) network.

We will supply more information about how to get the LoPy working as a nano gateway before the shipments in August 2016.

MicroPython is the Linux of IoT 

The rapid-results microcontroller scripting language of the future. Simple, powerful and fit for purpose, this nifty new open source scripting language came about to replace long winded programming that is overkill for microcontrollers, a key component for electronics based products. MicroPython leverages the existing Python 3.4 design and optimizes it for microcontrollers to enable a lighter, faster and better coding environment that both programmers and hardware developers can use with ease. Pycom continues and will continue to fund the development of core MicroPython features to ensure they stay Open Source. 

MicroPython and LoRa:We think MicroPython makes developing super fun!

And then … All those hardware specs are awesome, but it get’s better still. The LoPy is really easy to use, because we have written a powerful and intuitive IDE – the Pymakr to make it even easier for you to program in your browser and load straight to the LoPy (read on for more information on Pymakr).

Pymakr connects automatically to your WiPy or LoPy via the serial or Telnet Server, runs your code on the fly, manages the internal file system, synchronizes your code instantly and runs it with just one click. It also takes care of firmware upgrades and includes a built in console that interfaces with the MicroPython REPL. Features code completion, static analysis, PEP8 style checking and a built-in interactive prompt. Pymakr is the one and only tool you'll ever need to develop on the WiPy and LoPy.

PyMakr will be open source and we will release it right after the campaign is finished.

LoPy will also be compatible with THE ARDUINO IDE.

MicroPython forum
WiPy Documentation
Contact Pycom: support@pycom.io

IMPORTANT NOTE: You need to make sure you have an antenna kit and a power supply to be able to make the LoPy work. The antenna kits we supply are outlined above but you can also source your own.

ANOTHER ALSO IMPORTANT NOTE: LoPy backers will be offered 4 months of FREE use of the IBM Bluemix Binomium platform after shipment in August 2016.

There are loads of cool stuff you can build with the LoPy. Here’s a few examples of what you’d need.

And there’s tons more to do. You have the choice of three different types of wireless networks which means it’s really easy to connect to your home WiFi, your mobile phone or a city or country-wide LoRa Network. 

Here's an example of an IP64 LoPy enclosure unit with the external antenna Kit. All these items will be available for sale on the Pycom webshop.

Your imagination is the only limit.

What is LoRa? LoRa is a Low Power Wide Area Network (LPWAN) specification intended for wireless battery operated Things. LoRaWAN meets the key requirements of Internet of Things such as secure bi-directional communication, mobility and localization services. This standard will provide seamless interoperability among smart Things without the need for complex local installations and gives back the freedom to the user, developer, businesses enabling the role out of Internet of Things. Public Networks are being rolled out across the globe by organisations such as SENET (USA), ThingsNetwork (Europe and USA), TATA (India), KPN (Europe), Bouygues (France), Swisscom, Proximus and in addition to that there are a number of private LoRa networks being set up including some run by main universities. 

The benefits of LPWAN is that it is specifically designed for M2M and able to reach devices in remote areas, indoors or underground, with a long battery life – often over 10 years from a single AA battery.

Oh… and did we say we have friends? From our side, we have teamed up with a few network providers and joined the LoRa Alliance to achieve certification for the LoPy. 

For instance, we found a company as passionate as ourselves, SENET, based out of Boston, USA. In fact, they are so keen to support our developer community that they have agreed for each Pycom developer to connect (free of charge for non commercial applications) 2 LoPy devices onto their networks! At present they have deployed over 100,000 square miles of network coverage across the US with concentrations in the Northeast, the Midwest, and California. During 2016, network deployment will continue on an aggressive pace including deep coverage in the innovation districts of greater Boston and the San Francisco Bay area.

So if you are lucky enough to live in those regions then try connecting to the Senet network! Elsewhere, you can connect to the OpenSource network “The Things Network” whom also happen to be Dutch…. They have/will have coverage in the following cities: 

Sao Paolo (Brazil), Cape Town (South Africa), Buenos Aires (Argentina), Kochi (India), Port of Rotterdam / Rotterdam / Amsterdam / Flevoland/ Groningen / Eindhoven / Friesland / Den Haag / Utrecht / Maastricht (Holland), Zurich (Switzerland), Poznan (Poland), Montreal / Ottawa / Kanata (Canada), Montevideo (Uruguay), Perth (Australia), Mexico City (Mexico), Belfast (Ireland), Austin / Boston (US), Milan (Italy), Johannesburg (South Africa), Huesca (Spain), Copenhagen (Denmark), Dunedin (New Zealand), and Thatcham / Calderdale / Manchester (UK). 

And if you live elsewhere… be a NEIGHBORHOOD Hero and use your LoPy as the LoRa nano gateway to see how many ‘Things’ you can connect in a 5KM radius! Mmmhhh could be a nice little competition here… more on that later in the year.

★ Kickstarter Campaign Start 02 February 2016
★ Kickstarter Campaign Close 08 March 2016
★ Manufacturing July 2016

★ Shipping to Backers August 2016 

Meet the stars of the LoPy Kickstarter video Fred and Daniel who run Pycom on a day-to-day basis with the help of the extended team.

 We're so grateful to everyone who helped us along the way.
story_txt:
The creators of the WiPy are back!
So, what are we saying? 
The LoRa, WiFi and BLE Micro controller and LoRa Nano gateway for enterprise grade connected Things. With the latest chipset the LoPy offers a perfect combination of power, friendliness and flexibility. Create and connect your things everywhere. Fast. 
We have created a hardware platform with four times the memory of previous generation micro controllers, three wireless network types, a product that can act as a LoRa nano gateway allowing you to connect up to 100 LoPy's. Create your own little private network and become a neighbourhood hero! When used as a private nano gateway, it will connect your other LoRa devices up to 5km however expect up to 40km range (when in line of sight) when connecting your LoPy to a LoRa gateway of a network provider! 
LoPy Benefits 
★LoRa Nano gateway or just LoRa/WiFi/BLE device – you choose ★ MicroPython enabled, use "the Linux of IoT" to achieve speedy developments ★ super small and light to fit in any cavity★ Ever so low power to enable years of battery life so there’s no need for new nuclear power stations to run millions of LoPys ★ 

What’s more…
With dozens of ready to use templates and much more added options, now you can create almost anything that comes to your mind. Combination of advanced content importers, different layouts, header styles, post types,… gives you a freedom and control you have never seen before. And you can do it all with the new Pymakr IDE. 
★ARDUINO IDE COMPATIBLE  (See more details below)
★ Want to know more about LoRa? Check the FAQ here.








LoPy's rich features


Mechanical 
LoPy Size: 55mm x 20mm x 3.5mm (without headers).Expansion Board Size: 65mm x 50 mm x 12mm. 



Only a fraction bigger than a LEGO brick...Processing


★Dual processor (each core running @ 160 MHz) + WiFi  + BLE radio System on Chip.★Network processor handles the WiFi/BLE connectivity and the IPv6 and IPv4 stacks. ★Main processor entirely free to run the user application along with the LoRa stack. 
Memory 
★	RAM: 400 Kbytes.★ 	Internal Flash = 1MByte ★	External Flash = 4MByte ★ 	GPIO: Up to 24 (3.3V tolerant)
Interfaces 
★ 	2 x UART, SPI, I2C, DMA, I2S (audio playback).
★ 	Internal chip antenna and u.fl connectors for external antennas.
★ 	Surface mountable and also available with male headers. 
Timers
★ 16-bit and 32-bit timers with PWM.
ADC and DAC
★ 12-bit ADC and 8-bit DAC.
Hash and Encryption engines 
★	SHA  ★	MD5 ★	DES ★	AES 
Power 
★ Input: 3.3V - 5.5V.★ Wi-Fi:12 mA in active mode, 5uA in standby. ★	LoRa: 3mA in active mode, 39mA during Tx, 14mA during Rx. 
Bluetooth
★Bluetooth Smart: Both standard Bluetooth and BLE supported.★BLE: 8mA in active mode, 2uA in standby. 
LoRa Specification
★	Semtech LoRa transceiver SX1272. ★	LoRaWAN stack.
★	Class A and C devices. 
Operating Frequencies
★	868 MHz. ★	915 MHz. 
Range Specification
★	Node range: Up to 40km (when in line of sight). ★	Nano-Gateway: Up to 5 km (when in line of sight). ★	Nano Gateway Capacity:  up to 100 nodes.
Networking
★	WiFi: 802.11b/g/n 16Mbps. 
RTC (Real Time Clock) 
★	Of course, running @32.768KHz
DMA (Direct Memory Access)
★	All over the place.
Security
★	WEP, WPA/WPA2 WiFi security. ★	SSL/TLS support.★	AES encryption engine.
Compatible with 
★Blynk libraries available.★IBM Bluemix Binomium Ready (4 months FREE data management for LoPy backers).★Microsoft Azure ready.★Pymakr IDE.
Certifications
★EMC★CE★FCC★LoRa WAN





★Dimensions: 65mm x 50 mm x 12mm.★USB to serial converter.★LiPo battery charger with JST connector.★Push-push MicroSD card socket. ★3 Female headers, compatible with the LoPy and the WiPy.★User led and user push button.★Battery charge monitoring.★Lots of jumpers to enable/disable functionality. 



The LoPy Expansion Board.










Fitting the LoPy Expansion board is child's play.







External antenna.★RF Cable Assemblies SMA(F) JK-IPEX MHF U.FL 1.13 100MM
★SMA Tilt Swivel 1/2 Wave Whip antenna



LoPy Antenna Kit...an antenna and a cable...


Frequencies will depend on region. 
Power Hungry? 
We don’t think so. No need for new nuclear power stations to power the LoPys of this world. In fact, we’re quite confident we have a product that is mirroring the WiPy's SUPER 
GREEN CREDENTIALS as the LoPy consumes only: 
★0.1% of Raspberry Pi B+
★1.5% of the Arduino Mega
★5.27% of a Particle Photon
This is great news if you want to create something that is connected for longer periods and powered with a battery.







And what if you could build your own LoRa network?
Here is the clever part, you can use the module to switch a comms signal from WiFi to LoRa (and vice versa) thus making the LoPy both a LoRa Receiver / Transmitter and a Nano gateway capable of handling comms with up to 100 other LoRa nodes! This means you can go and create your own LoRa network for you, your friends or just your Things! No monthly bills for connectivity. 
All you need to turn the LoPy into a LoRa Nano Gateway is a LoPy kit including antennas, a power supply and fingers to type in some code.

The way it works is illustrated below: 



LoRa Nano Gateway Overview


We will provide the Python library needed to make the LoPy operate as a nano gateway and let you run your own private (or not, share it with your friends!) network.
We will supply more information about how to get the LoPy working as a nano gateway before the shipments in August 2016.





MicroPython is the Linux of IoT 
The rapid-results microcontroller scripting language of the future. Simple, powerful and fit for purpose, this nifty new open source scripting language came about to replace long winded programming that is overkill for microcontrollers, a key component for electronics based products. MicroPython leverages the existing Python 3.4 design and optimizes it for microcontrollers to enable a lighter, faster and better coding environment that both programmers and hardware developers can use with ease.
Pycom continues and will continue to fund the development of core MicroPython features to ensure they stay Open Source. 










MicroPython and LoRa:We think MicroPython makes developing super fun!



LoRa in MicroPython example







And then …
All those hardware specs are awesome, but it get’s better still. The LoPy is really easy to use, because we have written a powerful and intuitive IDE – the Pymakr to make it even easier for you to program in your browser and load straight to the LoPy (read on for more information on Pymakr).
Pymakr connects automatically to your WiPy or LoPy via the serial or Telnet Server, runs your code on the fly, manages the internal file system, synchronizes your code instantly and runs it with just one click. It also takes care of firmware upgrades and includes a built in console that interfaces with the MicroPython REPL. Features code completion, static analysis, PEP8 style checking and a built-in interactive prompt.

Pymakr is the one and only tool you'll ever need to develop on the WiPy and LoPy.
PyMakr will be open source and we will release it right after the campaign is finished.
LoPy will also be compatible with THE ARDUINO IDE.





MicroPython forumWiPy DocumentationContact Pycom: support@pycom.io
IMPORTANT NOTE: You need to make sure you have an antenna kit and a power supply to be able to make the LoPy work. The antenna kits we supply are outlined above but you can also source your own.
ANOTHER ALSO IMPORTANT NOTE: LoPy backers will be offered 4 months of FREE use of the IBM Bluemix Binomium platform after shipment in August 2016.







There are loads of cool stuff you can build with the LoPy. Here’s a few examples of what you’d need.



Need an Alarm for a remote shed?





or need to monitor your pet frog?





...and how about a remote light switch for those dark nights?





Or a remote control for your robot butler?


And there’s tons more to do. You have the choice of three different types of wireless networks which means it’s really easy to connect to your home WiFi, your mobile phone or a city or country-wide LoRa Network. 
Here's an example of an IP64 LoPy enclosure unit with the external antenna Kit. All these items will be available for sale on the Pycom webshop.



IP64 enclosure with LoPy, expansion board and antenna kit...and lid.


Your imagination is the only limit.





What is LoRa? 
LoRa is a Low Power Wide Area Network (LPWAN) specification intended for wireless battery operated Things. LoRaWAN meets the key requirements of Internet of Things such as secure bi-directional communication, mobility and localization services. This standard will provide seamless interoperability among smart Things without the need for complex local installations and gives back the freedom to the user, developer, businesses enabling the role out of Internet of Things.
Public Networks are being rolled out across the globe by organisations such as SENET (USA), ThingsNetwork (Europe and USA), TATA (India), KPN (Europe), Bouygues (France), Swisscom, Proximus  and in addition to that there are a number of private LoRa networks being set up including some run by main universities. 
The benefits of LPWAN is that it is specifically designed for M2M and able to reach devices in remote areas, indoors or underground, with a long battery life – often over 10 years from a single AA battery.
Oh… and did we say we have friends? From our side, we have teamed up with a few network providers and joined the LoRa Alliance to achieve certification for the LoPy. 



Yes, it's official, we joined.


For instance, we found a company as passionate as ourselves, SENET, based out of Boston, USA. In fact, they are so keen to support our developer community that they have agreed for each Pycom developer to connect (free of charge for non commercial applications) 2 LoPy devices onto their networks! At present they have deployed over 100,000 square miles of network coverage across the US with concentrations in the Northeast, the Midwest, and California.  During 2016, network deployment will continue on an aggressive pace including deep coverage in the innovation districts of greater Boston and the San Francisco Bay area.





So if you are lucky enough to live in those regions then try connecting to the Senet network! 

Elsewhere, you can connect to the OpenSource network “The Things Network” whom also happen to be Dutch…. They have/will have coverage in the following cities: 
Sao Paolo (Brazil), Cape Town (South Africa), Buenos Aires (Argentina), Kochi (India), Port of Rotterdam / Rotterdam / Amsterdam / Flevoland/ Groningen / Eindhoven / Friesland / Den Haag / Utrecht / Maastricht (Holland), Zurich (Switzerland), Poznan (Poland), Montreal / Ottawa / Kanata (Canada),  Montevideo (Uruguay), Perth (Australia), Mexico City (Mexico), Belfast (Ireland), Austin / Boston (US), Milan (Italy), Johannesburg (South Africa), Huesca (Spain), Copenhagen (Denmark), Dunedin (New Zealand), and Thatcham / Calderdale / Manchester (UK). 
And if you live elsewhere… be a NEIGHBORHOOD Hero and use your LoPy as the LoRa nano gateway to see how many ‘Things’ you can connect in a 5KM radius! Mmmhhh could be a nice little competition here… more on that later in the year. 





★	Kickstarter Campaign Start		02 February 2016
★	Kickstarter Campaign Close		08 March 2016
★ Manufacturing July 2016



Our manufacturing facility busy practicing for July runs.


★	Shipping to Backers		             	August 2016 

  






Meet the stars of the LoPy Kickstarter video Fred and Daniel who run Pycom on a day-to-day basis with the help of the extended team.









 We're so grateful to everyone who helped us along the way.

story:
Short Summary

The Infinite Frame is the lamp that helps setting the appropriate atmosphere in the room by simply using your iPhone or Android phone.

The Infinite Frame is the smart IoT Lamp designed and developed by the small group of people who enjoy working with modern technologies. In our group there are 10 people mostly with engineer background.

Since this is a long term project, here you can see our first commercial attempt :)  

First commercial

The Infinite Frame is a part of the much larger picture that we are working on,  the IoT wear for devices. The IoT Wear is an extension for regular home (it is not restricted to home) devices that turns them to smart devices connected to the internet. The Infinite Frame Lamp is controlled using one of those IoT Wear controllers.

 It is extremely important for us that this campaign succeed because that is the complete minimum for the development of the IF Lamp, in the first place and than IoT Wear controllers as a independent device, in the second. Without your help it would be very difficult. If this campaign succeed, after we deliver the lamps, our plan is to upgrade the lamp controller to this, much powerful IoT wear devices. And of course, you, our helpers will be the first one who will be informed and provided with this upgrade.   

The Infinite Frame

Set the ambient in the room

With The Infinite Frame you can easily set up any atmosphere you like in the room and just enjoy..

Use the smart phone to set the color on the lamp or to project any picture.


Do the Harlem Shake

:)


Infinite Frame + MindWave Mobile (The NeuroSky device)

This task was very challenging for our team because, like almost every other people on this planet, we think that mind control represent state of the art in IT industry. But, that is just what is interesting in research.

After some time of trying we managed to do the mind control. This was possible because both of the devices, the Infinite Frame and MindWave Mobile, are constructed in that way that they can be easily connected to any other available device. You just need to have a little bit of programming skills.

Maybe in the video it is not clear enough what we are doing here. We are controlling the lamp by reading the attention level and the level of meditation that MindWave can read. If the attention level goes below some predefined value on the lamp is shown a sad face, and if the attention level is above that level, the Infinite Frame shows a smile face. So, this could be really interesting for the classroom. The professor could monitor the attention level of the troubled student and the lamp could inform him about the current state. :)

The whole communication scheme looks like this:


The Infinite frame lamp - light of the future

The time has come to adapt all devices we use to our needs in such a way we even couldn’t imagine few years ago. We live in a time of M2M systems and Internet of Things progress. It is a very exciting time for the developers and researchers. It is estimated that over 50 billion of devices will be connected to the Internet by 2020. The IF lamp is one of those smart devices that uses the opportunities that modern technology (IoT) provides us. Additionally, the IF lamp is beautifully designed. The light used by the lamp represents Led lighting technology, the most energy-efficient light that exist. Having the possibility of choosing any of the 16 million colors, this product can offer you any light- appearance you like. Furthermore, with 36W Led lights, you’ll have enough room brightness.

Connection to the Internet

One of the most important things that characterizes our lamp is its ability of the Internet connection. The Infinite Frame has a Wi-Fi interface that enables Internet connectivity as well as a DHCP server that enables direct communication between the lamp and other devices, in case local area network is not available. We have a HTTP server running on the lamp that allows easy communication at the application level of IP stack. But, as we are the research team on the first place, we are testing some other possibilities, like CoAP server that uses UDP protocol on the link layer of the IP stack and CoAP protocol on the application layer. Connection to the Internet (when you start the lamp for the first time) is very easy, with the help of our short and simple instruction for setting up your home Wi-Fi network. After connection is set, there are many options available, either using your PC, Smartphone or Tablet. This functionality provides the possibility to control the lamp via the Internet. So, you can set up the atmosphere in the room in the simplest way. With lot of the web services available on the Internet our lamp can use many cool stuff, such as weather forecast, live score of your favorite team, mail, Facebook and Twitter notifications, exchange rates, and many more.

Internet of Things (IoT)

Over the past few years, the Internet of Things has emerged as one of the most interesting concept of the Future Internet. Enabling a range of new applications, it is based on constrained networks, i.e. networks of devices with limited computing, memory and energy capabilities. Typical constrained devices are characterized by severe limits on throughput, available power, and particularly on the complexity that can be supported with limited code size and limited RAM per node. The Internet of Things is foreseen as direction in which all technological progress will move toward in order to provide novel application scenarios.

Although IF Lamp is not limited with computational power and memory and it is assumed that the energy is not the problem, the IF Lamp is a proper IoT device.

During the IoT day in Belgrade, on the 09.04.2013, the IF Lamp is presented as one of the interesting IoT device.

We represented here the connection between, one also very popular device, MindWave Mobile and the Infinite Frame.

http://pcpress.rs/internet-of-things-dan-u-beogradu/

Hardware

For our prototype version we have used ARM based Linux computer to control the lamp. Our choice at the moment is Raspberry Pi, but we keep the option open to introduce some similar platform in our final product, because the production of such platforms is very popular and there is a possibility that some better and cheaper platform appears by the end of the campaign. At the moment, we have a microphone and temperature sensors connected to the board, but adding a new sensor is a very simple process. As a matter of fact, at the moment we are working on connection of the lamp with additional sensors, such as proximity sensor, presence sensor and so on. We've left open the option of adding the additional sensors for advanced users.

Software

We have a REST Web Server running on the Linux embedded platform that enables control over the net. It is written in Python language. Also, we have made our C and Python software for the IF Lamp usage. The code is written to be lightweight and modular in order to be able to add or remove some functionalities without influencing the other parts of the code. Because this is a REST web server, it allows as easy adding new interfaces.

Application

Fully featured FREE IF Lamp app, designed by our team, will be available on the Google Play and iTunes. Using the IF Lamp app, you will be able to set many different modes for the lamp. You’ll be able to set the color for entire lamp, set the color for every specific field, dim the light, run some cool widgets (that shows current temperature, runs the VU meter that follows the music rhythm, use the stroboscope, use timer, counter and alarm, etc), show pictures (with possibilities to zoom in some part of the picture), define favorites, use predefined color mix, use predefined animations (starry night, light show, etc), play some simple games (like Tic Tac Toe or puzzle) and similar things.

Web Platform

The Web Platform gathers community of the IF Lamp and, beside possibility to connect to some cool custom web services with the Lamp, it provides the opportunity to share idea about the IF Lamp’s pictures. There are a number of web services that anyone could use and connect to them with the Lamp, like weather forecast, score of your best team match, exchange Rates, world time and many more. The IF Lamp provides the opportunity to share and exchange ideas about your lamp. You can set some cool color mix on your lamp and share that with the IF community. So, if you like some picture, you just download it to your phone and project it on the IF Lamp. We are expecting from you to give us some new and good ideas about how to build a better and nicer lamp.

Beautiful design

While developing the design for IF lamp we followed the philosophy of minimalism. We consider that the simple geometric forms are the best solutions for the product that provides a number of technical possibilities. It’s not necessary that the chassis has complicated shape, because the best way for this technology to come to the fore is by simple and light forms. The fact that the lighting mode gives desired characteristics to the lamp is the reason why it fits anywhere. Of course, this lamp is designed to be simple for turning on (plug and play) and to be easily placed on the wall.

What can you do with IF Lamp?

  • illuminate the room by any of the 16 millions colors
  • dim the light 
  • enjoy in many offered animations
  • be creative and make your own animations
  • control the light by sound 
  • control the lamp with eeg device from NeuroSky (MindWave Mobile)
  • add an alarm (time when and what do you want to show on the lamp)
  • use the stroboscope for the dance party
  • use the light show for the dance party 
  • adjust the atmosphere by showing some of the favorite pictures
  • be creative and make your own pictures
  • play simple games
  • see the room temperature 
  • follow the Internet information (Facebook, mail and Twitter notification, weather forecast, score of the game, exchange Rates…) 

Team

    - Vlada Dimcic - Mechanical Engineer
    - Toma Dimcic - IT Engineer
    - Vladimir Jovanovic - Electrical Engineer
    - Sonja Dimcic - Architect
    - Spirovski Goran - IT Engineer
    - Spirovski Bojan - IT Engineer, Designer
    - Aleksandar Dobric - Mechanical Engineer
    - Vladimir Bokan - Mobile phone developer
    - Miroslav Maletic - director of photography
    - Rasko Miljkovic - director

How far have we reached?

Having done some prototypes, we've finally got the final hardware (architecture), software, and also the final lamp appearance. In regard to hardware, we started with Raspberry Pi  then considered some solutions, and now we are working on the development of the Microchip PIC microcontroller. We developed software to that point so it can perform all functions we need. We still need to develop the “modularity”, to increase the number of devices that will be compatible with software, to develop web platform that will allow you to share with the rest of world your photos, applications, etc.

Manufacturing plan (production)

Our manufacturing plan is divided into three parts: 
   1. manufacturing of tools and plastic parts 
   2. supplying of all outsourcing parts 
   3. putting together

1. Designing the tools and finding the companies that can make our product within the planned period of time has already been done. If we raise enough money, all we need is to create tools and move on with manufacturing. 
2. We've found some companies all around the world that can build for us some electronic components we need. We've already checked their business, now we only need to visit outsourcers, if we get enough funds, in order to make sure that they are capable of delivering the goods we need within the planned period of time. 
3. We've already organized the people and the space, so in very short period of time we can put together a great number of final products. Each lamp will be tested, before being sent, in order to make sure we are not sending broken product. Also, the package for lamps will protect them from damaging as arriving to your address.

Perks

The Infinite Frame Mini (2x2 cells)

  • dimension: 16x16cm 
  • 12 RGB LED with 16 million colors 
  • 4 LED driver chips  
  • 1 IoT Wear controller
  • Power supply input 220v or 110v, output 12V 0.5A


The Infinite Frame (7x7 cells) 

  • dimension: 56x56cm
  • 147 RGB LED (or less with the same power) with 16 million colors (36W) 
  • 49 LED driver chips  
  • 1 IoT Wear controller
  • Power supply input 220v or 110v, output 12V 3.5A

The Infinite Frame (7x7 cells) + MindWave Mobile   

  • dimension: 56x56cm  
  • 147 RGB LED (or less with the same power) with 16 million colors (36W)  
  • 49 LED driver chips   
  • 1 IoT Wear controller
  • Power supply input 220v or 110v, output 12V 3.5A 
  • MindWave Mobile (NeuroSky EEG device)
  • Special application that allows communication between the MindWave and The Infinite Frame

MEGA Infinite Frame (28x21 cells)   

  • dimension: 224x168cm 
  • 1764 RGB LED (or less with the same power) with 16 million colors (288) 
  • 588LED driver chips 
  • 1 IoT Wear controller
  • Power supply

Other Ways You Can Help

Please, if you are not in the position to purchase the lamp and help in that way, send an e mail to everybody who could help or blog about this. Send the information to any of your friends from social networks.

At the moment, we have a microphone and temperature sensors connected to the board, but adding a new sensor is a very simple process. As a matter of fact, at the moment we are working on connection of the lamp with additional sensors, such as proximity sensor, presence sensor and so on. We've left open the option of adding the additional sensors for advanced users.SoftwareWe have a REST Web Server running on the Linux embedded platform that enables control over the net. It is written in Python language. Also, we have made our C and Python software for the IF Lamp usage. The code is written to be lightweight and modular in order to be able to add or remove some functionalities without influencing the other parts of the code. Because this is a REST web server, it allows as easy adding new interfaces.ApplicationFully featured FREE IF Lamp app, designed by our team, will be available on the Google Play and iTunes. Using the IF Lamp app, you will be able to set many different modes for the lamp. You’ll be able to set the color for entire lamp, set the color for every specific field, dim the light, run some cool widgets (that shows current temperature, runs the VU meter that follows the music rhythm, use the stroboscope, use timer, counter and alarm, etc), show pictures (with possibilities to zoom in some part of the picture), define favorites, use predefined color mix, use predefined animations (starry night, light show, etc), play some simple games (like Tic Tac Toe or puzzle) and similar things.Web PlatformThe Web Platform gathers community of the IF Lamp and, beside possibility to connect to some cool custom web services with the Lamp, it provides the opportunity to share idea about the IF Lamp’s pictures. There are a number of web services that anyone could use and connect to them with the Lamp, like weather forecast, score of your best team match, exchange Rates, world time and many more. The IF Lamp provides the opportunity to share and exchange ideas about your lamp. You can set some cool color mix on your lamp and share that with the IF community. So, if you like some picture, you just download it to your phone and project it on the IF Lamp. We are expecting from you to give us some new and good ideas about how to build a better and nicer lamp.Beautiful designWhile developing the design for IF lamp we followed the philosophy of minimalism. We consider that the simple geometric forms are the best solutions for the product that provides a number of technical possibilities. It’s not necessary that the chassis has complicated shape, because the best way for this technology to come to the fore is by simple and light forms. The fact that the lighting mode gives desired characteristics to the lamp is the reason why it fits anywhere. Of course, this lamp is designed to be simple for turning on (plug and play) and to be easily placed on the wall.What can you do with IF Lamp?
illuminate the room by any of the 16 millions colors
dim the light 
enjoy in many offered animations
be creative and make your own animations
control the light by sound 
control the lamp with eeg device from NeuroSky (MindWave Mobile)
add an alarm (time when and what do you want to show on the lamp)
use the stroboscope for the dance party
use the light show for the dance party 
adjust the atmosphere by showing some of the favorite pictures
be creative and make your own pictures
play simple games
see the room temperature 
follow the Internet information (Facebook, mail and Twitter notification, weather forecast, score of the game, exchange Rates…) 
Team    - Vlada Dimcic - Mechanical Engineer    - Toma Dimcic - IT Engineer    - Vladimir Jovanovic - Electrical Engineer    - Sonja Dimcic - Architect    - Spirovski Goran - IT Engineer    - Spirovski Bojan - IT Engineer, Designer    - Aleksandar Dobric - Mechanical Engineer    - Vladimir Bokan - Mobile phone developer    - Miroslav Maletic - director of photography    - Rasko Miljkovic - directorHow far have we reached?Having done some prototypes, we've finally got the final hardware (architecture), software, and also the final lamp appearance. In regard to hardware, we started with Raspberry Pi  then considered some solutions, and now we are working on the development of the Microchip PIC microcontroller. We developed software to that point so it can perform all functions we need. We still need to develop the “modularity”, to increase the number of devices that will be compatible with software, to develop web platform that will allow you to share with the rest of world your photos, applications, etc.Manufacturing plan (production)Our manufacturing plan is divided into three parts:    1. manufacturing of tools and plastic parts    2. supplying of all outsourcing parts    3. putting together1. Designing the tools and finding the companies that can make our product within the planned period of time has already been done. If we raise enough money, all we need is to create tools and move on with manufacturing. 2. We've found some companies all around the world that can build for us some electronic components we need. We've already checked their business, now we only need to visit outsourcers, if we get enough funds, in order to make sure that they are capable of delivering the goods we need within the planned period of time. 3. We've already organized the people and the space, so in very short period of time we can put together a great number of final products. Each lamp will be tested, before being sent, in order to make sure we are not sending broken product. Also, the package for lamps will protect them from damaging as arriving to your address.PerksThe Infinite Frame Mini (2x2 cells)
dimension: 16x16cm 
12 RGB LED with 16 million colors 
4 LED driver chips  
1 IoT Wear controller
Power supply input 220v or 110v, output 12V 0.5A
The Infinite Frame (7x7 cells) 
dimension: 56x56cm
147 RGB LED (or less with the same power) with 16 million colors (36W) 
49 LED driver chips  
1 IoT Wear controller
Power supply input 220v or 110v, output 12V 3.5A

The Infinite Frame (7x7 cells) + MindWave Mobile   
dimension: 56x56cm  
147 RGB LED (or less with the same power) with 16 million colors (36W)  
49 LED driver chips   
1 IoT Wear controller
Power supply input 220v or 110v, output 12V 3.5A 

MindWave Mobile (NeuroSky EEG device)
Special application that allows communication between the MindWave and The Infinite Frame
MEGA Infinite Frame (28x21 cells)   
dimension: 224x168cm 
1764 RGB LED (or less with the same power) with 16 million colors (288) 
588LED driver chips 
1 IoT Wear controller
Power supply

Other Ways You Can HelpPlease, if you are not in the position to purchase the lamp and help in that way, send an e mail to everybody who could help or blog about this. Send the information to any of your friends from social networks.

story:
CLINCH - A love story

Today, most people protect their mobile phones from breaking or getting lost during a fall via cases, bumpers, wallets and next hangers. One could think that is strange given how precious and important our phones have become to most of us, but given the lack of flexible, discrete and good looking accessories that our in the market today, it actually isn’t that weird. CLINCH fills this gap. It simply helps you and your phone to stay together.

Today, I work for an FMCG company for a living – but as I got tired of either losing my phone or being generally scared to do so, I came up with CLINCH. In my opinion, it offers an easy solution to make sure your phone is safely attached in e.g. your pocket while skiing, sailing, climbing etc. – or simply in your everyday life. If you think so as well, I would be extremely happy if you backed me via one of the perks. And remember, without your help, your phone will never get the opportunity to fall in love with CLINCH. 

                                  

 It is better to be clinched than sorry

To make the product more apprehensive, imagine the following scenario; You are standing in deep snow, or sitting the chair lift, while at ski vacation – you want to take a photo or/and call a friend to decide where to eat you lunch. In both cases, you will bring out your phone out of your pocket or bag knowing that if you drop it, it will be lost in the snow. With Clinch, you will have clinched your phone in your jacket, pants or bag, and while you can still be flexible to move it around due to the roller, the phone will be attached in a secure way in case you drop it. Cause hey – it is better to be clinched than sorry. 

Clamp + reel + eyelet

Clinch combines an adjustable clamp, a highly durable roller and an eyelet.

The eyelet enables multiple alternatives for how to connect the Clinch to your phone:

1) Attach your phone directly to the Clinch via the eyelet (clinch base unit only): 

2)  Attach your iPhone 3,4 or 5 to the Clinch via a dock connector that is attached via the eyelet (CLINCH with iPhone connector):

3)  Attach your phone to the Clinch via a waterproof pouch – compatible with all phones (CLINCH with WP):

The production is ready to get started

Today, I have developed a 3D prototype, patented CLINCH as a trademark and created promotional videos to present the latest version. I have also found my partner in crime in terms of modeling and am ready to get the production started outside of Stockholm. Yes – CLINCH will be a product born and raised Swedish.

If everything goes according to plan (plus a bit a buffer to not let my backers down via a delay), I expect your CLINCH to be in your hands 6 months from now (if my project will succeed). But don’t worry, CLINCH is still a great Christmas gift to friends and family since I have designed a special voucher that is included in the Christmas edition. On top of being a perfect Christmas gift, CLINCH is also a very suitable give-away for companies (please contact me at info@clinch.org for more details). The rebate mechanism is easy; buy 1 get -10%, buy 2 get -15%, buy 3 get -20%, buy 5 get -25% and buy 10 and get -30% discount vs. retail price.      

This is me

I took a Master of Science in Technology Management from Lund University in Sweden 2009, and have been working as a financial analyst and within sales in the FMCG industry since. This project bridges my competence as an analyst, sales person and my strong belief in the need for CLINCH as a product.

Other Ways You Can Help

From what I have understood, the most important thing to succeed with a crowd funding project is to create A LOT of noise. There are several ways of doing so by sharing this campaign with your friends and family via Facebook, Twitter, Instagram or Youtube. You can easily use Indiegogo’s share tools!  Please use the hash tag #clinch whenever you communicate. 

Last but not least – a massive THANK YOU for your help and support to make CLINCH come alive.
