story:
The ultimate house for Pi

Raspberry Pi’s are fantastic – but when you want to use them in a standalone application that requires some kind of display and a keyboard with maybe some extra USB ports and access to the LAN port then things can get a bit messy.

You'll need to find a housing and a display and figure out some way to keep everything connected and hide all the wires and decide where to store the keyboard when it’s not being used and then how to keep all the various power supplies for the Pi, the display, the speaker amp and the USB hub from being unplugged three months down the line.

And this often ends up looking like the pictures below.

There are a number of great looking housings on the market but nothing that is specifically designed to house your Pi and make it look like a finished, all in one desktop style product with a built in screen, keyboard and speakers and access to the communication connectors that Pi provides.

Imagine then your Pi, almost as an appliance, standing on a desktop or counter. It’s beautiful and neat in white and grey with a brilliant 7” (800 x 480) HDMI LCD display angled perfectly for viewing.

It is unobtrusive but big enough - the size of an open A5 booklet with the screen filling the top half and the spill proof and washable keyboard filling the bottom half.

It’s your energy monitor or your home automation system, your internet of things manager or your ZX Spectrum, your media player or games console, the instant messaging device that you give to your parents, or your weather station, or pretty much everything else that a Pi can be. And now on top of it – it’s really nicely packaged too.

PiKasa is the ultimate Pi housing that can be used initially for Pi versions 1 and 2 and the A, B and B+ versions of these and in our next release, also for the Pi Compute module.


So how does it work ?

PiKasa is a really high quality injection molded ABS housing that has the following already fitted :

  • 7” (800 x 480) colour TFT LCD with HDMI interface
  • Keyboard with a splash proof silicon rubber keymat overlay and 4 hotkeys aligned to the screen
  • Interconnect board that has a built in 12v to 5v power converter, Li-ion battery charger, USB hub (to give you 5 external USB ports), LAN hookup, audio hookup with onboard amplifier and loudspeakers, Raspberry Pi power hookup and HDMI interface circuitry to drive the LCD
  • Carrier bracket to hold your Raspberry Pi inside the housing

All you need to do to get your PiKasa powered up is connect the internal cables on the interconnect board to your Raspberry Pi, press fit your Pi onto the internal HDMI connector and fit two holding screws to retain the Pi in the correct position. 

Then replace the back cover, connect power and switch on the device at the integrated power switch and your Pi is an instant appliance, running whichever applications you have loaded on your SD card.


What we need and What you get

We need to upgrade the LCD technology and hardware platform of one of our exisitng products that we deploy to provide content and controlled internet services to schools in South Africa.

To be able to do this we need to be able to afford the tooling changes needed to the injection molding tools as well as the implementation of the new hardware platform for all the content that is now available.

By creating PiKasa, we hope to be able to get the support needed to make these changes and at the same time be able to offer a really nice, world first product to the Raspberry Pi community.

Our perks are all based around the Pikasa product and we are offering some really fantastic discounts for everyone that jumps in early to support us.


So how did this come about ?

For the last few years we have been deploying a product into some South African schools that we call Streetwise. Have a look at www.thecontentcompany.co.za for some ideas on what we have been doing.

The technology that we developed about 5 years ago was developed in my previous company which sadly had to shut down just as Streetwise was almost ready to launch. I took over the IP and the product and my small team completed the development that was needed to launch the product into the market where it has been used very successfully at a small number of schools around the country.

The technology that we originally used was based around a monochrome 5” LCD and connectivity was provided via GPRS to cater for the lack of 3G services at the time. We now need to update our technology to cater for more cost effective colour TFT LCD’s as well as the far superior onboard content and connectivity that is now readily available.

To do this, our strategy is to first see if there is a enough of a need for PiKasa (the standalone Pi appliance housing), and if there is, then use this as the mechanism to make the changes needed to the injection molding tools and the changes needed to our hardware to be able to create the next version of our product.

If we can get enough support for our Pikasa project then not only will we be able to afford the tooling changes needed to bring this great housing to the market, but we will also be able to upgrade the technology in our Streetwise product and take this great educational project to the next level.

This means that the potential impact of this project is huge, not only for the Pi community but also for the 20,000 plus schools in South Africa that have zero connectivity to the internet or the great educational content freely available.

The state of play

We have built a working prototype in order to prove the concept and test that everything can be fitted into the housing as anticipated.

We have also been able to confirm the appropriateness of the 7” LCD and check that it provides a great display quality in terminal mode as well as when running a full graphical interface (OS or Application).

The changes needed for the tooling have all been designed in principle and have been discussed with our tooling and plastics manufacturing partner in Hong Kong (we have a 10 year working relationship with them).

We have selected a partner to work with for the supply of the LCD and we have sourced the HDMI controller circuitry and components needed for integration onto our PCB.

We have designed the individual blocks of circuitry needed for the USB hub, power supply and control, battery charger and onboard audio and have been able to fix the physical locations of the various connectors and pushbuttons needed.

The hook up cables to connect the Raspberry Pi to our interface board have all been defined and specified and have been put out for quoting.

And lastly we have designed the changes needed to our current keyboard PCB  and sourced the components required for it to operate as a standard USB device.


Timing and Challenges

The campaign will end around the middle of April 2015 and if we are successful then we intend to immediately start implementing the hardware design of the PiKasa interconnect PCB (that the Raspberry Pi will be fitted to) and the changes needed to the injection molding tools for the new LCD.

 

We have a lot of experience with taking products through the development and manufacturing process over the past 25 years and we do not expect any problems with this project, although the timeline is tight and does not cater for any unforseen delays.

All going according to plan, we will be shipping in August 2015 and you can expect to receive delivery of your PiKasa housings in early September.

The plastic components are manufactured in Hong Kong by a company we have worked with for over 10 years. Most of the electronic components are sourced from suppliers in the USA, Europe and China and the everything is manufactured, integrated and tested in South Africa at our world class third party manufacturing partners.

For final product delivery to your door, we will be using a fulfillment partner in the USA as well as in Europe or other regions if needed as this will be more reliable and will cost less.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you aren't in a position to purchase one of our fantastic PiKasa housings but can appreciate how it can be used to turn your Pi into a beautiful product or stunning appliance, then please use the Indiegogo share tools to tell your friends and other Pi community members about our project.


Frequently Asked Questions

Here are a few questions and answers that we think will be useful. If you have any other questions or comments or suggestions then please feel free to contact us.

1 : How does the Raspberry Pi connect to the LCD ?

Through the HDMI port on the Raspberry Pi. We have an HDMI connector on our PCB and a driver chip and circuitry to drive the LCD directly from the HDMI port. This way, you don't lose any I/O's and you get superb HDMI quality on your 7" LCD.

2 : Will my config file need changes ?

In most cases you will need to add a few lines to the config file to setup up the display function correctly. We will make these available to you.

You will also need to change your audio output settings to force the audio to use the stereo jack and not the HDMI plug.

3 : Will it work with all models ?

It will work with all models (Version 1 and 2 and Models A, B and B+). It will not work directly with the Pi Compute module but later we will release a version that can be used with this module.

4 : Is there a product spec sheet available ?

Yes, in the Image Gallery there is a document image with the basic product specification.

5 : Must I always add shipping ?

Yes please. We have different rates for different areas of the world.

story:
Tablet For Professional Use

Tablets have become part of our life, we all play games, browse Internet and watch videos on them...

... but how about professional use?

The people most often complain about:

  • The screen is too small. At the very least it should be able to accomodate A4-size documents without scaling them down.
  • It is not very convenient for tablets to exchange files with desktop or laptop PCs. Many file formats are not supported by tablets. Sending documents back and forth via the cloud does take a considerable time.
  • The tablet can hardly be used as a desktop replacement. Connecting various peripherals to the tablet is not easy.

We, Gembird Europe, have designed our tablet, trying to address these issues...

Some Like It BIG!

Our tablet has a large 13.3" screen (with resolution of 1600 x 900 pixels). A4-size documents can fit this screen entirely without having to be scaled down. And of course browsing Internet or watching videos also involves much less zoom and scroll, zoom and scroll...

FAQs (Frequently Asked Questions):

Q: How heavy is the tablet?

A: This tablet is just over 1 kg (net weight).  

Q: In the video I have seen that A4-size document fits the screen vertically but not quite horizontally?

A: Indeed the screen is a little bit narrower than the A4-size. However our software is able to remove the empty margins from the document sides automatically. The document then does not have to be scaled down at all to fit on the screen.

 

E-printer Function

E-printer function was first introduced by us for an e-Ink screen device and won an innovation award at CES Las-Vegas in 2012. More international awards followed...

 

What is E-printer function?

  • Connect our tablet to any PC or MAC and it will be recognized as a printer.
  • Print afterwards any document (or send any file using context menu) with wired connection or wirelessly. Note: the colors of the original document will be preserved in the printout.
  • Make remarks on the document on the tablet.
  • Send the document back and it would appear on the managing computer.

What are the advantages of E-printer function?

  • E-printer is useful for any business process where the paper is used to store
    information for a limited period of time. It is then a ready solution for this process which does not require any changes in existing software etc.
  • E-printer is especially useful for checklists, proofreading and business meetings.
  • E-printer would bring savings both in printing costs (cartridges, paper) and processing time (printing goes much faster).
  • E-printer is a green paperless solution.

FAQs (Frequently Asked Questions):

Q: Is E-printer some kind of app?

A: Actually it is not. The tablet is recognized by any PC or MAC as a printer, on a hardware level. This is achieved by our own, customized Android kernel. Of course we supply drivers for PC and MAC and some printout management/editing apps as well. 

Q: I understand that I can always print my documents onto the tablet but what if I need to transfer the original file? Should I still use the cloud?

A: No, you can use the context (right mouse button) menu on your computer to send an orbitrary file to the tablet. Just choose the option Send to E-printer from the menu and the file will appear in the Document Manager on the tablet. If your tablet is connected to the computer, then the file will be transferred via the USB cable, otherwise the document will be sent via the cloud. In any case no more handling will be required from you. Note: with E-printer software you can keep using the tablet when it is connected to your computer.

Q: What if I wish to transfer the file from the tablet back to my PC? How do I do that?

A: Just use the scanner icon in the Document Manager on your tablet. Again, the file would travel either via the USB cable or wirelessly. A pop-up window on your PC will then contain the returned file to let you save or process it.

Docking Station

With our docking station the tablet can be transformed into a full desktop PC within a flash. The handle at the back of the docking station can be turned to place the tablet horizontally...

or vertically...

 

Just pre-wire your favorite connections to the docking station, slide the tablet in and you are done!

FAQs (Frequently Asked Questions):

Q: Will I be able to charge the tablet in the docking station as well?

A: Yes, just connect your power supply to the docking station in advance. In the docking station the tablet will be charged much faster than without it (since it is using fast-charge connectors then).

Android Tablet

Just like any ordinary tablet our product will let you browse the Internet, watch videos and play games. Empowered with Android 4.1 operating system you will be able to download and use thousands of apps.

With G-sensor the screen orientation will be automatically adjusted to desktop or landscape mode as you turn the tablet.

Use two cameras (front and rear) to take photos or make Skype calls.

The USB connector will allow you to either connect your tablet to a desktop or laptop PC (it will then be recognized as a printer) or attach other USB peripherals (directly or via a hub) to the tablet. Note: Bluetooth devices can also be used with this tablet.

MicroSD card would allow you to increase the storage capacity of your tablet (with up to 32GBs).

With HDMI connector you will be able to connect your tablet to a TV set.

Use earphone connector to attach your favorite headset. There are built-in microphone and speaker as well.

Power charging connectors would help you speed up charging of your tablet.

How do you plan to update Android to the newer releases?

FAQs (Frequently Asked Questions):

Q: How do you plan to update Android to the newer releases?

A: Together with the tablet we supply software (for PC and MAC). This software regularly checks our server for updates. Once a new update becomes available, we publish it on our server. The software then downloads the update, informs the user and, if allowed, transfers the update to the tablet where it gets installed automatically. The software updates itself in a similar fashion.

 

Handwriting & Drawing

We deliberately designed the touch panel of our tablet to be of a very high-resolution. With the active, high-precision stylus (supplied with Advanced and Professional models) you will be able to make full use of the big screen for handwriting or drawing purposes.

Battery

Given that our tablet is quite big, we were able to accomodate a decent capacity battery - 12000mAh.

FAQs (Frequently Asked Questions):

Q: What is the battery life( while in use)?

A: The battery will last for at least 8 hours when used intensively and up to 25 days in sleep mode.

Q: How long would it take to fully charge the battery?

A: With our product we supply a 3A power adapter, the time to fully charge (from 0% to more than 90%) the tablet with this charger (with or without the docking station) is around 5-6 hours.

Specifications

Among the contribution options we listed Standard, Advanced and Professional models. All these models share the following specification:

  • Display: 13.3" TFT, resolution: 1600 x 900 pixels
  • Multi-touch capacitive touch panel
  • Operating system: Android 4.1
  • Internal flash drive: 16 GB
  • External storage: MicroSD slot (up to 32 GB)
  • WLAN 802.11b/g/n
  • Bluetooth 2.0
  • USB 2.0 (Micro USB socket), USB host, power charging
  • HDMI mini HD 1080P
  • Earphone 3.5mm stereo jack
  • 2.5mm  AC/DC charger connector
  • Built-in: 3 axis G Sensor, Microphone, Speaker x 1
  • Battery: Lithium 12000 mAh
  • Adapter: Input AC 100-240V 50-60Hz, output DC 5V/3A
  • Power consumption: up to 20 mA in sleep mode, up to 25 days on one full battery charge
  • Net weight: 1.0 kg
  • Dimensions: 347 x 220 x 13 mm
  • Operating temperature: 0 to 40 Celsius degrees
  • Storage temperature: -25 to 70 Celsius degrees

Standard model additional specification:

  • Camera: Front 2.0MP, Rear 5.0MP
  • Processor: RK3066 dual core 1.5 GHz
  • RAM: DDR3 1 GB

    •  

    Advanced model additional specification:

  • Camera: Front 2.0MP, Rear 8.0MP
  • Processor: RK3188 quad core 1.6 GHz
  • GPS
  • RAM: DDR3 1 GB

    •  

    Professional model additional specification:

  • Camera: Front 2.0MP, Rear 8.0MP
  • Processor: RK3188 quad core 1.6 GHz
  • GPS
  • RAM: DDR3 2 GB

    •   

    All the models share the following package content:

    • Tablet
    • Power AC-DC adapter
    • Leather case

     

    • Stylus for Standard model

     

    • Active, high-precision stylus for Advanced and Professional models

     

    • USB cable, 1.5 m

    Professional model also has a docking station included in the package.

    FAQs (Frequently Asked Questions):

    Q: Which model would you recommend to choose?

    A: The answer heavily depends on how you plan to use your tablet. If you do not plan to launch applications which require a lot of CPU power then probably you will be more than happy with the Standard model. Choose Professional model if you plan to use the tablet as the desktop PC. Note: you can order the docking station as a separate option with Standard and Advanced models as well.

    Indiegogo Campaign

    We are ready to arrange mass production. In fact we do not need crowd-funding money for that purpose. We only wish to know if our product is welcome on the market. We prepared special crunchy prices for this Indiegogo campaign. If we fail to reach the funding goal even with these prices, we would not proceed with manufacturing of this product. So please, vote with your contribution for the life of this product!


     

    Gembird was started in 1992 by IT professionals in the Netherlands.  Their vision was to develop proprietary & innovative computer related products that could be integrated with consumer electronics - ahead of its time in the computer/IT convergence.

    Gembird is a visionary solutions provider for the mobile communication devices, entertainment, LED lighting & power management. A dedicated R&D team is busy with a numerous unique (patented) designs/features. Gembird has a solid 20+ years record of innovations and award-winning products being a leading accessories channel provider in Europe. Gembird has a vast manufacturing experience and has an own factory in China. We are ISO-certified and the production follows strict European quality standards.

     

    Thank you very much in advance for your contribution!

    You are helping to make the world a better place!

story:
What is SHOULDY ?

Most of the time we feel defeated to our indecision when we want to choose something...

It is the need to get idea time out of mind. Erstwhile, when every single thing was not online; people would get the idea of friends or acquaintanceship before they buy something. Or after buying they would get the ideas of them, for confirmation!

At the present time is this a little more difficult. Imagine that you need a laptop. You begin the ask the next questions to yourself which u can't answer without help or ideas! Which brand is better? Is it going to meet the need? Is the capacity enough to run my all programs or for all my games...?

Or imagine that you bought a pair of shoes and you need to hear the next from people; "A good choice or well done"...

In short; when you buy something, while you are going to somewhere or when you need an another idea about whatever: SHOULD I = SHOULDY



While you can get the ideas of your friends, you can such also get the comments/ideas of billions who you don't know on SHOULDY.

Through the grouping options, you can choose who is going to see your sharing or question. Alongside you can do all of that anonymous!



Shouldy is preparing to be indispensable and a brand-new platform for everyone who wants to get ideas or confirmation of another people.


An another possibility which makes SHOULDY indispensable is Shouldy talk! Should I talk is a new style of messaging with detailed customizations.

Let's look at it from another angle;

Nowadays we are approaching with a prejudice to everyone who we don't know. We are making the selection of choice through his/her photograph without knowing of he/she is the someone that we can enjoy the conversation! Outmatch or no chance!



SHOULDY is up one's alley exactly at this point! Through Shouldy talk which doesn't classify the people according to external appearance, we give them an opportunity to introduce him/herself before we decide about chatting with.

While we give an another dimension to the sociability, we are and will keeping the focus on modernist innovation with all the new and old tastes in online planet.

Thank you in advance for supporting Shouldy.

Shouldy Team

(We tried to give some basic information about the concept with all the added images.But we have a more modernist and innovator permanent concept.We are ready to bring our idea to life after we've collected enough investment.)

www.shouldy.com  |  www.shouldy.at  |  www.shouldy.be  |  www.shouldy.biz

www.shouldy.co.uk  |  www.shouldy.de  |  www.shouldy.eu  |  www.shouldy.info

www.shouldy.it  |  www.shouldy.mobi  |  www.shouldy.org

story:
Raspberry Pi B+ is Awesome! Now we need an Awesome Case!


How about a case made of solid aerospace-grade aluminium?

Sounds good.

What if we made it black instead of silver or bare metal?

Sounds better.

What if it was anodized to help protect the metal, prevent paint chipping, and prevent corrosion?

This is sounding great!

What if the case features two built-in heatsinks to dissipate heat from the two main processing chips on the RPiB+ board?

It just keeps getting better!

What if it secures everything in place, and finishes off with 4 beautiful stainless steel screws to contrast the slick black anodized coloring to make it presentable?

Awesome!

What if we designed, manufactured, and assembled the case right here in the USA?

How could this possibly get any better?

What if this was all a reality thanks to your backing & support?

That would be incredible, wouldn't it?


Why am I doing this?

Having recently arrived into the raspberry pi scene and finding it very enjoyable, I was finding myself not too thrilled with the case selection available for the current Raspberry Pi B+ model.  Nearly all of the readily available, non-back-ordered cases were plastic, and produced overseas.  This caused me to question the material quality (let alone safety of the material used and potentially non-disclosed) for those cases.  The other option being D.I.Y. projects coming off of someone's 3D printer, which again brings into question durability, and results in production number capacity vs. orders issued, again resulting in a delay.

Given my background in CNC & Sheet metal fabrication (details below), I was finally fed up enough to design and produce my own case!  The community truly needs not only a case that is visually beautiful, but that is also cost effective as well as being produced with quality metal right here in the United States.

What makes this a project doable?

I have nearly 5 year experience in CNC & Sheet metal fabrication as a Production and Quality Control Manager.  Our experience and reputation in the Commercial, Medical and Aerospace Industries is vast and highly regarded.  Also, I'm not some machine operator trying to squeeze parts after-hours or on my break to make a quick buck.  In my role at the company, I control the production tasks and quality control.

This project is being processed just as a standard customer order run would be and will be given hands on by almost the entire staff.  I have the support of a full machining and sheetmetal shop with over 100 yrs combined experience, ready and at my disposal for both prototyping and mass manufacturing of this project.

What makes this venture different than similar crowd-funded projects?

Most CNC approaches to this type of application that we've seen utilize 1, or a small number of manual drills and manual CNC milling machines. While there is nothing wrong with this approach, it is very time consuming and drags out production times while also lowering the ability to repeat quality production runs.

My design will be run on Computerized CNC milling machines.  This means significantly faster production times, in larger quantities, with unquestioned ability to achieve the highest quality in each and every batch.

What We Need & What You Get

The target sales price for this case is $40.00 USD plus shipping and handling.

If there is one truth in CNC manufacturing, it is that if the quantity of parts per batch in your runs is not large, the price increases exponentially.  Larger quantity per batch equals lower per-piece cost.

Given that rule,  in order to start this project, the following requirements must be met:

  • The full amount of funding has to be met in order to cover the manufacturing costs of this case in a large enough quantity to satisfy the truth explained above.
  • Higher demand for the case will result in a even higher chance of longer runs and repeat runs funded independently by myself to ensure availability after the needs of the indiegogo campaign is met to make sure everyone can get one of these cases if they want one in the future.

The Impact on local job market

Successfully funding this project will provide a benefit to the local manufacturing community here in California.  None of the funds will be used for anything other than the production of the case.

Computers, Engineering services, Design services, Blueprinting Services, RPI B+ units, and prototype runs have already been accounted for and covered by myself long ago. I am volunteering my "personal" time that has been contributed to  getting this project going without compensation, and will never seek any compensation from the project funding.

During the production time of the case, you will directly cause the following effects in my home town:

  • Ensure employment and optional over-time availability for at least 10-20 factory workers in my shop that are living in Southern California.
  • Ensure employment for an additional 5-10 factory works at the anodizing facility these parts will be sent to.
  • Slightly enhance the local economy in my town as well as generating a small amount of needed tax dollars for the local area

Risks & Challenges

This campaign is to avoid personal financial risk.  $5,000 is a lot of out of pocket expenses for a sole individual on a single income, without any surety that I will see any of it back.  Using ingiegogo provides insurance not only to myself, but because the project will not start if the full goal is not met, it also provides insurance to you:  you will not be charged if it is not successfully (fully) funded.

Only additional challenges foreseen will be production lead time, and international shipping.

- Lead Time will be heavily impacted by the demand for this case, low demand will result in longer lead times. If I have a large demand for this case then lead times will be much lower as the funding for any needed rush processing would be readily available.

- International Shipping will be a challenge as I will need to work with a local shipping facility to accomplish this as it is a large task for any one person, at lease to start out. If this campaign is indeed funded fully International Shipping will be a reality. Otherwise I will need to work with a reseller to make this happen.

The Extra Mile - You win!

If full funding for this campaign is reached and/or exceeded before the end of the campaign period I will go the extra mile myself to make everyone extra happy by kicking in the large volume orders to the manufacturing facility with my own funding to get production started early. 

What does this mean for you? 

This means if you contributed enough to reach "Get 1!" level or beyond you will have the possibility of seeing a tracking number for your new RPI B+ case shortly after the campaign ends instead of in December like listed.

How serious am I about this?

Lets put it this way.. if this campaign manages to double, triple, quadruple the goal, heck or even exceeds by 10,000%  before it ends. Part will -already- be in production and getting prepaird for shippments -before- the campaign ends.


Bitcoin!

Once this Campaign ends I will be accepting payments via traditional processing means. I will also be accepting Bitcoin (BTC) for payment on any size order volume.

Yes this means you can become a supplier and purchase with bitcoin as well if the project is successful and we go into full production mode!

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Some people just can't contribute financially, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

    • Spread the word about our new beautiful, stunning case to your RPi friends and family via social media.

    And that's all there is to it.
story_txt:
Raspberry Pi B+ is Awesome! Now we need an Awesome Case!

How about a case made of solid aerospace-grade aluminium? Sounds good.What if we made it black instead of silver or bare metal? Sounds better.What if it was anodized to help protect the metal, prevent paint chipping, and prevent corrosion?This is sounding great!What if the case features two built-in heatsinks to dissipate heat from the two main processing chips on the RPiB+ board?It just keeps getting better!What if it secures everything in place, and finishes off with 4 beautiful stainless steel screws to contrast the slick black anodized coloring to make it presentable?Awesome!What if we designed, manufactured, and assembled the case right here in the USA?How could this possibly get any better?What if this was all a reality thanks to your backing & support?That would be incredible, wouldn't it? 


Why am I doing this? 
Having recently arrived into the raspberry pi scene and finding it very enjoyable, I was finding myself not too thrilled with the case selection available for the current Raspberry Pi B+ model.  Nearly all of the readily available, non-back-ordered cases were plastic, and produced overseas.  This caused me to question the material quality (let alone safety of the material used and potentially non-disclosed) for those cases.  The other option being D.I.Y. projects coming off of someone's 3D printer, which again brings into question durability, and results in production number capacity vs. orders issued, again resulting in a delay.
Given my background in CNC & Sheet metal fabrication (details below), I was finally fed up enough to design and produce my own case!  The community truly needs not only a case that is visually beautiful, but that is also cost effective as well as being produced with quality metal right here in the United States.

What makes this a project doable?
I have nearly 5 year experience in CNC & Sheet metal fabrication as a Production and Quality Control Manager.  Our experience and reputation in the Commercial, Medical and Aerospace Industries is vast and highly regarded.  Also, I'm not some machine operator trying to squeeze parts after-hours or on my break to make a quick buck.  In my role at the company, I control the production tasks and quality control. This project is being processed just as a standard customer order run would be and will be given hands on by almost the entire staff.  I have the support of a full machining and sheetmetal shop with over 100 yrs combined experience, ready and at my disposal for both prototyping and mass manufacturing of this project.



What makes this venture different than similar crowd-funded projects?

Most CNC approaches to this type of application that we've seen utilize 1, or a small number of manual drills and manual CNC milling machines. While there is nothing wrong with this approach, it is very time consuming and drags out production times while also lowering the ability to repeat quality production runs. My design will be run on Computerized CNC milling machines.  This means significantly faster production times, in larger quantities, with unquestioned ability to achieve the highest quality in each and every batch.
   What We Need & What You Get The target sales price for this case is $40.00 USD plus shipping and handling.
If there is one truth in CNC manufacturing, it is that if the quantity of parts per batch in your runs is not large, the price increases exponentially.  Larger quantity per batch equals lower per-piece cost.
Given that rule,  in order to start this project, the following requirements must be met: 
The full amount of funding has to be met in order to cover the manufacturing costs of this case in a large enough quantity to satisfy the truth explained above.
 Higher demand for the case will result in a even higher chance of longer runs and repeat runs funded independently by myself to ensure availability after the needs of the indiegogo campaign is met to make sure everyone can get one of these cases if they want one in the future.
 
  The Impact on local job market Successfully funding this project will provide a benefit to the local manufacturing community here in California.  None of the funds will be used for anything other than the production of the case.
Computers, Engineering services, Design services, Blueprinting Services, RPI B+ units, and prototype runs have already been accounted for and covered by myself long ago. I am volunteering my "personal" time that has been contributed to  getting this project going without compensation, and will never seek any compensation from the project funding.
During the production time of the case, you will directly cause the following effects in my home town: 
Ensure employment and optional over-time availability for at least 10-20 factory workers in my shop that are living in Southern California.
 Ensure employment for an additional 5-10 factory works at the anodizing facility these parts will be sent to. Slightly enhance the local economy in my town as well as generating a small amount of needed tax dollars for the local area


  Risks & Challenges This campaign is to avoid personal financial risk.  $5,000 is a lot of out of pocket expenses for a sole individual on a single income, without any surety that I will see any of it back.  Using ingiegogo provides insurance not only to myself, but because the project will not start if the full goal is not met, it also provides insurance to you:  you will not be charged if it is not successfully (fully) funded.
Only additional challenges foreseen will be production lead time, and international shipping.
- Lead Time will be heavily impacted by the demand for this case, low demand will result in longer lead times. If I have a large demand for this case then lead times will be much lower as the funding for any needed rush processing would be readily available.
- International Shipping will be a challenge as I will need to work with a local shipping facility to accomplish this as it is a large task for any one person, at lease to start out. If this campaign is indeed funded fully International Shipping will be a reality. Otherwise I will need to work with a reseller to make this happen.
The Extra Mile - You win!
If full funding for this campaign is reached and/or exceeded before the end of the campaign period I will go the extra mile myself to make everyone extra happy by kicking in the large volume orders to the manufacturing facility with my own funding to get production started early. 
What does this mean for you? 
This means if you contributed enough to reach "Get 1!" level or beyond you will have the possibility of seeing a tracking number for your new RPI B+ case shortly after the campaign ends instead of in December like listed.
How serious am I about this?
Lets put it this way.. if this campaign manages to double, triple, quadruple the goal, heck or even exceeds by 10,000%  before it ends. Part will -already- be in production and getting prepaird for shippments -before- the campaign ends.


Bitcoin!Once this Campaign ends I will be accepting payments via traditional processing means. I will also be accepting Bitcoin (BTC) for payment on any size order volume.Yes this means you can become a supplier and purchase with bitcoin as well if the project is successful and we go into full production mode!

  Other Ways You Can Help Some people just can't contribute financially, but that doesn't mean they can't help: 
Spread the word about our new beautiful, stunning case to your RPi friends and family via social media.
 
 And that's all there is to it.

story:
What is LINQ Wearable ChargingCable?

LINQ is a double wrap bracelet power cord that has capabilities of charging your mobile iOS devices to help you stay connected when you are on the go, in a fashionable way.

 

What devices is the LINQ Wearable Charging Cable compatible with?

Currently, LINQ Wearable Charging Cable is only available for iOS devices. It is compatible with iPhone and iPad. We hope to add variety in the future when we achieve our goals.

 

How long does it take The Power Bank charge my device?

It takes 1 hour to recharge your iPhone and iPad, if unused while charging.

 

Can LINQ Wearable Charging Cable also charge your device?

Not yet, we plan to create a fashionable and functional built in technology with charge incorporating with the LINQ in the next iteration.

 

Is the Power Bank an addition?

Yes, the LINQ Ultra Slim Power Bank is an option to add-on and is the perfect portable size to take with you anywhere.

 

How much power does the LINQ Power Bank hold?

The perfect backup, LINQ Charger is a 3600 mAh charger that can produce one full phone charge on your phone.

 

What sizes are available in the LINQ Wearable Charging Cable?

LINQ Wearable Charging Cable comes in a men’s and women’s size. The bracelet is meant to double wrap around the wrist and sizes are S/M for more petite wrists and L/XL for larger wrists.

 

When will I get my LINQ products?

We are excited to offer a pretty quick turnaround on this project. We plan to start shipping LINQ products on October 30th.

 

Does LINQ offer any Wearable Charging Cables that double as USB-C or microUSB cables?

Currently, LINQ only sells bracelets that doubles as a charging cable. However, we are currently working on solutions for non-iPhone users. Stay tuned!

Are LINQ Wearable Charging Cables waterproof?

No, unfortunately, they are not. Please be careful not to water-damage your bracelet, as we are not responsible for replacing water-damaged products.

 Are LINQ Wearable Charging Cable MFi certified?

At the moment, our bracelets are not MFi certified. We do plan on working towards the MFi certification - However, due to increased costs & extended wait times with Apple, it is not a current priority. In the near future, MFi certified bracelets will be available at an increased cost. 

We've been working hard to make sure that our cords are the highest quality possible - and tested prior to shipment. The lightning cords we use have been tested and used in the market for years and have shown very exceptional results in durability and functionality.

In addition, we offer a 90 day guarantee on all LINQ bracelets. If you do have any issues with your bracelet, shoot us an email and we'll be sure to find a resolution as soon as possible. 

Does LINQ offer a warranty?

We at LINQ warrant our products against defects in material or workmanship for a period of ninety (90) days from the original date of purchase of the product by a consumer (the “Warranty Period”). LINQ does not warrant, and is not responsible for, any smartphone or other device made by anyone other than LINQ. If a material or workmanship defect arises with regard to any LINQ product, and a valid claim is received within the Warranty Period, we will at our option: (i) replace the LINQ product with a new product; or (ii) refund the purchase price of the defective LINQ product. In the event of a defect, these are your exclusive remedies.

Except for the limited warranty expressly set forth above or to the extent restricted or prohibited by applicable law, LINQ expressly disclaims any and all other warranties express or implied, including any warranty of quality, merchantability or fitness for a particular purpose and you specifically agree that LINQ shall not be liable for any special, incidental, indirect, punitive or consequential damages for breach of any warranty of any type on any LINQ product. For the avoidance of doubt, the limited warranty does not cover damages that arose from negligence, misuse, wear-and-tear or failure to follow the product instructions (e.g. dropping the product etc.). In addition to and without limiting the generality of the foregoing disclaimers, the limited warranty does not, under any circumstances, cover the replacement or cost of any electronic device (including but not limited to any mobile phone devices) or personal property inside or outside of the LINQ product.

story:
Be apart of something new with the Touch for All

My name is Bojan, and i am an engineer of computer science.

I designed this product because i belive that many of the touch surfaces that exist today are EXPENSIVE, NON AESTETHIC and HARD TO USE.

I belive i can make the Touch for All to be a great looking device that is easy to use and affordable. For that , i need your help. 

I have made arrangements with a factory to build my table and wall design, but i need resources to fund the project.

What I Need for my project

Your contributions will be spent as follows:

  • Manufacturing costs are big for this project because they involve using alluminum and metal CNC machines, 
  • Purchasing computer parts (like motherboards, processors, RAM etc..),
  • Assembling everything into a whole
  • Food and Water for me :)

What my contributors get

As you know every new design is expensive to build.

Especially if you are building it , testing it and distributing it alone.

I appreciate every contributor, and i would like to give everyone a chance to get the device  but i know that wont be possible at start (i will be giving away detailed plans of my prototype for lower contributions so anyone cam make their own Touch for All).

So  i am offering  contributors a chance to own this beautiful device in your own choice (table of wall) at a price of 2600EUR.

If you are good at 3D design , you can make your own design , send it and get a touch surface of your liking with a laser signature.

Challenges

The biggest challenge was the choice of materials and precise milling.

I needed something that was light and easy to shape.

Alluminum and steel felt like the greatest choice.

I learned a lot about CNC milling and i am confident i can make this work.

Other Ways You Can Help

I am aware that not everyone can contribute by donating money.

But you can help by sharing this campain with people you know , using known social networks , email and word of mouth.

I will apreciate all the help i can get and i thank you all.

story:
1.   This amount will help cover research and development costs, promotion and awareness, and travel expenses.

2.   We plan to work with one of the country's top app development companies based in New York City.  

3.   A technical app such as Dispensed2U can take upwards of 18 weeks to build. The process from idea to creation is no small task. There is extensive research, planning, design, development, quality assurance, beta testing and so much more that goes into it.  

4.   We are hiring the best of the best and have some of the most amazing and creative geniuses on board with us.

5.   We will be traveling to Denver and Seattle later this year to talk to dispensaries and promote Dispensed2U, heavily. We will be building a solid foundation with dispensary owners and partnering up as early as the 1st Quarter of 2015. On 4/20/2015, our team will be promoting events in Denver and Seattle to celebrate our official anticipated launch date.


 FEATURED PERK!

AtmosRX Dry Herb Vaporizer Pen - Midnight Black Kit 50% Off Retail Price!

This Kit Includes:

  • 1 - Lithium Ion battery 
  • 1 - Ceramic Heating Chamber
  • 1 - Spring
  • 1 - Mesh Filter
  • 1 - Glass Screen
  • 1 - Chamber Connector
  • 1 - Ceramic Filter
  • 1 - Rubber Mouthpiece
  • 1 - Cleaning Brush Tool
  • 1 - Cordless USB Charger
  • 1 - Wall Adapter
  • 1 - USB Charger
  • 1 - Packing Tool
  • 1 - User manual







1.   Custom Cannaline 7ml (1 gram) concentrate containers and 1oz big jars:

2.   Custom 14g Pottles:

3.   Dispensed2U t-shirts

4.   Dispensed2U stickers

5.   Rewards for dispensaries (Save on Fees)

6.   The Dispensed2U Mobile App will be free:   

Our biggest challenge is raising the capital to make Dispensed2U come to life with one of the country's top app development companies.  

We are aiming to launch Dispensed2U on 4/20/2015. Once the capital is raised, the development stage will begin. Development can take up to 18 weeks to see a finished beta version of our app. We are planning to have a finished beta version to test by the 1st Quarter of 2015. Partnering with dispensaries in Colorado and Washington will take place starting January 2015.

Laws are constantly changing for both recreational and medical marijuana, state by state. Right now we are planning to build the app with capabilities for credit and debit card transactions. Due to federal regulations, banks are very reluctant to accept payments or deal with "Marijuana Related Businesses". Thus making this industry a "Cash Only" business. We will act on a "Cash Only" business model. Orders will still be placed via our website or mobile app but payment to the desired dispensary will be a cash-only payment (for now).  

Delivery laws vary from state-to-state. Dispensed2U feels that with the constant progression of marijuana legalization that delivery laws will be in our favor. However, in the event that delivery is not an option, Dispensed2U has a pick-up option set in place. This option will offer the same convenience. Instead of waiting in long lines you can bypass it all and go right to the counter to pick-up your order at your desired dispensary.

Our campaign is a "Fixed Funding" campaign. This means that we must raise a minimum of $125,000 for us to reach a successful campaign. This factor limits our challenges and risks as we have budgeted for a timely delivery of all the custom Dispensed2U products in our Perks Section.  

Simple login interface to ensure you aren't wasting any time:


Have the option to automatically be geo-located after logging in, and all dispensaries closest to you will appear. This gives you the opportunity to place your order as fast as possible with the closest dispensary.


Swipe down or tap the arrow in the upper left corner to view your dashboard. View account info, recent order history (for expedited ordering), billing information, personal settings, and favorites.

story:
Synergy Wireless Chargers

You probably work hard at hiding the cables throughout your home.  However, you have always made one exception.  Your phone charger cable rests on the floor next to your bed, hangs over your night stand, and is stuffed between your car seats.

However, there is a better solution for the next decade.  Synergy™ Wireless Chargers charge your smartphone wirelessly, beautify your home, and include several innovative patent pending features.  There is nothing like it.


We have three Wireless Charger Products in the Synergy Line:

  1. Synergy™ HV2 (Home & Vehicle Wireless Charger)
  2. Synergy™ W2 (Wall Wireless Charger)
  3. Synergy™ F2 (Furniture Wireless Charger)


Synergy™ HV2 (Home & Vehicle Wireless Charger)

  • Stunning cast metal design - A refreshing yet bold blend of industrial and modern design makes synergy beautiful and exotic
  • Use in home and car - Quickly go from home-to-vehicle with the press of a button
  • Proximity driven night light - LED ring around charging pad illuminates for 5 sec when any object is within proximity to "light the way" at night
  • Auto launch apps with NFC tag - Place phone w/ NFC on charging pad to auto launch apps/tasks such as a night clock, alarm, driving app, or maps
  • Cutting edge technology - Latest technology to insure the fastest phone charge possible


Synergy™ W2 (Wall Wireless Charger)

  • Easy installation - Quickly mounts to any flat wall
  • Nearly flush with wall - Designed to be nearly flush with any flat wall, this product will look fantastic on your wall
  • Proximity driven night light - LED ring around charging pad illuminates for 5 sec when any object is within proximity to "light the way" at night
  • Auto launch apps with NFC tag - Place phone w/ NFC on charging pad to auto launch apps/tasks such as a night clock, alarm, driving app, or maps
  • Cutting edge technology - Latest technology to insure the fastest phone charge possible


Synergy™ W2 (Wall Wireless Charger)

  • Easy installation - Quickly mounts to any furniture with a flat hard surface
  • Nearly flush with surface - Designed to be nearly flush with any flat surface, this product will look fantastic at the center of your furniture
  • Auto launch apps with NFC tag - Place phone w/ NFC on charging pad to auto launch apps/tasks such as a night clock, alarm, driving app, or maps
  • Cutting edge technology - Latest technology to insure the fastest phone charge possible
  • Designed for cleaning - Waterproof design keeps all liquids out. Perimeter seal keeps liquids and solids out from being trapped under the flange.




Accessories

Home Base



Vehicle Base



Galaxy S4 Receiver Module



Galaxy S3 Receiver Module



Galaxy Note 2 Receiver Module



iPhone 5 Receiver Module



iPhone 4/4S Receiver Module



International Plug Adapters



Vehicle Fuse TAP

story:
PengPod is back and this time our hardware can go head to head with anything on the market.  Our latest tablet, the PengPod 1040 has a Quad-Core Allwinner A31 Processor, High def 2048x1536 9.7" LCD, 2Gb of Ram, 16GB of Flash, SD Slot, Wifi, Bluetooth, 7 Ah battery and more.

Do you ever think, “I like the portability and cost of tablets but sometimes I have real work to do” ?

Thats why the latest PengPod can dual boot GNU/Linux and Android, all from internal memory.  No SD cards required, no flashing. Have the best of both worlds right out of the box. Android for web surfing, playing games and watching videos with its excellent touch UI. GNU/Linux provides access to a standard desktop, office suite, software IDEs, powerful networking tools and much, much more. Both systems share a large data partition for the easy exchange of files. Rebooting is simple and painless with an on screen menu to select an alternate boot option, or just let it time out to boot your default OS.

The PengPod 1040 Tablet

Specifications

Product Description

PengPod 1040 – Quad Core Dual Boot - Android 4.1/Linaro - 16 GB - 9.7"

Features

HDMI Port, Micro USB OTG

Dimensions (WxDxH)

9.45”x 7.4” x 0.4” ( 24 cm x 18.8 cm x 0.99 cm )

Weight

1.4 lbs (635 g)

Processor

ARM Cortex-A7 (Quad-Core)

Product Type

Tablet

RAM

2 GB

Display

9.7" IPS - 2048 x 1536 - Multi-Touch

Operating System

Linaro 13.04 / Android 4.1 (Jelly Bean)

Color

White/Silver

Wireless Connectivity

Bluetooth, 802.11b/g/n

Processor Clock Speed

1 GHz (Quad core)

Battery

7000 mAH

Camera

2 Megapixel rear + 0.3 Megapixel front

Storage

16 GB integrated - Micro SD Expansion

About the Processor - A31 SoC Features

  • CPU:

    • ARM Cortex-A7 Quad-Core

    • 256KB L1-Cache

    • 1MB L2-Cache

  • GPU:

    • Power VR SGX 544

    • Eight logic cores (8 shader engines)

    • Complies with Open GL ES2.0, Open CL1.x, DX 9_3

  • Video:

    • UHD H.264 4K ×2K @30fps video decoding

    • Full HD video decoding

    • BD Directory, BD ISO and BD m2ts video decoding

    • H.264 High Profile 1080P@60fps encoding

    • 3840x1080@30fps 3D decoding

    • Comply with RTSP, HTTP, HLS, RTMP, MMS streaming media protocol

  • Memory:

    • Dual-Channel LPDDR2/DDR3/DDR3L Controller

    • Dual-Channel NAND FLASH Controller

    • 64-bit ECC

  • PMIC:

    • A31exclusively tailor-made PMIC AXP221

    • 21-CH power output and 2.2A Flash charging

    • Comply with USB 3.0 power supply standard

  • Embedded Controller:

    • AR100, an OpenRISC controller. Manages deep powersave modes.


OS Options

The PengPods come with Android and Linaro installed on flash. The system will boot by default into Android (initially, this can be changed but Android should be run first to format the shared partition). The Android install has Google certification and access to the play store, maps and other typical Android apps you might expect. Linaro is a typical LXDE desktop environment backed by the Ubuntu Arm repositories including LibreOffice, GIMP, Apache, MySQL and most other mainstream Linux desktop applications.

Here is a list of the currently booting OS/Distribution options

  • Android 4.1 (4.2 Source available, should be ready soon)
  • Linaro (Based on Ubuntu for Arm with LXDE)
  • Fedora
  • ArchLinux
  • OpenSUSE
  • Ubuntu Touch

Here is a list of the OS options we are working on adding. The funds raised will help bring more of these to a working state. Some of these could be guaranteed with stretch goals if we reach that point.

  • Debian
  • Bodhi
  • Tizen
  • Cyanogenmod
  • FirefoxOS
  • Mer/NemoMobile
  • Chromium
  • Plasma Active

What you can do with your PengPod

The original PengPods have been used in many diverse applications including SCADA industrial controls, POS register systems, 3D printer controls, nurse stations, access control systems, survey equipment, LAMP servers, GPS navigation systems and more. With an open system the possibilities are only limited by your abilities and imagination.

An open system protects your freedom as well. All source for the Android build is available, not just Linux. You don't have to worry about what your tablet might be sending behind your back it is all free to be reviewed, modified and customized to your liking.

Why we need you

We want to be able to offer PengPod 1040 Tablet with the best software possible, at the best price possible and produce a quality product with an experienced, open source friendly contract manufacturer.  To meet our hardware goals and guarantee quality we need volume. 

This is our second time to market and we are now familiar with the demands of delivering the perks.  Open software is the lifeblood of the PengPod and what makes it so versatile. There are many exciting, evolving touch based Linux platforms we would like to offer with the PengPod. Each of these will require time and effort and with funding we will be able to make more of these available. 

Crowd-funding will allow us to bring on more permanent staff, including at least one full time engineer who will be dedicated to expanding and improving the software options available for the PengPod 1040.

The Perks

This time the perks are simple, some swag, shirts and the like, the Tablet and optionally some accessories:

Tablet includes

  • PengPod 1040 – 9.7 Tablet described above
  • Power Supply (US Prongs, prong adapter if international)
  • USB – Micro Cable
  • USB OTG Micro-Full Size female, adapter
  • Manual (English)

Bluetooth Accessory pack includes:

  • Capacitive Stylus
  • Bluetooth Keyboard/Case
  • Bluetooth mouse

T-Shirt:

Get a supporter T-shirt, details and images coming soon

Quotes About the Original PengPods

 "Finally, the Linux army has its own portable, touch-screen option."
Eric Mack - cnet

 "If you want both Android and a full desktop operating system on a touchscreen device it doesn't get any more affordable than the PengPod."
Jon Brodkin - Ars Technica

“PengPod created excitement because it promised to build a tablet that would run Linux as well as Android and be "free of Google and Android's restrictions.""
Julie Bort - Business Insider

 "The prospect is a compelling one, and it fits right in with the Linux-powered revolution that’s been going on."
Kathetrine Noyes - PC World

INTERNATIONAL CONTRIBUTORS

Shipping:  We have a 1040 Tablet Perk and an International 1040 Tablet perk, for shipping outside the US.  If you accidentally select the US one and live outside the US but already contributed, please contribute again and select the 'forgot international shipping' perk.  All international shipping will be done with DHL or UPS at our option.

Customs Fees & Duties:  You will most likely have to pay duties upon delivery of your perk outside the USA.  These vary by country and we cannot quote them ahead of time.  In the EU expect to pay the VAT and any national sales tax.  In Canada GST will likely be charged.  Please check your local laws.  Also the courier is likely to charge a collection fee, please contact your local office for more information.

Referral contest!

Most people that would want a PengPod still don't know it exist!  Help us spread the word about the PengPod1040 and you could get one free!  We are giving away one free PengPod 1040 to whoever refers the most contributors!  If you win and have already contributed for a PengPod1040 you will have the choice between a refund or an additional PengPod 1040.  Details: Will be selected based on highest total contributions referred a single account, total users referred will be used as a tie breaker if needed.  Does not include any duties or taxes required to receive the device and of course depends on us reaching the goal.

Thanks for helping up spread the word!


ViewTouch POS

We are pleased to announce a promotion backed by our friends at ViewTouch, inventors of the first graphical Point of Sale software back in 1986.  They have long been supporters of Linux and take full advantage of open source software to keep their register systems both feature rich and secure. They contacted us with this offer for two reasons.  They share our belief that tablets should be able to run unrestricted operating systems, just like we enjoy on our desktops and also they worked with our first generation devices and want to help make the next generation PengPod 1040 a reality. 


We are able to offer 100 PengPod 1040s pre-installed with their ViewTouch POS software for a contribution of $495.  Normally this system would cost $2000 for the software license and the initial hardware.  The software does require a monthly use, support and training fee of $29 to be enabled, typically this fee would be $79 but they have offered to discount that as well for a savings of $600 a year.  This is a great chance to support free software and acquire a high quality, commercial restaurant POS system for less than $500 thanks to our friends at ViewTouch and the power of an open system.

story:
Green Energy on the go! 

The Mini-solar-charger is a multi-function solar emergency charger and a power bank. Build in 1350mAh high capacity rechargeable polymer battery. 

You can charge your mobile phone, digital camera, PDA, MP3, MP4 whenever and wherever.


The compact and lightweight mini solar charger can be charged via the solar cell or the mini-USB. 

No matter where to load. 

Simply place the solar charger during the day on a windowsill with sunlight and invite her evening as mobile phone. 

This protects the environment and your wallet. 

Mini solar charger and power bank -

Technical data:

Length 93 mm Width 43 mm Weight 60 g Height 11 mm 


Features:

  • Solar energy board: 5.5V/80mA.

  • High capacity build in polymer battery: 1350mAH.

  • Output voltage: 5.5V.

  • Output current: 1000mA.

  • Charging time: about 60 minutes (the time is a little different for different mobile phone).

  • To charge the build in battery in the charger using solar energy: about 10-15 hours.

  • To charge the build in battery in the charger using computer or AC adapter: about 2,5 hours.


  • The auxiliary adaptors and cables fits for Mobile phone,

    input: mini-USB, output: USB / adapter

    To charge her phone with her load cable (USB).


Packing list:

1x Solar charger with accu, 1x cable, 5x adapter

By a large order at a partner company of at least 1000 pieces of this small price is possible.

This campaign is to support the development of the Cool-motor.

Cool-Motor is a revolutionary engine for green energy! Please visit.

Thank's for your support!

King regards, Enrico Kühl
