story:
What is LunarDock:Io?

The majority of the population owns a smartphone and personal computer. They have become mainstays in our everyday lives as well as something we largely take for granted. Power it up, push some buttons, get your information, and go about life.

However, the smaller populace of technology enthusiasts that not only demand functionality but also appreciate the aesthetics of their devices are looking for products that are both artistically unique as well as customizable to their individual tastes. We recognize that the Indiegogo community is composed of this select breed of user; therefore, we see this arena as the perfect launching pad for inspired creations like the LunarDock:Io...

The LD:Io is both unique and functional

The LunarDock:Io is the dock charging station for your smartphone. Simply plug it into your computer's USB port, set your phone into the cradle, and it recharges your battery.

In addition to this simple function, we realize that people are increasingly spending an extraordinary amount of time married to their desks and computers. So why not have your workspace accented with accessories that are not only functional but also visually appealing? This is where the LunarDock:Io stands out.

 

LunarDock:Io is more than your standard dock

  • CNC machined from billet 6061 aircraft quality aluminum.

  • Durable anodized finish available in matte silver or black.

  • The LD:Io weighs over 1/2 of a pound.

  • Silicon rubber is used on both the base and cradle for protection.

  • Multi-phone support. The LD:Io supports iPhone4/5 and most center-bottom mounted MicroUSB based phones.

  • Oversized docking bay to accommodate most phone cases.

  • Docking connector is adjustable. Phone plug location can move 1.5mm fore and aft.

  • 7 degree phone back support and matching phone connector angle.

  • And...it's lighted! RGB LEDs add a cool subtle glow in a variety of colors and patterns.

 

The LD:Io allows the owner to select from the following colors: Red, Red-Orange, Orange, Yellow-Orange, Yellow, Lime, Green, Aqua, Indigo, Blue, Violet, Pink or White.

Beyond just displaying a solid color, you can select two colors and have them alternate. You want to show your team pride? Select your colors and let everyone around you know even your LD:Io is a fan of your team. 

 

What effects can be selected?

The LunarDock:Io allows you to display a single selectable color. You can also make that color fade in and out similar to the sleep light on a Macbook. You can also select two colors and have them fade in and out as well. Or for those of you who really want to show off the LD:Io's capabilities, you can let it run in demo mode as seen in the video.

 

Will my phone work with the LD:Io?

We will be adding specific models of phones that should work with the LD:Io. There are so many case variables that it makes it almost impossible to say what will and won't fit without measuring each individual phone. Currently, the LD:Io supports the Apple Lightning connector for the iPhone5, the Apple 30 pin connector for the iPhone3/4 and center-bottom mounted MicroUSB. If your connector is directly in the center of the bottom of your phone and is less than 2.71" wide by .59" deep, you should have no problem using the LD:Io. If you want to be really safe, make sure your phone dimensions with your case are under 2.6" wide and .5" deep.   

Yes, that's right, the LD:Io supports your choice of Apple Lightning, Apple 30 Pin and MicroUSB connections!

The wide docking platform provides enough room to fit most cases.

The phone connector can be adjusted for those that want the absolute perfect fit to their case.

Stretch Goals

What would any crowdfunded project like this be without a mouthwatering stretch goal? We have some juicy LED effects lined up, and once we break the funding goal, we will be posting them. If you want to see how crazy we can get with LEDs, tell a friend and help us not only reach our funding goal but exceed it.

Let's see.... Maybe the first stretch goal will be a nice and bright single color flash.... ON-OFF-ON-OFF nice and fast to really make your coworkers angry.

 

How do I power the LunarDock:Io?

The LunarDock:Io is powered from a standard USB 5V source. We will include a matching gray MicroUSB to USB "A" cable for all the docks that are ordered with either the Apple 30 Pin or MicroUSB phone connector types.

We apologize but Apple iPhone 5 owners will need to provide their own Apple Lightning© cable to power the dock at this time.

 

Even with the skin off, the LD:Io is a stunning work of art.

 

Besides charging your phone, the LD:Io also works great as a night light to keep monsters at bay. And when you don't want the LED effects, you can always turn them off.

Why are we seeking funding?

While we have spent a significant amount of time testing and prototyping, manufacturing is expensive. With your support, LunarDock:Io will become a reality enabling us to bring this product to market. The LunarDock:Io is just the beginning of the projects we have lined up. This funding will help get a solid start and let us provide a unique product to our supporters.

The materials are already sourced and the suppliers are all in line and ready to go. The only real challenge we have is committing to the tooling setup and molding costs for both the silicon rubber pieces as well as the circuit boards. That is where the Indiegogo fanbase can help us out!

Every dollar helps us get closer to our goal, so even if you can't use the LD:Io for your current phone, a contribution to our project will help us fast track new ideas that will open our creativity to a new audience. Support for off-center MicroUSB phones, large format phones, and even a LunarDock for the iPad and iPad Mini? Yes, we have matching lighted designs all ready for these as well. Your support will not only help get this little gem in full production, but also set the stage for even more creative ideas.

Much more than simply charging your phone, the LD:Io has its own integrated circuit to give the owner control over the colors and lighting effects.

The first batch of prototypes straight from the anodizing tanks awaiting their electronic circuitry to be installed.

Risks and Challenges:

Any new endeavor is not without certain risks and challenges...

LunarDock:Io has significantly more "moving pieces" than the average phone dock. We have sorted out most of the logistics with sourcing of material, electronics, and shipping. However, as with any complicated project, coordinating logistics with multiple suppliers can result in delays. We feel communication plays a vital role and our pledge is to always be up-front with our supporters.

The delivery date is intentionally set to April 2013 with the hope that there are no parts sourcing issues that cause us to need that amount of time. We hope nothing will stand in our way to deliver the LD:Io to the supporters as soon as they come together. First ordered - first delivered. We promise to always keep supporters informed about ship dates and when they can expect delivery of their LD:Io. Simply, we vow to treat you the way we want to be treated as a customer.

How you can help:

While our goal to make this project a success is a modest $20,000, we appreciate every single contribution you provide to make this a reality. For those who can't spare the cash at this time, you can still help us out. While we would love everyone who visits this site to buy an LD:Io, we would benefit even more by having as many people as we can spread the word about our products on Facebook, Twitter, tech sites, blogs, word of mouth, whatever. The more people that see our creation, the better.

Here are a few steps you can do to help us even if you can't donate.

  • Copy www.indiegogo.com/lunardockio and paste it into an email or social media update
  • Click on the Facebook, Google Plus or Twitter icons to share through your social media networks 
  • Add a widget to your blog or personal website. Click Embed and then copy and paste the widget code. 
  • Send a direct email from Indiegogo
  • Impress us! Have a great idea to get the word out? Contact us. Maybe we can hook you up with some free swag if you really have the inside track to some traffic generating publicity.

About the Creators

Neostasis Designs Inc. is an industrial design and consumer electronics company located in Chicago, IL.

Founders, Scott Parus and Mark Sarnecki, have been creating and solving problems together for the last 25 years. We combine metal, wood, and glass with silicon and solder to create functional works of art that are aesthetically pleasing and unique. Both of us have been in the engineering and computer technology field for most of our adult lives and we would describe ourselves as jack-of-all-trades type of designers.

We laugh now, but remembering our first jobs after high school it's ironic how everything comes full circle. Mark started off repairing computer monitors and other electronic devices, while Scott fought the AutoCAD Release 10 interface to complete work in the railroad and extruded metals industry. Twenty-some years later, Mark is still inhaling fumes from the soldering iron and Scott's desk is littered with sketches on the back of junk mail and piles of rulers and dial calipers.

Mark's primary responsibilities are controlling all the electrons and making them bow to our will. Mark designed all the electronic circuitry packed into the LD:Io and tackled all the programming challenges under the covers. It is easy to forget that, unlike normal docks that are essentially electronic passthroughs, there is an active intelligence in the form of a little integrated circuit behind the LEDs and effect functionality of the LD:Io.

Scott's efforts are reflected in the physical design of the device, bringing unique lines and creative ideas to the mechanical side of LD:Io. No matter how nice the LED  effects are, nobody would want an ugly dock laying around; fortunately, Scott has blended the 30+ mechanical and electronic parts into a single flowing device that is  both functional and attractive. While the claim-to-fame of the LD:Io is its electronic circuitry, there is little doubt the physical elements are what makes the LD:Io an eye-catching addition to any tabletop.

We appreciate your support!!!

Thanks for checking out LunarDock:Io! We hope you are as excited as we are! Please be sure to check back often for updates as our project progresses. Also, feel free to contact us with any comments, questions, and suggestions.
story_txt:
What is LunarDock:Io?
The majority of the population owns a smartphone and personal computer. They have become mainstays in our everyday lives as well as something we largely take for granted. Power it up, push some buttons, get your information, and go about life.
However, the smaller populace of technology enthusiasts that not only demand functionality but also appreciate the aesthetics of their devices are looking for products that are both artistically unique as well as customizable to their individual tastes. We recognize that the Indiegogo community is composed of this select breed of user; therefore, we see this arena as the perfect launching pad for inspired creations like the LunarDock:Io...



The LD:Io is both unique and functional
The LunarDock:Io is the dock charging station for your smartphone. Simply plug it into your computer's USB port, set your phone into the cradle, and it recharges your battery.
In addition to this simple function, we realize that people are increasingly spending an extraordinary amount of time married to their desks and computers. So why not have your workspace accented with accessories that are not only functional but also visually appealing? This is where the LunarDock:Io stands out.
 


LunarDock:Io is more than your standard dock


CNC machined from billet 6061 aircraft quality aluminum.


Durable anodized finish available in matte silver or black.


The LD:Io weighs over 1/2 of a pound.


Silicon rubber is used on both the base and cradle for protection.


Multi-phone support. The LD:Io supports iPhone4/5 and most center-bottom mounted MicroUSB based phones.


Oversized docking bay to accommodate most phone cases.


Docking connector is adjustable. Phone plug location can move 1.5mm fore and aft.


7 degree phone back support and matching phone connector angle.


And...it's lighted! RGB LEDs add a cool subtle glow in a variety of colors and patterns.


 
The LD:Io allows the owner to select from the following colors: Red, Red-Orange, Orange, Yellow-Orange, Yellow, Lime, Green, Aqua, Indigo, Blue, Violet, Pink or White.

Beyond just displaying a solid color, you can select two colors and have them alternate. You want to show your team pride? Select your colors and let everyone around you know even your LD:Io is a fan of your team. 
 
What effects can be selected?
The LunarDock:Io allows you to display a single selectable color. You can also make that color fade in and out similar to the sleep light on a Macbook. You can also select two colors and have them fade in and out as well. Or for those of you who really want to show off the LD:Io's capabilities, you can let it run in demo mode as seen in the video.
 
Will my phone work with the LD:Io?
We will be adding specific models of phones that should work with the LD:Io. There are so many case variables that it makes it almost impossible to say what will and won't fit without measuring each individual phone. Currently, the LD:Io supports the Apple Lightning connector for the iPhone5, the Apple 30 pin connector for the iPhone3/4 and center-bottom mounted MicroUSB. If your connector is directly in the center of the bottom of your phone and is less than 2.71" wide by .59" deep, you should have no problem using the LD:Io. If you want to be really safe, make sure your phone dimensions with your case are under 2.6" wide and .5" deep.   
Yes, that's right, the LD:Io supports your choice of Apple Lightning, Apple 30 Pin and MicroUSB connections!

The wide docking platform provides enough room to fit most cases.


The phone connector can be adjusted for those that want the absolute perfect fit to their case.
Stretch Goals
What would any crowdfunded project like this be without a mouthwatering stretch goal? We have some juicy LED effects lined up, and once we break the funding goal, we will be posting them. If you want to see how crazy we can get with LEDs, tell a friend and help us not only reach our funding goal but exceed it.
Let's see.... Maybe the first stretch goal will be a nice and bright single color flash.... ON-OFF-ON-OFF nice and fast to really make your coworkers angry.
 

How do I power the LunarDock:Io?
The LunarDock:Io is powered from a standard USB 5V source. We will include a matching gray MicroUSB to USB "A" cable for all the docks that are ordered with either the Apple 30 Pin or MicroUSB phone connector types.
We apologize but Apple iPhone 5 owners will need to provide their own Apple Lightning© cable to power the dock at this time.
 
Even with the skin off, the LD:Io is a stunning work of art.
 

Besides charging your phone, the LD:Io also works great as a night light to keep monsters at bay. And when you don't want the LED effects, you can always turn them off.
Why are we seeking funding?
While we have spent a significant amount of time testing and prototyping, manufacturing is expensive. With your support, LunarDock:Io will become a reality enabling us to bring this product to market. The LunarDock:Io is just the beginning of the projects we have lined up. This funding will help get a solid start and let us provide a unique product to our supporters.
The materials are already sourced and the suppliers are all in line and ready to go. The only real challenge we have is committing to the tooling setup and molding costs for both the silicon rubber pieces as well as the circuit boards. That is where the Indiegogo fanbase can help us out!
Every dollar helps us get closer to our goal, so even if you can't use the LD:Io for your current phone, a contribution to our project will help us fast track new ideas that will open our creativity to a new audience. Support for off-center MicroUSB phones, large format phones, and even a LunarDock for the iPad and iPad Mini? Yes, we have matching lighted designs all ready for these as well. Your support will not only help get this little gem in full production, but also set the stage for even more creative ideas.



Much more than simply charging your phone, the LD:Io has its own integrated circuit to give the owner control over the colors and lighting effects.

The first batch of prototypes straight from the anodizing tanks awaiting their electronic circuitry to be installed.

Risks and Challenges:
Any new endeavor is not without certain risks and challenges...
LunarDock:Io has significantly more "moving pieces" than the average phone dock. We have sorted out most of the logistics with sourcing of material, electronics, and shipping. However, as with any complicated project, coordinating logistics with multiple suppliers can result in delays. We feel communication plays a vital role and our pledge is to always be up-front with our supporters.
The delivery date is intentionally set to April 2013 with the hope that there are no parts sourcing issues that cause us to need that amount of time. We hope nothing will stand in our way to deliver the LD:Io to the supporters as soon as they come together. First ordered - first delivered. We promise to always keep supporters informed about ship dates and when they can expect delivery of their LD:Io. Simply, we vow to treat you the way we want to be treated as a customer.
How you can help:
While our goal to make this project a success is a modest $20,000, we appreciate every single contribution you provide to make this a reality. For those who can't spare the cash at this time, you can still help us out. While we would love everyone who visits this site to buy an LD:Io, we would benefit even more by having as many people as we can spread the word about our products on Facebook, Twitter, tech sites, blogs, word of mouth, whatever. The more people that see our creation, the better.
Here are a few steps you can do to help us even if you can't donate.

Copy www.indiegogo.com/lunardockio and paste it into an email or social media update
Click on the Facebook, Google Plus or Twitter icons to share through your social media networks 
Add a widget to your blog or personal website. Click Embed and then copy and paste the widget code. 
Send a direct email from Indiegogo
Impress us! Have a great idea to get the word out? Contact us. Maybe we can hook you up with some free swag if you really have the inside track to some traffic generating publicity.

About the Creators



Neostasis Designs Inc. is an industrial design and consumer electronics company located in Chicago, IL.
Founders, Scott Parus and Mark Sarnecki, have been creating and solving problems together for the last 25 years. We combine metal, wood, and glass with silicon and solder to create functional works of art that are aesthetically pleasing and unique. Both of us have been in the engineering and computer technology field for most of our adult lives and we would describe ourselves as jack-of-all-trades type of designers.
We laugh now, but remembering our first jobs after high school it's ironic how everything comes full circle. Mark started off repairing computer monitors and other electronic devices, while Scott fought the AutoCAD Release 10 interface to complete work in the railroad and extruded metals industry. Twenty-some years later, Mark is still inhaling fumes from the soldering iron and Scott's desk is littered with sketches on the back of junk mail and piles of rulers and dial calipers.
Mark's primary responsibilities are controlling all the electrons and making them bow to our will. Mark designed all the electronic circuitry packed into the LD:Io and tackled all the programming challenges under the covers. It is easy to forget that, unlike normal docks that are essentially electronic passthroughs, there is an active intelligence in the form of a little integrated circuit behind the LEDs and effect functionality of the LD:Io.
Scott's efforts are reflected in the physical design of the device, bringing unique lines and creative ideas to the mechanical side of LD:Io. No matter how nice the LED  effects are, nobody would want an ugly dock laying around; fortunately, Scott has blended the 30+ mechanical and electronic parts into a single flowing device that is  both functional and attractive. While the claim-to-fame of the LD:Io is its electronic circuitry, there is little doubt the physical elements are what makes the LD:Io an eye-catching addition to any tabletop.



We appreciate your support!!!
Thanks for checking out LunarDock:Io! We hope you are as excited as we are! Please be sure to check back often for updates as our project progresses. Also, feel free to contact us with any comments, questions, and suggestions.

story:
It will help you to forget about problems with the uncharged phone. And, for the beginning, briefly about ChaC:

ChaC is thin! It's only 3,5 mm (0,1379 in.) thickness. You will not even notice it on your phone.

ChaC is light. Not more than 70 g (2.471 oz.)

ChaC is available for such brands as: Аpple, Samsung, Nokia, LG, Sony, HTC, Lenovo etc.

And the most important thing is tha ChaC is productive: it will never allow your phone to be uncharged.




1. Monocrystalline solar cells. We use them instead of polycrystalline solar cells because their capacity is much higher and the price difference is not very large.

2. Battery. We use nanobatteries. They are thin and very productive. Accumulator capacity of the ChaC's models differs because the surface area of the phones also differs. It depends both from the phone sizes and from the arrangement of the elements of the phone. 

3. Power management system. It ensures correct ChaC's functioning. Also it allows to turn it on/off (you can see it by the LED indicator)

4. Optical device. It elps to improve solar cells capacity. Optics focuses light rays and this gives ChaC an opportunity to work not only from daylight but also from lamplight.




Once again (at a thousand time) when I noticed my phone is dead I started to think about the creation of the device that would always charge my phone itself and I would never EVER see my phone uncharged! 

For a long time I considered different variants of charging: thermoelectric generators which could work at the moment when you take the phone in hand, radio waves as a source of energy, static electricity, piezo electric generators… BUT every variant apart has too little energy to charge a phone. And if this variants are united in one device, energy will probably be enough but the size of the gadget will be huge like a brick. Thinking and thinking about the decision of size problem I came to the variant of using solar elements, i.e. conversion of light (natural light during the day, lamplight during the night) into energy sufficient to charge the phone. 

Lucky me, almost every mobile and smart phones nowadays are not very small sized, so the area for placing solar cells on the opposite side of the phone is enough for having the energy to charge it. All of us know about additional devices for charging the phone, but they usually are big and hard. Besides what's the point of taking additional devices when you can have light and thin case and forget about the necessity of charging? Also you could have seen cases like mine BUT they have 4 flaws: 1. Those cases are huge 2. not lightweight you feel it in your hand 3. as usual those cases are made only for one brand 4. And the most important thing: their capacity is not enough to forget about traditional charging through net. 

First sample was made from polycrystalline solar cells, it worked, but for the full charge of the phone claimed a lot of time. That is why all subsequent models of ChaC were made from monocrystalline solar cells, their capacity is much higher, so the time of charging had been reduced.


But there is no sunlight at the evening and night, only lamplight. And whithout any additional element in this gadget my idea won't come to life. Then I had a thougth to use optical devices to improve the capacity of ChaC untill it would be enough to carge throug the lampligth. To be truthfull there were some problems with optics: I had to try everything that was on the market and it wasn't exactly what I needed. So I had to get in touch with the produser of optical devices and to communicate with almost all the levels of management trying to explain my demand. And by autumn of 2015 after all the calculations and tests they are ready to provide the nessesary optical device. But, as you understand, it costs money, because the new production needs the new matrix and new producing process. And if I'm the only one who order this good, the volume of an order should be not little. How to get a guaranteed pre-order from the consumer to make an order to the plant? And here comes the croudfunding plattform.

As a result, by all accounts, as mine as the Department of Engineering of the plant-producer of optics here goes ChaC that charges your phone by sunlight and lamplight. But what shall we do if there isn't any light? For example, it is night and the electricity is cutted. For that reason there is a thinniest battery in ChaC. Its thickness is not more than 2,2 mm and depending of the model of your cell its capacity is from 1000 upto 1400 mAh. It enough to extend the work of your device at least for a few hours. So, eventually I got ChaC. Case which helps you to forget about low battery forever!

After choosing solar elements, optics and battery we only had to work on power management system. The main criterion was to make it as compact as possible in size. To expedite this process, we have determined the useful volume, which can be used to ChaC himself remained thin, lightweight and not bulky, and therefore look attractive. Then we contacted the company producing boards. This company has developed a management system for our performance and dimensions. And again, to make an order we still need help of the croudfunding platform. 

As a result, we have everything prepared for the assembly of ChaC. What we need is to get the required amount of pre-orders from you, backers, investors and people who want to help us in this project.


ChaC available for any phone model which has proportions not less than 11 cm (4,3 in) in height and 6 cm (2,3 in) in width.


You can choose any color of case from any model of the phone you wish (Apple, Samsung, Sony, LG etc) 





Why we are not able to show you ChaC in a final assembly version?

Because we have not got a management system and optics yet. They will be  produced specially for us, but the required minimum order amount is 1000 pieces. Thats why we need your help, your investments, pre-orders.


Does ChaC come with a warranty?

Absolutely!  Every ChaC will come with a 1 year warranty for any manufacturing faults or defects.

If you want to get additional warranty on ChaC (for mechanical damage and ingress of water) you may buy perk (extended guarantee).


For which models will you produce ChaC?

ChaC is available for any phone model which has proportions not less than 11 cm in height and 6 cm in width.


Who are we?

We are a small group of inventors, enthusiasts. ChaC first came about as an idea to make something new, interesting and affordable for the most of phone owners.


How can I get in touch with your team?

If you have any questions for ChaC team you can e-mail us to chac.case@gmail.com or chac_case@mail.ru  



We'd like to say thanks to all who have helped to us with working on ChaC.

And of course, thanks to our Backers, you are the best!


P.S.:  If you like our idea, if you like ChaC, but you can`t make pre-order now, you can help to us - make some noise about our campaign. And we will be very grateful to you.

story:
We thrive on Freedom. Customization is a way of life. No one will Control what we do or say. Everyone is Unique; everyone is an Individual. We are Not Boring. Who are we? We are Android, and Android Powers our Life.

My Story

Many months ago I was looking for a better way to connect my Android smart phone to my car.  I've been an Android user since the original Motorola Droid came out. In my three years as an Android user I've been puzzled at the relatively ineffective options to connect our Android devices into our vehicles.  In the past these were your options:

  • Headphone Jack: cables ran all over the car making it look bad and was unsafe
  • FM Radio Transmitters: poor audio quality and if you drove under power lines there is no way it would work
  • Bluetooth: many radios don't support it, and it always isn't easy to plug and play
  • iPhone Connector: *cough* unless you buy a new iPhone 5 *cough*
  • Brand Specific in Dash System: just isn't quite there yet http://mashable.com/2012/04/18/iphone-in-car/

With Android commanding well over 50% market share, and 75% of the smart phones shipped in the last quarter of the year being Android smart phones, this is definitely a problem that needs fixed.  Many other people have tried to fix this problems as well:

http://www.androidcentral.com/nexus-7-makes-best-car-entertainment-system-ever

http://www.androidcentral.com/nexus-7-dash-mount-beautifully-simple

http://www.androidcentral.com/who-needs-car-head-unit-when-you-have-galaxy-s3

With no two Android devices being alike it makes it hard to standardize things like dock connectors.

Enter: The Smarter Dock

To solve my connection problem I decided to create a new, simple docking method for our phones.  I decided that it would be best to use already well known and used standards: USB and HDMI.  The USB will keep the phone charged.  The HDMI will send the audio and video to the car's entertainment system.

The Five Reasons you want the Smarter Dock:

1) It's Pretty Cool

There are no other devices out on the market that allow you to watch movies, navigate, listen to music, and play games in your car all from your smart phone. Everyone that sees my prototype in my car ask where I got it, and how they could get one.  Now's your chance to wow everyone too.

2) Music and Navigation

You can use your phone to listen to your favorite music in high quality sound. You can also use your navigation apps to get you from point A to point B.

3) Watching Movies

Adding video is where the Smarter Dock really starts to excel.  Whatever is on the cell phone screen you can send back to the back seat.  This may not seem very important at first; but any parent who has taken a road trip longer than an hour can testify that entertaining children is not an easy task.  Using apps like Google Play Movies and TV, Netflix, Slingbox, and many other video apps can make it possible to rent, buy, and watch movies on road trips.  This is something that is priceless on a six hour drive across the Wyoming tundra, if you know what I mean.  Even just showing the navigation screen will entertain children for a while.

4) Playing Games

What really excites me is the ability for passengers in the car to be able to play the games that are on your phone.  Over 33% of cell phone owners play games on their phones.  It's becoming a natural part of life.  The Android system has made it possible to play more than just cell phone games.  For example, using ROMS one could play N64 games and PlayStation games.  With the recent success of Ouya, the gaming landscape has been completely changed.  Many high end phones today have similar specs to what is in the Ouya.  These same games that are made for the Ouya could also be made to play on your phone.  Imagine: your kids have a favorite game they play at home on your Ouya.  When you go on road trips they can just pick up playing from where they left off.

5) Helping out someone like you, for all of us

When I started this project I built it because I wanted something that could do all the above things. I know there are other people out there looking for a better solution. This is the next step in making our phones and cars more powerful, connected, and fun. I'm not from a big company trying to make money, I'm just a person trying to solve a problem.

My Project

For many months I've been developing a simple, yet powerful way to dock our Android devices to our cars.  After much trial and error, running into many obstacles, and learning about boring things like patents and working with manufacturers, I'm ready to bring my ideas to the public.  This is where I need your help.  So far I've:

  • Developed a working prototype
  • Worked with custom car audio and video installers to improve my design
  • Protected my design with a provisional patent
  • Worked with manufacturers to get ready for production
  • Put together some awesome perks

What I need:

  • The excitement and backing of the Android Community
  • Funds to start production and finish protecting the Smarter Dock

How much is needed, and what is it used for?

To start I'll need $65,000.  This is what the funds will be used for:

  • $10,000 to complete the patent process. This is an estimate given to me by a local patent attorney.
  • $7,500 to pay for the molding and tooling costs.
  • $5,000 to pay for HDMI rights to use their technology.
  • The rest: to pay for your perks, shipping, fees from indiegogo and credit card fees, and other small miscellaneous items.

What perks will you get if you help fund this project?

I'm glad you asked.  I thought long and hard about this question, and I hope I've found not only nice perks, but one's that you will actually want to have too.  Here is a list of the perks you can receive:

Donate $10

Android Powered Bumper Sticker:  Show the world and the person stuck in traffic behind you that you are powered by Android.

Donate $20

Android Powered T-Shirt:  It's what's on the inside that counts.  Show everyone you come into contact with that you are Android to the core.  I wanted to make a shirt that I would actually wear, and that I hoped you would want to wear too.  I think this is just the thing.

Donate $35

Smarter Dock: Power you car's entertainment with the Smarter Dock.  This includes one Smarter Dock and the hardware to install it to your dash board.

How is the Smarter Dock installed?

Installation can be accomplished in many different ways.  It can be installed in your dash, on top of your dash, or anywhere else in your car.  I suggest talking to a custom car audio installer for suggestions on how to install it in your specific car, or get it professionally installed.  Click on the following link and watch the video below to see how I installed it in my car, a list of supported smart phones, and get suggestions on what parts are needed to fully install the Smarter Dock: http://sdrv.ms/UBF2aS

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_EPb4hmArQ0

The Smarter Dock was made to either be installed inside your dash, like I installed it, or if you don't want to cut a hole in your dash you can install it on top of your dash.  Using the included installation ring makes it possible to do both.

Then use your favorite phone holder to hold your phone, and the appropriate cables to connect your phone to the USB and HDMI.  I use the iOttie phone holder.

What if we raise more than what we are asking for?

To get the initial order I'll need about 2000 supporters, or $65,000.  If we can get another 500 supporters, or $90,000 in total, then I can also make the Smarter Connector.  The Smarter Connector is a connector that connects straight to the Smarter Dock and also holds your phone, thus eliminating the need for a separate phone holder.

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=U73knlvQVSk

If we reach this goal I will make the Smarter Connector available as a perk too.

Let's make this happen!

Thank you for looking at my campaign.  Please take a moment to pledge so we can make this possible.  Tell all your friends about this project as well so we can make it possible.  Lastly, Android is great because of its community. In the comments section share your ideas, apps, and other ways that we can use the Smarter Dock to make our life, well, Smarter.

 If you have questions email me at thesmarterdock@gmail.com, or post in the comments box above, thanks.

RISKS AND CHALLENGES 

Tackling a project like this one is not an easy task. I've been working months already getting things lined up ready to post here on indiegogo. After the project is funded the real work begins. Here is the list of things I need to do:

Fill out application and pay dues to become an HDMI adopter 
Work with the manufacturer to get items manufactured and shipped to me 
Put together your rewards and get them to you in a quick matter 
Start working on the Utility Patent for the Smarter Dock 
Survive Thanksgiving at the In-Laws (just kidding... haha...)

Working with my manufacturer, here is the timeline after the project is funded: 
45 Days lead time for the tooling 
About 10 weeks for it to get delivered to my door 
Another week or so for me to get everything sorted and shipped off to you.

Developing a new product is a fun, exciting, interesting, and challenging time. But with patience we can all become a part of something new and amazing. Thanks.
story_txt:
We thrive on Freedom. Customization is a way of life. No one will Control what we do or say. Everyone is Unique; everyone is an Individual. We are Not Boring. Who are we? We are Android, and Android Powers our Life.
My Story
Many months ago I was looking for a better way to connect my Android smart phone to my car.  I've been an Android user since the original Motorola Droid came out. In my three years as an Android user I've been puzzled at the relatively ineffective options to connect our Android devices into our vehicles.  In the past these were your options:

Headphone Jack: cables ran all over the car making it look bad and was unsafe
FM Radio Transmitters: poor audio quality and if you drove under power lines there is no way it would work
Bluetooth: many radios don't support it, and it always isn't easy to plug and play
iPhone Connector: *cough* unless you buy a new iPhone 5 *cough*
Brand Specific in Dash System: just isn't quite there yet http://mashable.com/2012/04/18/iphone-in-car/

With Android commanding well over 50% market share, and 75% of the smart phones shipped in the last quarter of the year being Android smart phones, this is definitely a problem that needs fixed.  Many other people have tried to fix this problems as well:
http://www.androidcentral.com/nexus-7-makes-best-car-entertainment-system-ever
http://www.androidcentral.com/nexus-7-dash-mount-beautifully-simple
http://www.androidcentral.com/who-needs-car-head-unit-when-you-have-galaxy-s3
With no two Android devices being alike it makes it hard to standardize things like dock connectors.
Enter: The Smarter Dock
To solve my connection problem I decided to create a new, simple docking method for our phones.  I decided that it would be best to use already well known and used standards: USB and HDMI.  The USB will keep the phone charged.  The HDMI will send the audio and video to the car's entertainment system.
The Five Reasons you want the Smarter Dock:
1) It's Pretty Cool
There are no other devices out on the market that allow you to watch movies, navigate, listen to music, and play games in your car all from your smart phone. Everyone that sees my prototype in my car ask where I got it, and how they could get one.  Now's your chance to wow everyone too.
2) Music and Navigation

You can use your phone to listen to your favorite music in high quality sound. You can also use your navigation apps to get you from point A to point B.
3) Watching Movies

Adding video is where the Smarter Dock really starts to excel.  Whatever is on the cell phone screen you can send back to the back seat.  This may not seem very important at first; but any parent who has taken a road trip longer than an hour can testify that entertaining children is not an easy task.  Using apps like Google Play Movies and TV, Netflix, Slingbox, and many other video apps can make it possible to rent, buy, and watch movies on road trips.  This is something that is priceless on a six hour drive across the Wyoming tundra, if you know what I mean.  Even just showing the navigation screen will entertain children for a while.
4) Playing Games

What really excites me is the ability for passengers in the car to be able to play the games that are on your phone.  Over 33% of cell phone owners play games on their phones.  It's becoming a natural part of life.  The Android system has made it possible to play more than just cell phone games.  For example, using ROMS one could play N64 games and PlayStation games.  With the recent success of Ouya, the gaming landscape has been completely changed.  Many high end phones today have similar specs to what is in the Ouya.  These same games that are made for the Ouya could also be made to play on your phone.  Imagine: your kids have a favorite game they play at home on your Ouya.  When you go on road trips they can just pick up playing from where they left off.
5) Helping out someone like you, for all of us
When I started this project I built it because I wanted something that could do all the above things. I know there are other people out there looking for a better solution. This is the next step in making our phones and cars more powerful, connected, and fun. I'm not from a big company trying to make money, I'm just a person trying to solve a problem.
My Project
For many months I've been developing a simple, yet powerful way to dock our Android devices to our cars.  After much trial and error, running into many obstacles, and learning about boring things like patents and working with manufacturers, I'm ready to bring my ideas to the public.  This is where I need your help.  So far I've:

Developed a working prototype
Worked with custom car audio and video installers to improve my design
Protected my design with a provisional patent
Worked with manufacturers to get ready for production
Put together some awesome perks
What I need:

The excitement and backing of the Android Community
Funds to start production and finish protecting the Smarter Dock
How much is needed, and what is it used for?
To start I'll need $65,000.  This is what the funds will be used for:

$10,000 to complete the patent process. This is an estimate given to me by a local patent attorney.
$7,500 to pay for the molding and tooling costs.
$5,000 to pay for HDMI rights to use their technology.
The rest: to pay for your perks, shipping, fees from indiegogo and credit card fees, and other small miscellaneous items.
What perks will you get if you help fund this project?
I'm glad you asked.  I thought long and hard about this question, and I hope I've found not only nice perks, but one's that you will actually want to have too.  Here is a list of the perks you can receive:
Donate $10
Android Powered Bumper Sticker:  Show the world and the person stuck in traffic behind you that you are powered by Android.

Donate $20
Android Powered T-Shirt:  It's what's on the inside that counts.  Show everyone you come into contact with that you are Android to the core.  I wanted to make a shirt that I would actually wear, and that I hoped you would want to wear too.  I think this is just the thing.

Donate $35
Smarter Dock: Power you car's entertainment with the Smarter Dock.  This includes one Smarter Dock and the hardware to install it to your dash board.

How is the Smarter Dock installed?
Installation can be accomplished in many different ways.  It can be installed in your dash, on top of your dash, or anywhere else in your car.  I suggest talking to a custom car audio installer for suggestions on how to install it in your specific car, or get it professionally installed.  Click on the following link and watch the video below to see how I installed it in my car, a list of supported smart phones, and get suggestions on what parts are needed to fully install the Smarter Dock: http://sdrv.ms/UBF2aS
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_EPb4hmArQ0
The Smarter Dock was made to either be installed inside your dash, like I installed it, or if you don't want to cut a hole in your dash you can install it on top of your dash.  Using the included installation ring makes it possible to do both.



Then use your favorite phone holder to hold your phone, and the appropriate cables to connect your phone to the USB and HDMI.  I use the iOttie phone holder.
What if we raise more than what we are asking for?
To get the initial order I'll need about 2000 supporters, or $65,000.  If we can get another 500 supporters, or $90,000 in total, then I can also make the Smarter Connector.  The Smarter Connector is a connector that connects straight to the Smarter Dock and also holds your phone, thus eliminating the need for a separate phone holder.



http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=U73knlvQVSk
If we reach this goal I will make the Smarter Connector available as a perk too.
Let's make this happen!
Thank you for looking at my campaign.  Please take a moment to pledge so we can make this possible.  Tell all your friends about this project as well so we can make it possible.  Lastly, Android is great because of its community. In the comments section share your ideas, apps, and other ways that we can use the Smarter Dock to make our life, well, Smarter.
 If you have questions email me at thesmarterdock@gmail.com, or post in the comments box above, thanks.

RISKS AND CHALLENGES 
Tackling a project like this one is not an easy task. I've been working months already getting things lined up ready to post here on indiegogo. After the project is funded the real work begins. Here is the list of things I need to do:
Fill out application and pay dues to become an HDMI adopter Work with the manufacturer to get items manufactured and shipped to me Put together your rewards and get them to you in a quick matter Start working on the Utility Patent for the Smarter Dock Survive Thanksgiving at the In-Laws (just kidding... haha...)
Working with my manufacturer, here is the timeline after the project is funded: 45 Days lead time for the tooling About 10 weeks for it to get delivered to my door Another week or so for me to get everything sorted and shipped off to you.
Developing a new product is a fun, exciting, interesting, and challenging time. But with patience we can all become a part of something new and amazing. Thanks.

story:
Meet LOCSHARK.

LOCSHARK is a hardware company created around our innovative cell phone case. We want to pick up  where Apple’s “Find My iPhone” left off. The LOCSHARK case allows owners to locate their lost or stolen phone even when the battery has died.

LOCSHARK was co-founded by Armani Williams and Rex Rose in November 2013.  Chad Galvez joined the company in 2015.


LocShark originally began as an iPad case
 

LOCSHARK in the Press

 


 

Meet the Team


LocShark Team (Chad Galvez, Armani Williams and Rex Rose) at Collison Conference in New Orleans

 

Why Indiegogo?

This campaign is important to us because we wanted to make sure we had a large group of devoted followers who are interested in our product before jumping to crowdfunding right away. We could have easily rushed to crowdfunding without having our manufacturing, supply chain, and other things in place.  

We waited to ensure we got the highest quality product at the best price for our customers. In addition, we are planning to sell cases for other devices compatible with androids and tablets.

What We Need

We are planning to sell between 1,000 and 2,000 units initially, but understand that we could sell more based on interest from the public. Whether we reach our goal or not, we will use all money raised to pursue finalization of the prototype and start production.

Allocation of Funds

  • Web App

  • Design and Improvements

  • Production and Tooling

  • Antenna Refinement

  • Firmware Refinement 

  • Certifications- FCC, CE, Bluetooth 

 

FAQs

  1. Can the case be removed?
    No. It's physically locked to the device. Only the user can remove the device by unlocking via our mobile or web app. 
  2. How can the case be tracked?
     LOCSHARK cases can be tracked through the website or mobile app.
  3. Have you partnered with manufacturers who can produce the product?
    We're working closely with large manufacturing and engineering partners to ensure our BOM and specs are correct. We hope to announce them soon. 
  4. How long is the battery life?
    72 hours
  5. Is the case waterproof? 
    Not yet.
  6. Expected Shipping time?
    We plan to begin shipping in February.
  7. What is the material of case?
    Polycarbonate plastic
     

Timeline

 

Risks and Challenges

With any technology startup there are common risks and issues with supply chain, design, delivering on time...

We are confident we will avoid these issues since we have spent an abundant amount of time and energy in building a relationship with our manufacturers and suppliers.

A mature supply chain and a commitment by our partners to deliver the highest quality product possible and on time is what our mutual expectation is.

story:
Lets change the world.

Hey!

We are a small, dedicated and motivated technology start-up located in Melbourne, Australia. Over the few years our sophisticated design and technology team, comprised of people from around the world, has been working hard combining different cultures, experiences, solutions and ideas that has finally culminated in our revolutionary product which is now ready for launch -  PowerTrip.

 

PowerTrip is the worlds first real-time, automated emergency app. Utilising GPS tracking and live video/audio streaming, PowerTrip allows emergency services to locate you in situations when you would otherwise be unable to contact them.

PowerTrip is a revolutionary solution to a problem that cripples every emergency service around the world. When a person is in trouble, only rarely are they in a position to actually call the police.

Many of you will have seen the multitude of products, including mobile apps, which act as “personal alarms” or “emergency alerts”, however they don’t address the actual problem. These other services require users to flick a button, choose a message and press “send”, or call emergency services directly. From our research we found that this was the main issue for people – when they were attacked, there was no time to send the message, or push the button. Almost every time the phone was knocked out of the users hands.

So we decided that was the answer.

PowerTrip removes the need for making selections, typing messages, relaying information or launching messages. When you are in an emergency, and just like a grenade, PowerTrip detonates simply by the user letting go of the phone.

Letting go of the phone, and other actions, called “triggers”, automatically declare an emergency and notify the police.

 

The Button Trigger

Imagine a woman walking home alone at night, or a man walking through a rough neighborhood. It could be someone being approached on a train, in a taxi, or in a side street. It could be waking up in the middle of the night and hearing someone moving around inside your house. You cant call the emergency number (911,999,000) as nothing has happened, but if someone suddenly attacks you, its too late to try and call.  

Now the user simply grabs their phone, and PowerTrip is armed instantly.

If the user removes their hand from the phone (For example, if they are grabbed, punched, pushed, stabbed), the app springs to action:

Alert is sent to police declaring an emergency, including:

  • User Contact information, Current Location, Live Tracking of Location
  • Live video/audio stream of what is happening, stored in the cloud.

 

The Headphone Trigger

Many people use headphones whilst doing exercise, making them the perfect target for assault. Before going for a run, bike ride, or any outdoor activity where you would find yourself alone, users simply arm PowerTrip on their phone before they begin. PowerTrip will then run in the background of their phone, allowing them to continue to listen to music, use fitness apps, make and receive phone calls and check email.

In the event of an attack, users simply rip the headphones from the phone (which usually happens in an attack anyway), and PowerTrip declares an emergency and begins streaming live data to the police, allowing the Police to get to your location quickly.

These are examples of two of the triggers built into version 1 of PowerTrip, with several more in development for version 2.

PowerTrip is a real time emergency beacon that notifies the police as soon as you are in trouble.

In an emergency, such as a fire, or if an ambulance is needed, or if you are witnessing a crime, then calling the police (911,000 etc) works. It is when there is no time, such as if you are being bashed, assaulted, kidnapped, raped or worse, that the PowerTrip automated system can revolutionize how we protect ourselves.

PowerTrip is a revolutionary weapon against attackers in 3 ways:

  • As soon as the attack begins, the police are automatically notified.
  • Showing an attacker that video of the event is streaming live to the police is a huge deterrent to committing a crime.
  • If a crime is committed, video evidence can be used in court against the attacker, even if the phone is destroyed, as the information streams live to our servers where it is stored.

PowerTrip will be released in Melbourne, Australia in September 2013, and will rollout across the rest of Australia by November. It will then begin operating across Europe and the US in December, and is expected to be completed by March 2014.

PowerTrip will be released initially on Android and iOS, and toward September Blackberry and Windows Phone. PowerTrip will cost $4.99/month on a subscription service, or users can purchase 12 months for $49.99.

For the price of a cup of coffee every month, PowerTrip will arm you against attacks.

The App for both operating systems has been designed and specified, as well as the receiving (Police/Emergency Services Telecommunications Authority backend) web interface. The server and database end are specified and tested, and agreements have been made with the relevant parties to introduce the system.

So what do we need the money for?!

We are aiming for a total of $30,000 in funding to bring PowerTrip to the Global market. We are spending $7,500 on completing the coding for the iOS app, and $12,500 on coding the Android App. A further $5,000 (and 2 amazing volunteers!) will be used on converting the Android App to run on Windows Phone and BlackBerry OS. We firmly believe that PowerTrip should be available to everyone, not just those with certain phones, hence the focus on getting each operating system to market as soon as possible, and in as many countries as quickly as possible.

The remaining $5,000 will be used on marketing efforts up to the Australian launch, where (due to the nature of the app!) we have secured free advertising space from local councils, stores, major chains, radio stations and taxis - all the places where people would need the service! The $5,000 will be spent on online advertising - mainly social networks and banner ads to create awareness.

We realize that this is a huge undertaking, both for us, our coders, our liaisons working with the governments and police, and of course you, our backers!

We have come to realize that the most important outcome of this product is not just knowing you will be safe, but that all those round you, from girlfriends and wives to sisters and kids,  are protected when by themselves.

We also realize that without our backers, this system would never launch, and so we hope our perks below give you not only a great deal on the app, but a sense of the appreciation we have, and the wider community you are now helping to protect, of your backing.

Is there any other way of helping PowerTrip launch?

Absolutely - We hope this is not too intrusive, but when PowerTrip launches in your area, we would love to send PowerTrip stickers to you in the mail to stick wherever you think they will be seen by people who will benefit from the App - Maybe on the train, or in the womans bathrooms, or on drinking fountains on a running track - Informing people of this new weapon is our biggest hurdle, and as a supporter, you can help!

So what is the vision for PowerTrip?

Well we would love for PowerTrip to be come a trusted weapon against personal attacks, and so as part our vision of community awareness we will be looking to provide PowerTrip for free to all school children and the elderly. We also realize that creating and maintaining a global security network will be fairly expensive, and so will be looking at selling in PowerTrip with national and multinational corporations for their work force, “Your 5,000 employees will all have access to the PowerTrip network, protecting them on their way to and from work, on the train for $X etc”.

Every country has problems with muggings, assults, rapes etc. The amount varies by country, by state, by city and by suburb, and existing methods do nothing to protect you in an emergency, and more importantly do nothing to make people feel safe. 

To feel safe, people can carry anything from pepper spray and whistles to knives and guns. But they can be used against you. Especially if there is more then one attacker, or they take you by surprise. PowerTrip is designed from the ground up to activate when you are taken by surprise, and no matter how many attackers, records their voices and films their faces, while at the same time directing police to your location.

The goal of PowerTrip is not to be a "scare" tool, but an empowerment tool.

 

Thank you, and hope to work with you all soon!

The PowerTrip team –

Nina, Trav, Andrew, Simon, Lydia, Tina, Dave, Tiere, Ev, Andy, Zandi and Adam.

Thank you, and hope to work with you all soon!
The PowerTrip team –
Nina, Trav, Andrew, Simon, Lydia, Tina, Dave, Tiere, Ev, Andy, Zandi and Adam.

story:
"I’d like to see these guys get off the ground, wouldn’t you?"

"Le nuove idee sono sempre molto interessanti e piacevoli, sopratutto se sono figlie del nostro Paese e sviluppate in modo buono sia a livello qualitativo che di design e materiali."

 

"...poter avere sul Galaxy S un vero e proprio Flash Led? tutto questo potrebbe essere possibile grazie a COVERLIGHT..."

 

"...di certo ci aspettiamo davvero tanto da questa innovazione, che farà di certo piacere a molti che posseggono ancora il Galaxy S..."

 

"...finalmente qualcuno ha risolto l’unico difetto di questo Smartphone."

 

 

"Grazie a Coverlight potrete finalmente scattare foto notturne o utilizzare il vostro smartphone come torcia quando non trovate le chiavi..."

 

 

  "...finalmente arriva l’accessorio che tutti i possessori di Samsung Galaxy S hanno sempre desiderato..."

 

***versione italiana in fondo (scroll down for italian version)***

 

Samsung Galaxy S battery cover with built-in LED Flash

 

If you tried to take pictures in low light situations with a smartphone like the Galaxy S, you might have noticed how poor the outcome is. This is because this smartphone doesn't have a built-in LED flash.

For this reason we designed COVERLIGHT. Easy to assemble, simple to use and with a stylish design. Say goodbye to dark pictures!

The above video will show you how COVERLIGHT dramatically enhance the picture quality in different situations. With COVERLIGHT you will now able to take pictures and make videos whenever you want (for example during a night spent clubbing with your friends or capturing the moment when someone you love blows all the candles on his/her birthday cake).

WHAT IS

Samsung Galaxy S has a 5MP camera which takes good pictures, has the autofocus function, but... it lacks a LED flash.
COVERLIGHT simply makes up for the lack of LED flash.

 

HOW IT'S MADE

COVERLIGHT is entirely made in Italy, and consists of a high-quality polycarbonate battery cover and an electric circuit with a 1Watt hi power LED Flash. The high-quality fittings make COVERLIGHT the ideal solution for all those who own a Galaxy S and want to take pictures and make videos whenever they want and in every light conditions.

 

HOW IT WORKS

In order to start using COVERLIGHT you simply have to remove your Galaxy S battery cover, remove the battery and apply the electrically conductive adhesive. Now you have to put COVERLIGHT battery cover in place. When you press the button next to the speaker hole, the LED Flash will light up.
The button position has been designed for both portrait and landscape mode.

 

COVERLIGHT is available in 3 different colours: black, white and green (indiegogo special edition)

PICTURES COMPARISON

Pictures taken with Galaxy S plus I9001 (original unedited photos)

 

Pictures taken with Galaxy S plus i9001 (original unedited photos)

 

 Pictures taken with Galaxy S plus i9001 (original unedited photos)

 

ENHANCE THE SPEAKER SOUND

The 2-mm bump, where the LED flash lies, avoid the typical muffled sound when you put the smartphone on a plain surface.

WHERE WE'RE AT

We have worked for 6 months to design COVERLIGHT, develop prototypes and test the materials and design in order to get a reliable and solid product, which is completely different from the most common imported battery covers. We remind you that both the materials and electric circuits are made in italy.
Now we are  reay to bring COVERLIGHT to market. What  follows is a timeline for the project and a summary of where your funds will go:

We expect the first shippings to take place in early February 2013. In the meantime, we will keep you up to date on our progress and will be ready to answer your questions or accept any suggestions from you.

COVERLIGHT FOR OTHER DEVICES

We have decided to start with the Galaxy S device since it is one of the most widespread and successful smartphones on the market over the last few years. This is why we think we have more chances to reach our target.


*** Should you have any suggestions about developing COVERLIGHT for other devices, please send your ideas to info@eledment.com. Once we reach our target, we would develop COVERLIGHT also for other devices. ***

 

COMPATIBLE MODELS

COVERLIGHT is compatible with:
Samsung Galaxy S GT-I9000
Samsung Galaxy S GT-I9001
Samsung Vibrant Galaxy S SGH-T959
Samsung Galaxy S 4G SGH-T959V

 

Click the Facebook LIKE button and Twitter TWEET button right under the video, and share with your friends, family and colleagues. In this way you potentially allow anyone with a Galaxy S to get to know this item. THANK YOU

 

music credit: Brian Boyko

 

Cover per Samsung Galaxy S i9000 ed S Plus 19001 con Flash LED integrato

Se hai uno smartphone come il galaxy s e hai provato a fare foto in condizioni di scarsa luminosità, probabilmente avrai notato come la mancanza di un led flash non permette di fare foto o di girare video. Questo perchè questo smartphone non ha un Flash LED.

Per questo motivo abbiamo progettato COVERLIGHT. veloce da montare, semplice da usare, e bello da guardare.

Il video mostra come COVERLIGHT aumenta notevolmente la qualità delle foto in differenti situazioni. Con COVERLIGHT potrai scattare foto e girare video ovunque vuoi.

Cos'è

Il Samsung Galaxy s i9001 (ed il suo fratello minore i9000) hanno una fotocamera da 5.0 megapixel: fa buoni scatti, ha l'autofocus, ma non il flash led... COVERLIGHT completa la dotazione hardware di questo smartphone.

 

Come è fatto

COVERLIGHT è interamente costruito in Italia, e consiste in una cover in policarbonato di alta qualità ed un circuito elettronico con un potente flash da 1 watt. L'elevata qualità dei materiali e delle rifiniture rendono COVERLIGHT la soluzione ideale per tutti i possessori di un Galaxy S che vogliono scattare foto e girare video ovunque vogliano, anche in condizioni di scarsa luminosità.

 

Come funziona

Per iniziare ad utilizzare il Flash LED, occorre semplicemente sostituire la cover originale con COVERLIGHT, dopo aver applicato il contatto elettrico adesivo ai contatti per la batteria del telefono (guarda il video). Ora premendo il pulsante accanto al foro dell'altoparlante il LED si illuminerà.

La posizione del pulsante è stata progettata per l'utilizzo sia vetricale che orizzontale.

 

COVERLIGHT è disponibile in 3 colori: nero, bianco e verde (in edizione speciale su Indiegogo)

Confronto foto

Foto scattate con Galaxy S Plus I9001 (foto originali non ritoccate)

 

Foto scattate con Galaxy S Plus I9001 (foto originali non ritoccate)

 

Foto scattate con Galaxy S Plus I9001 (foto originali non ritoccate)

 

Migliore qualità audio

Il rialzo di 2mm del LED solleva lo smartphone ed evita il tipico problema del soffocamento dell'audio quando poggiamo il dispositivo su una superficie piana.

A che punto siamo:

Abbiamo lavorato per 6 mesi allo sviluppo di COVERLIGHT, realizzando protopipi e testando i materiali al fine di ottenere un prodotto solido ed affidabile, completamente differente dalle comuni cover importate. Ricordiamo che sia la cover che i circuiti elettronici sono prodotti in Italia.

Ora siamo pronti a lanciare COVERLIGHT nel mercato. Qui di seguito una linea temporale del progetto ed un riepilogo di come verranno utilizzati i fondi raccolti:

Prevediamo di iniziare le spedizioni i primi di Febbraio 2013. Nel frattempo vi aggiorneremo sui progressi e saremo a disposizione per rispondere alle vostre domande e/o accettare i vostri suggerimenti.

COVERLIGHT per altri dispositivi

abbiamo pensato di iniziare la produzione di COVERLIGHT con il modello Samsung Galaxy S i9000 / i9001 e le sue varianti estere Vibrant / 4G, in quanto questo smartphone è stato (e ancora è) uno dei terminali più riusciti e diffusi negli ultimi anni ed abbiamo più probabilità di raggiungere il nostro obiettivo.


***** se avete segnalazioni di modelli a cui possiamo dedicare la nostra attenzione segnalatelo con un commento o una mail a info@eledment.com, raggiunto l'obiettivo svilupperemo COVERLIGHT per altri terminali *****

 

Clicca sul bottoneMI PIACEdi Facebook eTWITTAsu Twitter sotto al video, e condividi questo progetto con amici, familiari e colleghi. In questo modo potremo consentire a chiunque possegga un Galaxy S di conoscere questo prodotto. GRAZIE

 

music credit: Brian Boyko

story:
People across the world wear ties to work and other events. Until now, the necktie has rarely been more than decorative (except in maybe MacGyver's case). Tommies Ties are fashionable handmade neckties that double as a screen or glasses cleaner. We have carefully selected suppliers that work with other well-known, high-end fashion brands. We will be producing our ties from 100% pure silk with ultra high-quality microfiber professionally sewn into the lining.

Rather than untucking your dress shirt to wipe your screen or glasses with a soft undershirt, help us make these ties with microfiber specifically intended to clean delicate glass. Reaching our goal will enable us to produce these ties and expand to other designs. 

We have already ordered the blue Father's Day tie, which will be delivered in time for gifting. All other ties are expected to be delivered by July.

5 STYLES OF TIES

story:
Most active WIN SCANCASE XXL EVERYDAY or new IPAD MINI at the end of the campaign.

  1. LOG-IN&GO TO OUR CAMPAIGN
  2. COPY YOUR UNIQUE LINK
  3. SHARE AND WIN

Make sure you use your unique link which can be found under our video and contains a 7-digit number at the end of the link. Person, who sends the most referrals to our Indiegogo campaign website each day, win Scancase XXL every day. Most active of you will get New iPad mini at the end of the campaign.


What is ScanCase?

Scancase is an easy to use, affordable and unbelievably portable scanning box that uses your smartphone's or tablet´s camera to take amazing high quality scans. It's easy to set up and packs down flat to easily fit into your bag, brief case or just in your hand.

                     Scancase XXL                                          Scancase Basic 


Do i need it?

Well, if you find yourself often needing to scan a photo, document or even receipts. Doing live presentations or web meeting with your biz partners but don't want to take up valuable bench space with a clunky old scanner or use crappy old fashioned software to do a simple document scan and email out then Scancase is for you. 

Scancase has been designed to optimize nearly all lighting conditions so your scans always look great. 

Where can i use it?

Scancase in  office:

  • Use it as photocopier
  • Use it as scanner

Scancase in school and university:

  • Use it as live presentation tool for your classes, your students would love it
  • Use it as powerful method to get all your classmates focused on your live presentation
  • Share your homeworks or notes with your mates pretty easily

Scancase your business:

  • Do your presentation for your partners easily and everywhere
  • Do your business more valuable and powerful
  • Use it as lightroom for your products

Scancase at home:

  • Do digitalization of your old photos quick and effective
  • Store your receipts or documents on your computer or cloud
  • Make photos from your children last longer 

Scancase simply everywhere:

  • In bars
  • At the airports
  • On train
  • In the park or street


    Scancase is also unbelievable portable. It packs down flat to fit in your bag and is practically indestructible. When you want to use it simply unfold and let the high powered magnetic tape to hold it together for you.

Can i use it with my smartphone or tablet?

Yes, you scan. Scancase your documents, photos and 3D objects or even do the live presentations using this magical product.

Scancase fits to every smartphone or tablet on the market.

To additional information check FAQ below.

What everything i can do?

Scancase Documents, receipts or cards

  • Powerful tool for everyone to get good looking scans or photocopies
  • Suitable for every person on the planet
  • Easy use your smartphone or tablet, store it as a picture, email it or use wifi enabled printers to print it out.

Scancase 3D objects or pictures

  • Great thing for all old photo lovers or product sellers. Make your old photos look gorgeous and send it to your family or friends.
  • Sell your products easily, using great looking pictures of your products (Ebay, Amazon,...).

Scancase Live presentations or WEB meetings

  • Simply create great presentation in every enviroment using your phone or tablet.
  • Share your ideas and be more effective on your meetings with your business partners or collegues.

Scan in a SECOND

Scan in 5 seconds!

Scancase design and construction was made in accordance with japanes techniques SMED which are used by TOYOTA. It made scancase really simple and easy to built up or fold. Estimated time for builting up from 0 to Scan is 5 seconds. This is making Scancase fastest scanner in the world.

Scancase with your TABLET

To make scancase properly working with your tablet you need to use TABLET PORT.

This really flat equipment holds with super strong magnets and it is attached and assembled really easily. Tablet port fits your scancase when is folded down. 



Scancase has ACTIVE LIGHT

Scancase is using LED lights to increase quality of photos and scans you´re taking.

12 super white colour LED lights are making Scancase suitable for every enviroment.

Active light makes your photos without any shadows that may appear depending on the natural light direction and you can use it in complete dark enviroment as well.

Active Light make inside Scancase enviroment with 120 lux which is pretty cool.

LED used in automotive industry is powered by BYO 9V battery.

Scancase is thin, light and durable

Scancase is made from the most durable materials which are making him still flat, thin and easy to carry.

Materials and production

To bring our ideas to life we need to produce at least 1000 pcs of these amazing SCANCASEs. Our product is using special durable cardboard which is 3 times laminated, powerful magnetic tapes, LED lights which are used in automotive industry.

Scancase is using technologies such as offset printing and die cutting, which are expensive but needed to get best quality products.

All the production is made in European union.

.

Thank´s for your support!


Anything else?

There are numerous smartphone applications that will significantly increase the functionality of your Scancase. They allow you to do OCR scans, scan directly to PDF, create multi-pages documents and upload directly to Google Docs. Check the Appstore or Google Play Store.


FAQ

What is the difference between Scancase BASIC, L, XL or XXL?

Scancase BASIC - scancase for your smartphone 

Scancase L - scancase for your smartphone with Active Light for better scans & photos

Scancase XL - Scancase BASIC with Tablet PORT for scanning with your tablet

Scancase XXL - Scancase XL with Active Light for your smartphone or tablet

How big is Scancase?

Scancase is big as A4/US letter envelope. Fits pretty much to all cases. Is just 0.6 cm / 0.3 inches thin and 500g light.

How about postage?

In the price for scancase is worldwide postage included.

Contact us for postages for 10 or more products, we will give you better shipping price.

What device does the Scancase work with? 

Scancase is optimized to work with smartphones & tablets especially the iPhone 5S/5C/5, Galaxy S4/S3. But it works just as well with any device that has a camera.

How do i use my Scancase as a live projector for presentations or web meetings?

If you have an iPhone and Apple TV your already set up via "Airplay" which lets you mirror exactly what’s on your mobile display to the big screen. If you have a Samsung Galaxy phone you can use "AllShare Play" to do the same thing. For more information check out http://www.apple.com/ and http://www.samsung.com/

There are many other free apps on Appstore or Google play store which you can use with your smartphone or tablet such as SKYPE or WEBCAM.

How do i use Scancase as a photocopier?

Apple devices have a great function called "AirPrint", which allows you to wirelessly print to any AirPrint-enabled printer. There are many available from HP, Epson, and Canon. Just visit the Apple Online Store or view a list of AirPrint-enabled printers and find one that’s right for you.

There is also an application for the Mac called Printopia which turns most printers connected to a Mac into an AirPrint enabled printer.

http://www.ecamm.com/mac/printopia/

Legal Stuff

iPad, iPhone and Samsung, Apple logo and Apple are registered trademarks of Apple Inc. and are not affiliated with our product in any way.


For any kind of information please contact us on scancase@outlook.com
